text: Member States could be invited to submit written inputs which would be synthesized into an Outcome document with a zero draft to be ready for circulation well ahead of the report back meeting on 15 December 2025.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: This approach would reduce the need for multiple physical meetings during the peak of Committee work, thereby easing the burden on smaller delegations.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Further, we propose that the roadmap includes a provision for three interactive dialogue sessions between January and March 2026.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: These sessions could be utilized as consultative sessions with the objective of finalizing the outcome document.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Additionally, Zimbabwe envisages the adoption of a resolution endorsing this outcome document before the conclusion of the 80th session.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We welcome the commitment by the Secretariat to support Member states in implementing WE Extreme 2 and encourage the Secretary General to regularly update Member States on the progress in the activities outlined in the Report that are within its authority and we thank Mr.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Guy Ryder for that reassurance.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Let us therefore utilize this opportunity to work together towards a mandate in implementation review process which culminates in an agile fit for purpose United nations capable of effectively and efficiently responding to the world's pressing challenges.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I wish to assure you coaches of Zimbabwe's constructive participation during deliberations.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Zimbabwe.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I give the floor now to the distinguished representative of Trinidad and Tobago who will be followed by U Uruguay

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: thank you Chair firstly, congratulations to both of you Chair on your ascension to your respective co Chair positions.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Chair Trinidad and Tobago aligns itself with the statement delivered by Belize on behalf of CARICOM and the statement delivered by Iraq on behalf of the group of 77 as well as the statement delivered by Palau on behalf of oasis.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Trinidad and Tobago wishes to highlight the need to commit ourselves to a process that is open, transparent and accessible by all, ensuring primacy, recency and accessibility in addition to transparency of all documents and ensure whatever we embark upon can be tracked and measured, knowing fully well, Chair that what gets measured gets done, what gets measured gets improved.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Also, Chair ensure practical reconciliation and consolidation of mandates, the outcome of which can be appropriately aligned and matched to the requisite resources, if so required, to ensure that the follow up mechanism of these mandates can be optimally operationalized.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Finally, Chair, I wish to remind my colleagues and all of us that this process can be at times challenging, perhaps to match the challenging times that we face requiring patience, commitment, communication, trust and transparency in the conduct of our business.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I wish to reiterate Trinidad and Tobago is committed to retooling, reforming and renewing our organization and we stand ready to roll up our sleeves in this regard.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We look forward to a better, stronger and smarter, more agile un.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: So said.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you Chair

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Trinidad and Tobago.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Give the floor now to the distinguished representative of Uruguay who will be followed by Kuwait and then the final speaker will be Chile.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Muches.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: So co Chairs, thank you to the USG Guide writer as well.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We align Uruguay aligns itself to the G77 and China statement as well as the Small States Group Declaration today.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: And we are also of the view of the of the need for informed decisions, evidence based decision and we also value the work on the role of the Secretariat in in providing extra additional information on for example actual duplications of mandates where we can rationalize the agenda.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We need this listening mode or consultative mode at the beginning be it in thematic cluster sessions or also at a certain point the cross sectoral also view because the three pillars as we know all know are equally important and are interdependent and they all enrich the others.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We we don't want the as it also was said by several colleagues, the cherry picking, forgetting some of them.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: It's not the opportunity to for regressions or for polarization.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: This is what we want to avoid at this point.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: If we want efficiencies and effectiveness, we need to look for synergies and the synergies of the three pillars.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: There are some permanent interests of the United nations like it is the human rights and fundamental freedoms which cannot simply have a sunset close.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Just to put an example, probably some others very sensitive and political issues which are pending of solution cannot be subject to a sunset clause either because it signals something that there's something to be done yet.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: So no automatisms are needed.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Yes, we need some rationalization and we heard several concrete proposals and we are going to participate in a very constructive way the impact on the ground which very much is needed.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We value all of them from the guidance, the simple guidance, the sharing of best practices.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Everything really is an impact on the ground.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: And so we need to look for those type of results.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Uruguay.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I give the floor now to the distinguished representative of Kuwait and then Chile.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you, Mr.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Chair. Madam President, Excellencies and distinguished colleagues.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I have the honor to deliver this statement on behalf of the member States of the Gulf Cooperation Council gcc, the Kingdom of Bahrain, the Sultan of Oman, the State of Qatar, the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the the United Arab Emirates and my own country, the State of Kuwait.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: The GCC aligns itself with the statement delivered by the Republic of Iraq on behalf of the group of 77 in China.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: @ the outset of our statement we express our gratitude for convening the first meeting of the informal Ad Hoc Working group on the UN 80 initiative and the remarks of Her Excellency Annelina Baerbock, President of the General Assembly.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: The GCC extends its sincere congratulations to Her Excellency Ambassador Carolyn Schwalger, Permanent Representative of New Zealand and to His Excellency Ambassador Brian Wallace, Permanent Representative of Jamaica, on appointment as co facilitators for the IAHWG on the UN80 initiative.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: And we affirm support for their efforts in fulfilling the task ahead.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Madam Chair, the GCC emphasizes the importance of focusing the efforts of the Informal Working Group on strengthening multilateralism and ensuring the full and effective participation of all Member States with adherence to the principles established in the United Nations Charter, particularly those related to preserving the effectiveness and its pivotal role of the United Nations.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: The Group also stresses the importance of taking into account the bustling schedule of the United nations when setting the timeline of work of the IHWG and provide ample time and sufficient means to ensure effective participation by all Member States in in its work in order to ensure its effectiveness.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: On this note, the GCC supports the proposal submitted by the Group of 77 in China to establish a detailed work plan for the informal Working Group.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We further recommend that the subject of each meeting be clearly specified in advance to facilitate the effective management of Member States.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: The GCC also underscores the importance of adhering to the principles of transparency and inclusivity throughout the upcoming deliberations, with a view to ensuring a successful outcome of the mandate implementation review Under Work Stream 2 and with the overarching objective of fostering a United nations that is fit for purpose and equipped to address both present and future challenges.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: In conclusion, the GCC affirms its readiness to support the work of the informal Ad Hoc Working Group to ensure the delivery of its mandate.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We take this opportunity to emphasize the need to approach this process with a constructive, comprehensive and pragmatic approach that takes into account the interests of all Member States without exception.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Please allow me to thank the distinguished representative of Kuwait, especially for their grace and for their flexibility in accommodating the lack of translation and the miscommunication that led to that.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: So, thank you so much.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I now give the floor to the final speaker for today's meeting, the distinguished representative of Chile.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Co Chairs, allow me to congratulate you on your appointment to this important position.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I wish you every success in your future deliberations.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We align ourselves with the statement delivered by Iraq on behalf of the group of 77 and China as a contribution to the discussion on the way forward.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: In pursuing the objectives of this ad hoc working group, our delegation would like to offer the following suggestions.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: First, that our work, at least in its initial stage, remain firmly guided by the report of the Secretary General and its recommendations.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: This report, the result of a significant effort, should not be disregarded.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Rather, it must serve as the starting point for the endeavors we will undertake in the months ahead.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Second, that the work aimed at formulating a framework for future mandates be organized around the three key steps of the mandate Life cycle, creation, delivery and review.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Structuring our discussions in this manner would allow for a more effective and focused process than, for example, addressing all of the Secretary General's recommendations at once.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Third, that the Secretary General's recommendations on each of these key steps served as the foundation of our deliberations, asking, when needed, the support from the Secretariat to share deeper analysis and that our discussions remain centered on them while allowing space for potential new additional proposals from member states.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: In conclusion, I would like to reiterate our support for the co chairs and reaffirm Chile's CO commitment to engaging constructively in the work of these working groups.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Chile colleagues.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Before I hand back to my co chair for some closing remarks and to close the meeting, I just wanted to say how optimistic I am that we have been able to begin this process with such a hopeful tone.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I think it augurs well for the process that we embark on from here.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: And, and let me just take this opportunity to wish you all a successful high level week.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I hope you get some rest this weekend.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you, Ambassador Wallace. Well, I agree.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: I think we've had an immensely thoughtful exchange today.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We know there's complexity to these issues and I think we've seen that in your interventions.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: But I also feel that we've had a really genuine sign of commitment by all of you to both this process, but also to the broader strengthening of the organisation.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: On behalf of.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We're going to be informal, right?

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: On behalf of Brian and I really like to thank all of the delegations for the constructive spirit which you have engaged in this morning.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We did hear a range of people perspectives and we acknowledge that we need to think about that as we think about how we guide our collective work and how we move forward to, I guess, chart the next steps in front of us.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We will remain in close contact with you.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Communication will be key throughout this process and we really do hope that you will continue to participate at the highest level possible so that we can can get through the work of this group in a meaningful way that leads to a more stronger and effective and efficient United Nations.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: We will advise you of our next meeting of the informal ad hoc working group.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: The date is still to be announced, but be assured that we will be very mindful of the thinking that you have all shared with us today about the importance for a clear work process program and also one deconflicted to the extent possible with the main committees.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: So we will circulate a letter to you in due course.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Once again, thank you to the PGA team.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you very much to Under Secretary General Guy Rider.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you very much to the Secretariat for all your support in getting us ready in a short period of time.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Thank you to all the delegations who participated today.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: And thank you so much to the teams from Jamaica and New Zealand who've put in so much hard work to get us here in such a short amount of time.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: Happy high level week, everybody.

session_title: First meeting of the working group
text: The meeting is adjourned.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Good morning, everybody.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I call to order the informal meeting of the Working Group to hear a technical briefing on mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: On behalf of Ambassador Wallace, I warmly welcome all of you to this technical briefing.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We recognize the presence of Ms. Ayaka Suzuki, Director in the Executive Office of the secretary general, and Mr. Christophe Monnier, director of the Program Planning and Budget Division in the Department of Management, Strategy, Policy and Compliance, as well as Her Excellency Ms. Maritza Tan, Permanent Representative of Costa Rica, and Ms. Min Thu Pham, Founder and CEO of Project Starling.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Colleagues, we have an important task ahead of us.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The UN is at a critical juncture.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The UN 80 initiative provides a unique opportunity to build a UN that is more effective, efficient, accountable and capable of responding to contemporary needs.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This informal ad hoc working group provides the mechanism for us as Member States, to be constructively engaged in the effort to strengthen the ability of this organisation to deliver concrete outcomes for the people of the planet as envisaged in the Charter.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We encourage Member States to seize this opportunity as the first intergovernmental process launched under the UN80 initiative.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The this informal ad hoc working group has a particular responsibility to build trust and mutual understanding and to demonstrate that concrete progress can be made on reforms that can strengthen this organisation and improve the effectiveness, efficiency and impact of its work, as outlined in our letter.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: On the 7th of October we will begin our work with a Discovery phase.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This will include consultations among Working Group members and, subject to the interest of Working Group members, research and analysis to ensure our consultations are informed by empirical evidence and data.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Today's briefing marks the start of this Discovery phase and will run until mid December.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It is the first of three shorts executive level briefings, each of which will focus on one of the three stages of the mandate life cycle creation, implementation and review.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The briefings will provide an opportunity for senior leaders to consider the recommendations under each section of the Secretary General's report on the Mandate Implementation Review, which was published on 31 July in more detail.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The briefing also provides you with an opportunity to consider other ideas and perspectives and to ask questions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Each technical briefing will then be followed by consultations on the same topic about a week later.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: At the consultation, Working Group members will have the opportunity to hear responses to the questions posed at the briefing sessions, convey their views on the recommendations provided in the Secretary General's report or by the briefers, and importantly, put forward their own ideas and proposals for consideration.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Today's briefing will focus on the topic of mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have invited four briefers to speak on this topic, each has been selected for their depth of knowledge and insights on mandate creation, with each offering different perspectives for our consideration.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Like all of us here today, they are invested in the effective functioning of the un.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Following their presentations, there will be an opportunity for Working Group members to ask questions of our briefers.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As noted in our letters of 7 and the 10October, we remind colleagues that today's session is focused on providing Working Group members with information.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We welcome members wishing to deliver statements outlining their perspectives and proposals on mandate creation, to do so at the consultations scheduled for 23rd of October.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I now give the floor to my Co Chair, Ambassador Wallace.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much, Co Chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we will move immediately into the work for today.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I will therefore give the floor to Mr. Ayaka Suzuki, Director in the Executive Office of the Secretary General, to brief the Working Group on current practice exercised in the creation of mandates and to provide an elaboration on the recommendations contained in the Secretary General's report on mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I also invite her to update the Working Group on progress in taking forward the recommendations in the report that lie within the Secretary General's existing authority as Chief Administrative Officer and what further support the Secretariat may be able to provide to Member States when creating mandates, including access to data and analysis.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mr. Zukey, I give you the floor.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much, madam.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Co chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mr. Co chair, good afternoon, or good morning rather.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Excellency and Distinguished Delegates, thank you so much to the Co Chairs for inviting us to deliver a briefing today.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's a great pleasure to be here.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So today we will walk through key insights and suggestions from the Mandate Implementation Review Report which was issued on 31st of July.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And the focus today, as mentioned by the Co Chairs, is the creation phase, where mandates are made and how better visibility, design and stronger collaboration and enhanced support could improve delivery of mandates with a bigger impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: With this presentation, my team and I hope to contribute to a shared understanding of this process.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So first, let us just recall from the report that every mandate has a life cycle.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If you could advance to the next slide, that would be great.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So creation, delivery and review, ideally connected via feedback.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: When mandate creation is clear and coordinated, delivery improves and review produces learning that in turn improves the next iteration of the mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Based on the insight in the report, our goal is structure, strengthening our support to you in that first step so that the whole system can perform better.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So before I dive in, let me answer a simple question.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How would one define a mandate in simple terms?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And for the purpose of the report, we're treating a mandate as a request or directive for action written in the operative paragraphs of of a resolution or decision adopted by mandating organs such as the General Assembly.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It is the instruction that tells the United nations or other implementing entities that Member States have asked it to do.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This slide shows how a resolution might translate into mandates and results so for example, in resolution General assembly resolution on the pattern of conferences, which was adopted in December 2023, which is the mandate source, contains a request to the Secretary General to produce a report on conferences.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This report needs to be planned and budgeted in the program budget.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Post and non post.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Resources need to be approved so that the requested report can be prepared.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Ideally, the report is delivered on time and has data to support your review of our performance and informed decisions on how to improve is a simple chain Decisions, Mandates, Actions and results for Mandate creation the report identifies limited visibility as a key challenge which is the situation today across the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mandates originate from many bodies, not just the main organs of the United nations, but also mandating organs of specialized agencies or related organizations.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Since 1946, more than 40,000 resolutions have been adopted in the General Assembly, Security Council, ecosoc and Human Rights Council alone.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: However, most bodies lack straightforward and up to date registries, let alone a registry that looks across all of these bodies.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That increases the risk of unintended duplication and overlap.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The review therefore recommends building comprehensive registries and strengthening coordination among secretariats that are supporting these governing bodies.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In short, visibility matters because it is hard to manage better what is hard to see.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So to start closing that visibility gap, we have launched mandates.un.org which was launched, as you may recall, in conjunction with the release of the Mandate Implementation Review Report.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This site compiles the source documents the UN entities cite when explaining why their programs exist and why they need resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You can search by entity, mandating organ or subject, and quickly see links between mandate sources and proposed programs.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It is interactive and we encourage everyone who have not tried this to explore it.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: New features are also regularly added.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I personally find this to be a very exciting new tool.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Here is a concrete example to see what you might find when you use this tool.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Youth.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You can see how the same subject of Youth appears in 48 resolutions or decisions across eight different bodies the General Assembly, ECOSOC, Security Council, Human Rights Council, and so on.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Some 30 UN entities cited these sources 128 times in support of programs proposed for 2026.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Sometimes it's helpful, sometimes it may be duplicative and may include extra reporting.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Using this tool, mandates un.org we can immediately trace potential overlaps and their sources.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As I said, everything's interactive and you could click and it links you to necessary documents later.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Ambassador Schwalger, we talked about disability.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have an example of that as well, and we can take a look at that.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So visibility is only the first part.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The design of mandate shapes how well they can be delivered.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And here three challenges stand out.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Longer text resolutions are getting lengthier and more complex.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: More prescriptive wording, which leads to less flexibility for implementation and tasking within existing resources without reducing previously mandated tasks, is becoming more frequent.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And it's now appearing more often than even budget is, even as budgets decline.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So the report proposes four potential remedies.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First, better secretariat support during drafting.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Second, AI tools that can help flag potential duplications or complementarities.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Third, mandates framed so that the Secretary General can allocate the task to those with the best comparative advantages.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And fourth, avoiding new tasks without corresponding resources or reduction in tasks.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The message here is clarity, flexibility and practicality.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: These are what make mandates deliverable.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Now, creating better mandates is a shared responsibility.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In simple terms, it takes people, guidance and tools that we have summarized on this slide.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: People capacity, the Technical Secretariat, subject matter experts and training or tools to support efficient drafting, guidance and frameworks to help negotiators craft better processes and language on mandated activities, entities and resource implications.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Data and AI tools, registries and drafting modules that flag overlap before it happens.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Together, we believe these elements can form the basis of renewed collaboration between all of us.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So let me end with three key takeaways.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First, visibility matters.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: More accessible information prevents duplication and improves coordination.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Second, design drives delivery more concise, clear, properly resourced mandates achieve real impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Third, enhanced support, stronger people guidance technology and support to assist your work.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Our next briefing in the next iteration of this series will go deeper into delivery and resources resourcing.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But for today, our core message is simple.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And again, this is for the creation phase of the mandate life cycle.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Visibility leads to better design leads to stronger delivery equals greater impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you and I look forward to your questions and reflections.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And thank you for giving me the opportunity.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Co Chairs thank you so much, Ms. Suzuki, and to your team for preparing such an interesting and informative presentation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I now give the floor to Mr. Christophe Monnier, Director of the Program Planning and Budget Division in the Department of Management, Strategy, Planning, Policy and Compliance, to brief the Working Group on the relationship between mandate creation and the UN budget process, including how it currently works and how it might be improved.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Christoph thank you, Ambassador Wallace.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And thanks to Ambassador Schrager and Ambassador Wallace, the co Chair of the Working Group, for having us today and giving us this opportunity of the briefing on the I'll pass a few moments to explain a few concepts and then discuss a bit more on the budget part.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So on the Legislative framework, the purpose of this slide is to explain how we define a mandate in a budget context and link it to the budget process.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So legislative mandate as indicated by my colleague Ayaka is a request for action that is addressed to the Secretary General on Executive Head, acting on his behalf in a resolution or decision adopted by a competent United nations intergovernmental organ.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And this is governed by the policy document we call PPBME that has a very long name you see on this slide.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The budget themselves are also driven by such requests for action and the Rule 153 of the Rules of Procedure of the General assembly provides two checkpoints to ensure that Member States are fully aware of the resulting resource requirements, one before a resolution is recommended for approval by a Committee and a second checkpoint before approval by the General assembly following a review by the ACABQ and the Fifth Committee.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Now how are budget derived from resolution and decisions?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The resolutions or decisions I'll be speaking only about resolution for simplification, but I always mean both are what drives the results based budget containing the program plan and the resource proposals.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In a resolution we typically have two aspects the preambler paragraphs which express the background, sentiment and concern of Member States and the operative paragraph that provide guidance and mandates for the Secretariat or other stakeholders.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The concerns expressed in the preambler paragraph help the Secretariat to formulate a long term objective which reflects the desire and State to address the needs of Member States and the operative paragraphs contain the mandates for the Secretariat to determine the deliverable and output which the Secretariat is expected to produce in order to contribute to the collective achievement of the objective.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The strategy is what links the both and is the plan approach to produce the mandated deliverable to meet the needs of Member States and most effectively contribute to the long term objective.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: On the left side you see the performance measures that are there to demonstrate the progress made, while on the right hand side the inputs on the purple box are the budgetary resources that are required to fund the activities undertaken by the Secretariat to produce the mandated deliverables.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So we now focus on those budgetary resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You've heard us talk about program budget implications.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Those are linked to a resolution that indicates that resource that has implications resource implication so a pbi, how we call it is prepared in response to a draft resolution with mandate to the Secretariat to conduct new or expanded activities.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It is communicated to Member States prior to the adoption of of a draft resolution and is then later issued as a supplementary budget to request additional resources to implement mandates not included in the current approved budget or proposed budget.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: After that, it's considered by the ACABQ and then the Fifth Committee before being approved through a formal decision of the General Assembly.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Alongside approval of the resolution, we have a different format for PBIS called Oral Statement.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Those are used instead of a PBI when we have three situations.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Either the resource implications are not yet known and are pending future decision by Member States, for example, if the format and location of a new meeting or conference is still to be defined if the frequency or size of a new report is also to be defined.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The second case is when the resource implications are known but will be communicated in a subsequent revised estimate, possibly grouping several program budget implications.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is how, for example, we proceed with PBIS resulting from ECOSOC decisions or from the Human Rights Council.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The third situation is when resource implication relates to a future proposed program budget not yet issued by the Secretary General.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The resource implication will be proposed in the relevant future proposed program budget, for example, if anything is done today with an impact on 2027 or later, because those are not yet proposed program budget.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Now if we look at the budgetary implications are clearly directly influenced by nuances in the language used in the resolution.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Without fully getting into the details of this slide, I wanted to mention how the language of the operative paragraph of a resolution drives the understanding by the Secretariat of the intent of Member States to be interpreted as having potential budgetary implications.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The resolution must contain a binding request for action and require new or expanded activities.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In the interest of time, I will not develop further at this stage, but I would like to highlight the need to ensure the mandate creation process makes the intent of Member States very clear.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: To warrant the implementation by the Secretariat or the UN system corresponds to the expectations on the aspect of costing resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I'd like to mention that upon reviewing a draft resolution, the Secretariat conducts an internal review to determine the workload related to the required activities and whether these activities can be absorbed within existing resources or what additional resources will be required.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The tool presented by my colleague Ayaka would be instrumental in helping both Member States and the Secretariat identifying connections, synergies or potential duplication with existing deliverables and activities.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Technically, the use of the expression within existing resource in the draft resolution of the Main Committee does not preclude budgetary implication if the Secretariat assesses that the delivery of those additional mandated activity cannot be absorbed within existing resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I know that the use of the expression has become more frequent over the years and is quite unpopular amongst my colleagues.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I feel, however, that it could be a good indicator of the true intent of Member State within existing resources signals to the Secretariat that Member States expect the additional activities to be of a relatively low impact and to be absorbed within existing resources, accepting de facto that those existing resources originally given for other mandated activity will now be shared for those additional mandated activity, possibly leading to a lessening of some other activities.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The absence of this expression within existing resource signaled to the Secretariat that that Member States are ready to consider providing additional resources for those new mandated activities as assessed under the strict principle governing in particular the revised estimates relating to the proposed program budget for 2026 with an expectation of delivery under an efficient framework, making full use of possible synergies and avoiding duplications and this will be my last slide in terms of support to Member States in linking the mandate creation and the budgetary resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have in place briefings to the main Committees on the PBI process and we are open to provide them more frequently or to larger audience and to enrich them to better meet the requirements of Member States and are very interested in your feedback on those in terms of support on the drafting.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: While we are actively supporting the process today, improvements could be made to be more present throughout the maturation of the resolution, but this would require additional focus resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In addition, it's also noted that during conferences the same drafting consultation with PPBD does not usually take place and this is a weak point that might require further discussions on improving the review and presentation of program plans.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We review the mandates and deliverables annually to identify those no longer required to be referenced and and potential streamlining of activities to ensure effective use of resources in the implementation of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The outcome of this Working Group and proposal Under Work Stream 3 would provide opportunities for further strengthening program plans.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The revised estimate report on the program budget and support account that I mentioned earlier reflects some of these areas where program managers have identified areas where they can increase the use of existing mechanism to identify opportunities to consolidate and streamline work, including recommendations to change the frequency, format or terminate specific outputs and deliverable.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mr. Chair, thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank Mr. Monnier for that interesting presentation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I now invite Her Excellency Maritza Chan, Permanent Representative of Costa Rica, to provide insights from the perspective of of a Member State who has been involved in the creation of mandates in a number of different capacities.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Ambassador Chan, the floor is yours.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Ambassador, Excellency, Colleagues, I wish to thank Ambassador Schwager and Wallace for inviting me to share our views.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We're certain that with your leadership this will be a successful process.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mandates are truly at the heart of of everything the United nations does.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Each mandate reflects an agreement among Member States on how to address an issue and what action needs to be taken.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Yet the current context compels us to be more deliberate in how we create mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I will share key observations from Costa Rica's experience in either chairing, co facilitating or presiding over different intergovernmental processes.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I will highlight persistent experiences which reveal both affected approaches and persistent challenges.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A positive example comes from the 2024 conference to review progress in the implementation of the Program of Action to Prevent, Combat and Eradicate Illicit Trade in Small Arms Allied Weapons in all its aspects.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: RepCom4 in response to the new technological developments such as polymer and modular weapons and 3D printing, Member States agree to establish an Open Endeavor Technical Expert Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This mandate was needs driven.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It emerged from real challenges, focus narrowly on actionable outcomes and build on previous commitments while adapting to new context.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The Small Arms and Light Weapons Fellowship Program exemplifies a mandate designed for direct impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: When a mandate is clearly justified, appropriately scope and linked to current realities, it strengthens the UN capacity to respond.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A second experience I'd like to share is the 2024 negotiation of the Modalities Resolution for the High Level Meeting on addressing the existential threats posed by sea level rise.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The General assembly decided to convene a high level meeting within existing resources, but later on it became evident that those existing resources would not be enough.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Additional throughout the negotiation process, delegations recognized that the meeting alone would not suffice for the UN to properly start to address this issue.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So three additional mandates were created a Secretary General's report with inputs from Member states, a political declaration, and the High Level Meeting itself.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This case highlights two points.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First, new thematic areas often require new mandates to build institutional attention from the ground up.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Secondly, early coordination with DGACM was essential to anticipate budgetary implications and whether mandates can be realistically implemented and properly resourced.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: When chairing the first committee in 2024, we observed a third example with both potential and pitfalls.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: During the 29th session, the committee adopted 77 draft resolutions and decisions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: However, only 27 were adopted without a vote.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The remaining 50 required recorded votes with 156 separate specific paragraphs votes requested, leading to 201 total votes compared to 148 the previous year.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Of course, not all resolutions create mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mandates are created by resolutions or decisions with operative or actional elements.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Many resolutions have operative paragraphs that in fact do not invoke action, and frequently operative paragraphs which invoke action are unclear in their intent.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Sometimes this is the result of finely balanced negotiations, sometimes it is unintended.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Extracting mandates from resolutions and decisions can lead to the Secretariat and wider UN system which implements them to have to make subjective decisions about Member States intentions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As we all know, many resolutions are long, repetitive and lacked sunset clauses or review clauses.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: One off resolutions are by far the exception rather than the norm.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Many also include rollover annual requests for compilations of State views that carry production cost.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: While the compilations themselves gather little interaction, bringing into question the value of the requests themselves, what at the same time show the difficulty for States to follow up on those requests?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is a problem in several committees.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This combination of voting fragmentation, procedural inefficiency and no engagement outputs compel us to ask fundamental questions in a Committee such as the first committee when in 2024 only 27 out of 77 resolutions and decisions achieved consensus.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Should we pursue more resolutions annually or would fewer, better focused proposals on biennial or triennial cycles allow time for genuine consensus building?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Similarly, we must question whether to continue commissioning Secretary General's reports and annual compilations at the rate we have been doing so when resources are constrained and engagement remains minimal.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: For instance, first committee mandates that consistently receive fewer than 10 replies could transition to less frequent reporting cycles, allowing the Secretariat to focus resources on higher quality, more impactful outcomes and provide states with more time to fulfill the requirements requirements.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Another example is my experience as Vice President of the ECOSOC Humanitarian affairs segment in 20242025 we received divergent views about the annual resolution, particularly its overlap with the General assembly omnibus Humanitarian Resolution.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Both segments traditionally produced negotiated outcome documents through repetitive annual discussions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In 2025, Costa Rica took a different approach.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Instead of negotiating yet another formal outcome document, we issue a Call to Action.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This shorter, more strategic document, developed through streamlined consultation with Member States, sent a strong collective message of support to those affected by humanitarian emergencies and to the humanitarian system.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Instead, the result 151 states supported the call to action, a commitment beyond ECOSOC's membership.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How can we improve mandate creation?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Now turning to this question of improving mandate quality and discipline, I would like to make five points.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Firstly, mandates are more likely to be implemented and deliver quality outcomes for people and planet if they are created thoughtfully at the outset.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Secondly, there is a growing trend of resolution coming commissioning SG reports.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In my experience, the SG reports that actually get read and used are the ones with expert analysis.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We saw this with the new topics like AI, they sparked real debate because they offer insight, not just aggregation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A shift from compilation to analysis in SG reports would be transformative.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thirdly, before we create more mandates, we need to map what we already have.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: When we spotted the duplication between ECOSOC and the General assembly humanitarian resolutions, we addressed it, but that was one case we happened to notice.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We need systemic visibility and thus I welcome this fund finding in the SG report on Monday.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Implementation Review Fourthly, some simple tests might help us understand whether a mandate we have created is of sufficient enduring interest to the collective membership.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Does a mandate with which commissions and SG report get more than 20 responses does a mandate which establishes an agenda item on the UN's books result in engagement from more than a dozen states?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Has the mandate produced something concrete in three years?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Are the costs reasonable for what the mandate produces?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And how would we know unless a monitoring and evaluation mechanism is built in?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If we can say yes to to these questions, should it trigger a review of the mandate?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Fifthly, I welcome the proposal in the ESRI report which suggests the Secretariat could do a better job of assisting Member States to create higher quality mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I encourage the Secretariat to engage with Member States, including those who lead initiatives.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Observe as co facilitators or co chair for process on what this support could look like.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is also a shared responsibility.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: All co facilitators should seek that assistance from the start of each process.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Finally, I'd like to add one more thing.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Leadership makes a real difference in how mandates are created.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It matters who the PGA designates to run a negotiation, and it matters what experience those persons bring.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We've seen that skill facilitation can turn a contentious process into a productive one, and that preparation and institutional knowledge help Member States find common ground.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Getting the right people in these roles is how we create mandates which delivered meaningful outcomes.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank Ambassador Chan for that interesting and thought provoking presentation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I now invite Ms. Mintu Pam, co Founder and CEO of Project Starling, to provide insights and lessons learned from the last intergovernmental process to consider reform of mandates in 2006 in which she played a central role within the UN secretariat.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you Excellencies.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And thank you Ambassador, the Ambassadors from Jamaica and New Zealand for inviting me here to address you all.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Ladies and Gentlemen, distinguished guests, as Ambassador Wallace has just mentioned, I had the, the fortune, or maybe for some the misfortune of being designated within Kofi Annan's office actually 20 years ago now in October of 2005, to lead the Secretariat's mandate review to support the Member States mandate review.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And so my comments draw from that experience.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I was heartened to hear that so many of you wanted to hear about what were some of the lessons from that time.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So let me get right to it.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The 2006-2007 mandate review, one of the core lessons from that is that a detailed backwards looking intergovernmental review of existing mandates was unmanageable.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The reason for that is because you don't have the information that you Member States need to do a full review of past and current mandates, including and especially budgetary information that would be required.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And third, success for this mandate review, you should carefully think about what are the criteria for success.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I was encouraged to see that the co facilitators have laid out a really constructive process, I think, for how you might consider the mandates and especially the process by which mandates are created, delivered and reviewed.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And that success should not be reviewed.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Success should not be determined based on how many mandates you get rid of.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As you heard from Ms. Suzuki earlier today, mandates can be everything from establishing an organization to just designating a report to be written.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And those are very, very different types of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So if you say we got rid of one mandate, that could have been the issuing of a report or an entire institution or agency or fund or program within the un.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Those are very different things.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So just consider how you consider success.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mandates are carefully negotiated outcomes of extensive and often contentious intergovernmental negotiations.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You all know that very, very well.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Reviewing all existing mandates could mean that you are relitigating decades of difficult compromises.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The current governments that are in place now, the ones that you all lead, would be forced to rehash agreements that were made by their predecessors and that would reopen old wounds.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You are in a different political context right now.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And rehashing old mandates that may or may not still be relevant, I think would reopen those old wounds.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I think you may find that you'll be relitigating 80 years of diplomacy.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I have to say the process that the co facilitators have taken to look forward is the way to help build goodwill and trust, which is needed at the beginning of an extensive reform process.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In 2006 and 2008, member states took a clerical approach to avoid reopening old wounds.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That was the right call at that time, given that the 2006 World Summit's directive, meaning the language that was in the World Summit outcome, was to, quote, review all mandates older than five years, originating from resolutions of the General assembly and other organs.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That meant that we did not have the option that you have in front of you now, which is to look forward at the mandate life cycle and what should be done to put in place the systems to make it better.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The reason why the past mandate review didn't work so well was because the directive was to review old mandates older than five years.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And back then, after two and a half years of tedious work to examine individual mandates for duplication and delivery, the process simply lost steam.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
