text: In fact, I left the Secretary General's office in the middle of 2007, about halfway through, because I also lost steam this time, I suggest that we look forward.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Just as the co facilitators have advised you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You will always find more unity looking forward into the future than looking backwards into the past.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You should focus instead on the fundamental reason why we have a mandate problem, the mandate life cycle.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And it really is a cycle.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's a feedback loop.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How mandates are created is really a byproduct of what happened before then and what exists currently within the system.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's really encouraging to see that the Secretary General has addressed the systemic challenge in his report.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And that was something that we in 2006 in Kofi Annan's office also highlighted at the time.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We had to focus on old mandates because of the World Summit's mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But I really do urge you to follow the lead this time, to look into the future.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If you take decisions to strengthen the way that we create and monitor mandates, you'll be better off, the UN will be better off, and you'll enable us also to potentially refresh our existing programs.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What do I mean by that?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Here's the core problem.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Member states create mandates to address transnational problems.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So there are challenges in the world that you see the UN playing a role to address.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And yet, too often, as the Secretary General's report indicates, you have to do this without full insight into what already exists across the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You don't know in fact what's working, what's potentially overlapping, and where right resources could be shifted or what programs could be updated to then respond to the challenge that you're having to address.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In the absence of that visibility, decisions rely on incomplete information or even your own national analyses rather than shared evidence that you all are working from the same set of information.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And as you all know not every member state can conduct their own national analyses.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As a result, this often results in fragmentation, which you all know is a major problem within the system where some parts of the UN are perceived as more effective than others.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This can also increase politicization in the intergovernmental decision making process where you're all relying on your own information or your own perceptions as to what needs to be done.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The Secretariat is capable of providing the assessments of implementation and that is essential for you to create new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: However, that requires investment and I know that's not something we're talking about necessarily in an environment of budgetary austerity, but it really does require investment.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Around the world, well run organizations devote about 3 to 10% of their budgets to program evaluation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You all know this within your own bureaucracies, the UN system, and this is my own calculation, and it was our calculation back in 2006 that the UN spends likely closer to about 1% or less than 1% of its budget on proper program evaluation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You don't know what's happening if you don't have a sense of the assessment of how the programs are working.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I'd encourage that perhaps the Secretariat or others can provide you with this specific number.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How much does the UN actually devote to proper program evaluation?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If we strengthen the UN's capacity to do internal, meaning self, evaluation, as well as external independent evaluation, meaning externally validated assessments of the UN's work that would provide you with evidence that can then inform your creation of mandates, Member States, you all have to be given the information so that you understand and can then discuss and adopt new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Essentially, it's so that you can be better custodians of your mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is essentially what Secretary General Kofi annan recommended in 2006 and what the current Secretary General has just suggested in his report.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In that 2006 assessment, we realized that we had to significantly invest in evaluation capacity across the system.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That includes oios, the Joint Inspections Unit, and then individual program based inside the departments and offices and agencies self evaluation so that you could then have better streamlined reporting and more transparent understanding of what is actually required budgetary wise when you ask for a new mandate and when the Budget Office is then giving you a program budget implication.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is the essence of evidence.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Informed policymaking.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In the Secretary General's recent report under Mandate Creation, here's my recommendation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: He recommends that improving Secretariat support for Member States during mandate creation and that you need to complement budget estimates with information on related programmatic activities across the system.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I think that's absolutely necessary.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I would urge you all to consider going one step further.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Build into every mandate budget a modest dedicated percentage for evaluation, so that from the outset, when a mandate is created as part of the cycle, you are building in implementation, learning and assessment as part of the design of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If we don't know, and we're not budgeting for the system to understand how well and whether your mandates were implemented, there's no way you would know what should be the next mandate that you create for those of you, Because I've suggested a forward looking approach for those of you who are concerned about reviewing existing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What do we do about the backlog of our existing mandates, the thousands that we've discussed, and to know whether they are duplicative or overlap or even remain relevant?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I'd suggest that the best solution is not to conduct another sweeping review, at least not yet, maybe a little bit later in your phases, but rather to make these changes, investing in understanding what the visibility across a system of the mandates are, and then whether or not the evaluation is there to know how well those mandates are being done.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If you do that, then you'll know whether or not the existing mandates are still relevant or even if they've been delivered well.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What you need is the information that tells you not only what activities took place, which is essentially what the content of many of the UN's reports are, but also you need to know, what difference did it make.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That information strengthens transparency, accountability, and ultimately public trust, which is in short supply these days, especially in institutions like this one.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And this can be reported back to you in a way that enables even the smallest of missions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I know how strapped, because I work with so many of you, how strapped some of the smallest missions are.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You cannot read the thousands of reports that the UN issues every day, every day, every year.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So it's so important so that you can really understand and then credibly adopt new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So my appeal to you today is not about an issue that's going to make the headlines.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's about the quiet systems that ultimately make multilateral cooperation work.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I've devoted my career to improving how the UN delivers because I know personally what a functioning UN can do.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: My life is.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I'm here because of the un.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: When I was three, after the war, my family fled Vietnam by boat.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We were rescued by the UN High Commissioner for Refugees and brought to a refugee camp that UNHCR ran in Indonesia before being resettled.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: My life is shaped by the UN's ability to work when it works well when it's adequately funded, when we invest in knowing how well it works, the UN can save lives and expands what's possible for millions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Strengthening your ability to better adopt mandates with better evaluative information, with better visibility across the system, so that the UN can learn and adapt is one of the surest ways that it can continue to do so.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This was a huge lesson from 2006.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The poet Edna St Vincent Millais said, life is not one thing after another.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Life is not one thing after another.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's one damn thing over and over again.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Her point was that life keeps repeating itself and the same problems keep coming up again and again.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I can't believe that I'm here 20 years later talking to you about something that is a scar.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I'm still recovering from the 2006 mandate review.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But by improving, you really have a great opportunity right now.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: By improving the mandate life cycle, as has been proposed, and building into that the budget that is needed to do evaluation, by addressing these systemic issues, you can try to prevent the same mandate problems from coming up again and again.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much, Ms. Pham, for those insights and for that personal touch as well.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The impact of this organization is legendary.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's our task to make sure that it remains so going forward.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In the time remaining, I'm going to now open the floor for any questions from delegations on the briefings we have just heard.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I'm just going to remind you, delegations, that this briefing will be followed in a week or 10 days by informal consultations at which there will be an opportunity for delegations to deliver prepared statements to ensure today that we can take as many questions as possible in the next half an hour.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We're asking that you keep your interventions short, no longer than a minute and a half or so.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: With that, I give the floor to the distinguished representative of the European Union, to be followed by China.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Co chairs supremely appreciate this opportunity today.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And the briefers very enlightening and full support for your work.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I have three very, very short questions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The first one has to do with the discussion that was opened by Project Startling now about the existing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I do understand the experience of 2004, but back then, of course, all the tools that were described by the Secretary this morning, the AI tools in our disposal, the knowledge of every single mandate out there, the capacity to combine them and see all their overlaps, those didn't exist back there.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So one question is, could those tools, or how could those tools also help us if we were to, if they were to be applied to existing mandates and would you need more or different kinds of tools when you look at existing mandates as opposed to advising on new ones?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And to the cofax, A question on this and to everyone else really, can we envision a possibility for the Member States in the committee process itself to be able to work on the evaluation, assessment of mandates, implementation of them, making sure that the UN itself helps implement its own mandates in a conscious of potentially given that limited time, avoiding looking perhaps at some sessions, at the discussion of renewals of mandates, renegotiation of mandates, all those things and instead focus on implementing them.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Does that make sense?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Second question has to do with related to the first with tying adoption to implementation assessment.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Can you please tell us how many mandates today already have a sunset clause, if any do how many do have a built in monitoring, assessment, evaluation mechanism, implementation mechanism, how those are working?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Are they working well or are they not working well?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Now a third question has to do with badger allocation itself and to understand which mandates you know, have which badgered requirements.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I do not know if the best way is to ask do we have the top 50 most expensive mandates in the UN system?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And if we do, can we look at the details of those and understand what costs what and whether or not we could achieve better results in implementing those mandates by cutting out some of their elements?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But obviously we cannot ignore the cost.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So we have to be able to do that exercise.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So that's the question, a final question.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The suggestion which makes a lot of sense when mandates are being are asking for within budgetary resources, but in fact that's not possible.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: There's a suggestion that there's more flexibility given to the Secretary General to be able to allocate those limited resources to different mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Like I said, that makes a lot of sense.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We do not have unlimited money, obviously, and that's why we're having this exercise in addition to trying to make our lives better and more effective at the un stop renegotiating things all over again and bring a collective power together as Member States to implement things we have decided.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But what criteria would the Secretary General then use, do you think or has used up to now that you consider particularly effective in making those decisions on how to allocate those more limited resources through increased flexibility.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mandate creation marks the beginning of the mandate life cycle.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Just like fasten the first button on a shirt, it must be done properly from the start Listening.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I listened very carefully with the briefings and I would like to raise three questions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First, regarding the online registration of mandates, could you please provide information on the resources that have been invested in the development of the registration system so far, as well as the resources and funding resources that will be required in the future?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Second, only corresponding resources for mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The Secretary General's report recommends strengthening the linkage between mandate creation and corresponding resources and providing more comprehensive budget estimates for new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What impact would this have on the current budget preparation process, in particular on the work of the Committee for Program and Coordination and the Fifth Committee of the General Assembly?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Third, concerning the use of artificial intelligence, what type of data does the Secretariat intend to feed into these tools?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What measures are planned to ensure the secure management of this entire process, including data input, content generation, result verification and integration and optimization?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And what is the estimated financial cost of these activities?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I would also like to take this opportunity to thank the Co Chair by circulating the work of plan which demonstrate a spirit of openness and transparency.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In conclusion, I want to strike a optimistic tone now.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The Secretariat and also the UN's work is multiplying in terms of the rapid change of international situation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So we need to really keep the work with the pace of the times, rather than simply compare this times work with the work we have done before and label the previous previous work as a failure.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of China.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I'll give the floor to the distinguished representative of South Africa, to be followed by Liechtensteinstein.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

text: Protocol observed and thanks to the, to the briefers extremely helpful briefings presentations this morning.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Morning.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we do, we do like this format so thank you for this.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I will have a couple of questions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I mean it was particularly useful for me to hear the comments on the budget.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I think the term visibility was used quite a bit.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What we are looking for a little more is also transparency because I think the reality is we often don't know how much the things cost that we mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And my experience is also that we often actually don't know if a mandate that we're drafting is, is linked to a PBI until extremely late.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So I've been involved in negotiations or it's like oh this is a big question.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Is there going to be a PBI or is there no pbi?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But I think the reality is also even without a PBI a resolution does entail costs.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So that is for us important.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we'll comment on other issues such as SG reports and the famous phrase within existing resources when we have this opportunity.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In informals my questions are linked to my brief comments and the first is what methods can be used to link newly created mandates in the future with the reduction of consolidation of older ones in order to maximize the efficiency of the use of resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Think that links also you know the forward looking perspective that that has been advocated in the discussion with what we also need to address as far as what you already have.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And the second question relates also to my comments namely what additional information can be provided besides regular budget estimates to ensure full funding transparency for newly created mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Because I really think that has been one of the the things that we have not been doing well on, well at all on in the past and something that I hope can be fixed relatively easily.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

text: Great.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Kirk chairs and thanks to all the panelists today.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Just a couple questions and reactions to follow up on the very useful briefings today.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First to Yaku Suzuki.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: One of the recommendations that you discussed is around giving the Secretariat appropriate flexibility to assign responsibility based on comparative advantage.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I think it would be useful to have more information on what the that would actually look like if there are examples in existing mandates that perhaps could serve as a model as we consider new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Similarly, you talked about, I think the very useful mandate report that the SG produced.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I was particularly struck by the the graphic on the last page of that report, which is the heat map looking at overlap across the three pillars of the organization.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It would be useful to have a better understanding of clusters of similar mandates that could be potentially a basis for us as Member states to think about consolidation or deconfliction.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And the representative of the European Union talked about which mandates were the most expensive.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It might also be useful to have a good sense of what mandates do we spend the most time on.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And then finally to Christophe Monnier, wearing my 5C hat, a lot of that was of course very familiar.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I think it's worth noting that when we use within existing resources and mandates, it's often a political compromise.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's because some in the room don't like the mandate, some do.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And the sort of most expedient way of reaching agreement is to say, fine, you can do that, but with no new money.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And with that in mind, I think it would be helpful to know both how the Secretariat determines whether, as you said, in circumstances where we have mandated doing something within existing resources, additional resources are needed, or if the Secretariat cannot actually implement the mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And similarly, should we be thinking about a threshold below which the Secretariat can absorb those resources, or above which resources actually would be necessary for implementation?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Co Chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you for convening today's briefing and I also thank the Briefers for their useful presentation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I have a question to Ms. Suzuki with regards to the mandate registries.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As noted in the Report of the Secretary General, the availability and accessibility of information on existing mandates remain limited.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Malaysia joins those who believe that improving access to this information could contribute to more informed and effective decision making by Member States as part of our broader efforts at reform.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We also note and support the recommendation to accelerate the creation of comprehensive registries of existing mandate tax issued by all mandating bodies.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we are also encouraged to see that at least the beta version of the UN Mandate Registry has been online and is being expanded in the coming weeks.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So my question is, is there a sense of timeline for the completion of the mandate source registry?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And my second question would be what are the potential persistent challenges that are being faced in building and completing this registry?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Malaysia.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I now give the floor to the distinguished representative of the Republic of Korea, to be followed by El Salvador.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you for the briefing.

text: I have a couple of questions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The SG report identifies excessive prescriptiveness as a problem which may seem a bit counterintuitive because specificity is generally virtue in drafting clear mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Is the concern primarily about assigning tasks to specific entities or does it extend to mandates that prescribe in detail how active activities should be done and also for visibility?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I wonder myself, would the registries at the current format be sufficient perhaps to avoid duplication, but not so much to ensure coherence to give Member State a full insight of how the existing mandates or duplicative mandates are implemented, coordinated or funded.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I just want to listen to how you are going to improve this mandate registry.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much Co Chairs for convening this meeting and also to the briefers for the valuable presentations and also to the Secretary for all the efforts highlighting the presentation that Ambassador Maritza Chai gave us.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Very comprehensive and with a lot of food for thought precisely in our work.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I would like to know if you Co Chairs have also engaged with other Member States precisely that have led intergovernmental processes recently to draw lessons from them that could inform the current review mandate that especially because the report was presented last August and the first meeting was in mid September on the creation of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: More specifically and within the context of the current Main Committees now in session.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We would like to know if there have been exchanges between the Secretariat Co Chairs of different processes and the Chairs especially of the main Committees to raise awareness of the need to avoid repeating the same pace of creating countless new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Also have the discussions taken place within the committees and that's related from what was previously mentioned of the use of within existing resources when establishing new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And that's precisely seeing what in the framework of the main Committees could be done to avoiding that use of the phrase, whether for political reasons or others.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Other questions that we have is regarding the paragraph 29B of the SG report when referring to the need of frame mandates that allow the Secretary General flexibility to assign task based on comparative advantages and resources across the UN system Co Chairs, what exactly will that flexibility mean in practice and related to mandate implementations?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Very concrete questions is that has the Secretary identified a sense of competitiveness between agencies within the system, and are there any considerations regarding these cases in the field based, for instance, on the findings of the multiple QCPR reports during the last few years?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I think I used this analogy before.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You are making us looking in the mirror because at the end of the day, Member states are responsible for this important phase of the mandates creation.

text: I'm looking at Mintu and I'm wondering if we did not manage it 20 years ago, what would make us confident that we'll make it this time?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I think we have to make it this time because there is no, this is not optional.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mrs. Suzuki spoke about the design that drives delivery.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is correct.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is something that we've been looking at together with Matu in the revitalization resolution, how to make resolutions, you know, more streamlined.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The demand has to be clearly codified.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But I'm still concerned.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I mean, if we did not manage to do it 20 years ago, what would it take it this time?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I'm interested from, from the Secretariat, probably, and all the panelists, what exactly benchmarks, criterias we may develop in addition to what we had developed so far?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I very much like the presentation on the financial impact of our mandates and the way we have explained what exactly a mandate means.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And it is correct in my understanding as well, a resolution simply requesting the Secretary General, producer mandate, a report, it's a mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I'm interested, actually, can we go back to the basics in a way, looking at what exactly does it mean from a financial perspective, what is the expenditure related to such a simple task?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Because the way I see it, and that's the mirror that we have to look into, we're not even observing our own rules of procedures throughout these processes that we promote through different committees of resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We're actually supposed to quantify the financial impact of those resolutions so it doesn't happen.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So I would be very much interested how we can quantify in practical terms such a request to produce a report, because it will be giving an important visual for member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The other point I would like to ask is we scatter different mandates through different resolutions in different bodies.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much Co Chairs, for convening this briefing.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We also thank all the panelists for their insightful presentations.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I will save our substantive reflections on the proposals in the SG's report for the next meeting and limit this intervention to three points on which we desire greater clarity.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First is on one of the key issues identified in the SG's report that many entities are citing the same mandates in their pbis, implying possible duplicates duplication of efforts to address this.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The report recommends that greater flexibility be granted to the SG to assign tasks when designing or implementing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: From our perspective, the solution proposed is not necessarily in line with the problem identified.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The question would be is it possible for the Secretariat to provide more in depth analysis on how the proposal in the the report would enhance efficiency?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In our view, if the mandates formulation remains unclear, it would lead to delays in implementation, interagency conflict, etc. It is the Member States who should spy specify the implementing entity and the Secretariat which should provide adequate support to Member States to make an informed decision.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Second is on the proposal for linking new mandates to corresponding resources or reductions elsewhere.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We can agree to this principle when Member States are creating new mandates to be implemented within existing resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: However, applying such a principle to all new mandates is a point of concern.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We cannot expect the UN to respond to new emerging challenges if PBIS are our overarching concern.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So the question here is can the Secretariat inform whether this principle is implementable on all new mandates and not just those which are specified to be implemented within existing resources and what this would imply in practice for recent new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Third, we agree with the proposal for accelerating the creation of comprehensive registries of existing mandate text issued by all mandating bodies.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We recall that the 2006 exercise highlighted by Ms. Fam also created a mandate Registry, but we are unaware of its fate.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We would like to ask the Secretariat what arrangements are in place to ensure that such registries remain in place even after the Unity Initiative is completed, and we would also be very happy to hear what what you have to respond to the Chinese question about what resources are being spent on the Registry.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The creation of the Registry itself.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished Representative of Pakistan.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to the Distinguished representative of Mozambique, to be followed by Ireland.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank. Thank you Chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Our co Chairs and we also welcome this discovery phase.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And for us this is not only a forward looking exercise.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Even as we meet today, new mandates are being created making this a particularly hands on and practical exchange for certain countries such as mine.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Strengthening the connection between the political decisions that create mandates and the budgetary realities that sustain them has real life implications.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Let me pose a couple three or four questions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First, on visibility and mandate registries, does the Secretariat intend to expand the registry to include specialized agencies so that duplication can be addressed system wide rather than only within the Secretariat?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Second, has the Secretariat considered developing model drafting guidance or templates to help delegations avoid the pitfalls that were mentioned such as prescriptive language, the famous within existing resource clauses and others.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Third, on AI, will we Member States be consulted on the criteria and methodology those systems will use to flag duplication and complementarities?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And finally, in what ways can regional commissions such the eca, the Economic Commission for Africa, contribute to or manage regional mandate registries to enhance coherence in regional ownership?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Mozambique.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Much appreciated.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: One question I had is for Mr. Monnier from the Executive Office of the Secretary General.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And secondly, and finally, yes, we've spoken about the mapping of mandates that we have currently.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Which ones are the most expensive, which ones take up the most time or two elements, I would add, which ones have the most impact?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But of course that also relates to what Minh Tu was saying.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How do we evaluate?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How are we able to tell where the impact and results are?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So very supportive of thoughts in that regard as we go forward.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much Chair for giving me the floor and thanks for this opportunity.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have three questions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First, regarding the ongoing initiative to improve the visibility of the mandate landscape, referring para.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: 23 of the Secretary General's report, how has the allocation of resources being managed in the context of the equate liquidity crisis facing the Organization for the implementation of these initiatives?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Second, regarding the recommendation to grant the Secretary General greater flexibility in mandates to assign tax to entities within the system, taking into account the points raised in para.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: 28 of the report, we would like to know the criteria or procedures that will be taken into account to assess the suitability of giving entity to implement a mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And third, concerning the use of artificial intelligence to support the creation or drafting of mandate text, how will it be ensured that that the relevant political analysis and sensitivity of each issue analyzed by the Organization will not be undermined?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Could the Secretariat provide an exhaustive list of the areas of the organizations where in which AI is being implemented?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What AI tools are currently in use by the Organization or are being considered for use?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How can it be ensured that they are fully respectful of Member States, their positions and their perspective?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We would like appreciate receiving right information from the Secretariat for the next sessions of the Ad hoc Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of Cuba and I'll give the floor to the distinguished representative of the Russian Federation, to be followed by Nigeria.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Ambassadors and colleagues in the Secretariat.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I think we have to be thankful to all of us.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We're starting the frank conversation which is long overdue.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: With that frank conversations, my questions are the following.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As I mentioned last time, I would love to address not only the part actions by the Member States, but also the part actions by the Secretary General.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So I see two conflicting points.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: One is that the Secretary General is going to approve Secretariat support and the other is that the Secretary General is going to provide shorter reports.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So my question is how do these two combine with each other?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Because in my opinion, shorter reports are not improved support.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Does it mean that the UN Secretariat wants to work less?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And does the working less means that the UN Secretariat is ready to receive reduced salaries?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: My second question also concerns the appropriate flexibility to assign tasks by the Secretary General.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We would love to ask how does this is commensurate with the prerogatives of the Member States to control the implementation of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And how does this impact the accountability of the Secretary General?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: My last point would also the also address the flexibility.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Not flexibility, sorry.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Also address the conditionality of mandate with the resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The clause that says that the impact has to be defined first, the source of funding has to be defined first.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How does this impact the prerogatives of Member States in determining the provision program of the organization?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And last issue just echo the questions about existing resources clause.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We understand this is quite a difficult sometimes an outcome for Member States to arrive into decision and consensus.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But how the Secretary choose and prioritize in the conditions where it's clearly that resources are not enough.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of the Russian Federation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I give the floor to the distinguished representative of Nigeria, to be followed by Iran and then our final speaker will be Argentina.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you the Co Chairs for this wonderful job.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Be rest assured of my delegations full support for achieving a positive outcome in the ongoing review mandates in line with the results or guidelines of giving to the Committee.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: While we share the view that it is important to look forward, we must also recognize that understanding where we are coming from is fundamental to determine where we are going.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A clear appreciation of past mandates and experiences enable us to build more coherent and effective path for the future.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The Secretary is always supportive of Member States in terms of resolutions making by extension mandate creation from language, form illumination going forward.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So what is the support again that is needed different from what they are doing or giving to Member States and how can they do better?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I will appreciate for these cautions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Then lastly, on the issue of duplications of mandates, as highlighted, resolutions from the ga, ECOSOC and Security Council which according to the representative of the Secretariat, how can this time around be better than the previous time given that the administrative bureaucratic process of monitoring and evaluating of this this mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And once again I want to also, what do you call it?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Ask the question related to what my distinguished colleague from Cuba, on the issue of AI, how are we looking at the transparent usage of the AI?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As well as my colleagues from Mozambique, who is talking about entities in terms of their mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How can we look at the review as well as the registry creation for their respective mandate?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Nigeria.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you Excellencies, Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: All protocols observed.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I also wish to thank the Co Chairs for their attention to the past experiences and to the lessons learned from them.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A meaningful step forward.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As we have previously requested, I wish to raise two questions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First is concerning the artificial intelligence.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And as as some colleagues previously said, we know that AI tools are subject to bias and exclusivism and more importantly remain costly and insufficiently developed for application, especially in the highly sensitive context.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: There are already concerning examples in the context of the un, such as speech to text tools and we all recognize that it is still an evolving technology.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Then how do you evaluate this as a supportive element to achieve inclusive outcomes under current financial situation?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Second, it relates to the ambiguous Language of mandates, often the result of delicate political compromises which frequently requires clarification during implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I would be interested to know whether there is any reflection or statistical data show showing to what extent this ambiguity consumes the Secretariat's time and energy in the interpretation and how often we encounter situations where Member States or groups later express their concerns that the implementation did not fully reflect their intended meaning.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Iran.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to the distinguished representative of Argentina and then Mexico.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mr. Co Chair of Protocol observes.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I have a question in the context of Rule 153 that was mentioning and the question is what challenges or limitations?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Or maybe, if you want to see positively what possibilities do we have to count with PBA estimates well in advance?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I would say maybe when the zero draft is presented so we can incorporate the budgetary implications from the beginning of a discussion when a mandate is created and not, I would say at the end, as it is now in the context of the procedure, maybe that would allow us to incorporate from the 0 draft the PBI implications and all be aware of what that means in the context of mandate negotiation.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Argentina and now give the floor to the distinguished representative of Mexico who will be our last speaker.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I would like to thank the briefers for the very clear and comprehensive presentations.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: My country, Mexico will be presenting its position on how we see the whole process in a thorough Way on October 23rd.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But in the meantime we would like to ask Ms. Mintu Pam if she could go a little bit more into detail on evaluation and monitoring in the creation of new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you Ambassador.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And thank you Co Chairs for the inclusiveness of this process.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We're looking forward also to the next briefings and avenues for discussion.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We also have some questions.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First of all, we welcome the establishment of the Registry of Mandates that has the potential to be a useful tool to support states improve mandate design and reduce duplication.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What functionalities do you envisage to strengthen its usefulness?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A second question would be to ask the Secretary General for a timeline on the implementation of the recommendations of the SG's report.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We already saw some shortened reports passing by which we greatly value, but we would like to have additional information on the implementation of the recommendations.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: On your side, slide AI tools.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The third question on AI tools, they have obviously a huge potential to support more informed decision making by States.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How do you foresee the implementation of such tools in this process?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I thank you very much for your attention.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of the Kingdom of the Netherlands.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And with that I try to hand the floor back over to my co chair for some summary remarks.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Ambassador Wallace.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And first of all, thank you to all of you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I cannot say how much we appreciate the trust that you have placed in us by working with us in the format and the process as we've prescribed.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we can see that in the presentation of your question and kind of early markers of your intent to come back with fuller ideas and proposals at the session on the 23rd of October.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I'd also like to thank the briefers.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Each one of you, in your own ways, I think, brought different aspects of this discussion on mandate creation to the fore.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This discussion was very rich.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's hard to summarise, but let me at least just touch on a few points before we close on what I think we may have heard today.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I was very taken by Mintu's comment that quiet systems make multilateralism work.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I think that is so true and that is the exercise we're embarked on.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So it's so great to hear from so many of you that you welcomed the opportunity to hear from some of the lessons we've learned in the past so that we can apply those to our work now and in the future.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I heard a lot of commentary around there is a great desire to have better design of the way we make mandates and the reason for that is because we all want to have better delivery and better impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That came through from both our presenters and from you as well.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Having said that, it was always.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
