text: It was also acknowledged in this discussion that because of the way we negotiate as Member States together, of course some of the ways that we create mandates are a product of our own decision making and sometimes come with unintended consequences, but sometimes come with intended consequences as well.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And of course that is completely legitimate.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It, however, does raise questions around clarity.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We had comments and questions around how are mandates sourced out of the system?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: How does the Secretariat interpret what we produce as Member States?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we asked and heard a lot of questions around more information.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A desire for increased visibility so that that can support delivery.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But also transparency came through very strongly as well.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It was noted by some in their questions in the briefers that ambiguity can cause challenges for the Secretariat, but can cause challenges for us as Member states too, and our own evaluation or satisfaction on how we believe that mandates are delivered upon or not.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: There was much discussion around the relationship between the creation of mandates and how resources are allocated to those mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Both comments and questions around the information that we need before we start and the better information and understanding of the financial impacts of mandates perhaps before we conclude them.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A very strong theme came through today about the importance of monitoring and evaluation, the importance of having better assessments of what we've actually done to inform what we do in the future.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I heard clients comments and questions around not only the impacts of mandates on our finances and our funding, but also on our time and also on our impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So we have questions there for the briefers as well.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Many of you referred to the SG's report.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Many of you welcomed some of the recommendations.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Many of you had questions about some of the recommendations, whether they were the right recommendations, and some of you who had questions asking for elaboration on some of them as well.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: There were many questions and comments around the tools, the registry that's been mentioned.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What is its functionality, how is it being resourced?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We had questions about AI, how can AI help us?

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But also what are some of the caveats we need to consider when we think about the use of AI in this exercise.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Many of you ask questions of about what does giving the SG increased flexibility mean in terms of allocating parts of the system to deliver on mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And there was a lot of discussion around the implications of within existing resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We heard from a couple, including Maritza, about how SG reports are consumed, one of the frequent mandates that we see in resolutions, and there was an encouragement to move from compilation of information to analysis.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We also of course heard questions beyond the recommendation in the SG's report and we started to see some flavour and hints of things that you might bring back to us on the 23rd as well.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I think there's a great desire to see how the tool that the Secretariat has developed and maybe outside of this format we can ask the Secretary Secretariat to provide a very informal, informal meeting sometime between now and the 23rd where they can show you your experts how the tool works and you can see some of the functionality by testing it on a few case studies that might be something we will commission from the Secretariat.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So that was my attempt to summarise this hour and a half or so or almost two hours this morning.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I think it's been a really rich discussion and as co chairs we're really thrilled and I'm looking forward to hearing more from you.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: On the 23rd, but also, of course, before that, as we said at the first session, we remain available to you to meet you individually, to meet you in groups, to meet you in clusters who are interested in particular aspects of this process.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So thank you very much again for today.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I have to do the formalities to get close us out.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So before adjourning, as previously announced, the next meeting will take place on the 23rd of October.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As I said, in the interim, if you wish to meet with us directly in person or by in writing, you can also do so to the email address that we provided in the letters on 7th and 10th of October.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But for today, this meeting is adjourned.

session_title: Mandate Creation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I call to order the informal meeting of the Working Group for consultations on the matter of mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: On behalf of Ambassador Shuolga, I warmly welcome you to these consultations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I'd like to start by recognizing the presence of Mr. Ayaka Suzuki, Director in the Executive Office of The Secretary General Mr. Christophe Monnier, Director of the Program Planning and Budget Division in the Department of Management, Strategy, Policy and compliance and Ms. Min Thu Pam, founder and CEO of Project Starling.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Colleagues, as we said last week at the Briefing on Mandate creation, we are a key acutely aware of the importance of the task ahead of us.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We can all agree that the UN is at a critical juncture and there is much to do to make the UN more effective, more efficient, more accountable and capable of responding to contemporary needs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Launched as part of the UN 80 initiative, our informal Ad hoc Working Group has a particular responsibility to build a set of principles and actions which can better support the creation, implementation and review of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Our Working Group also has a role in building trust and mutual understanding which can support the broader goal of organizational strengthening as envisaged by the UN 80 initiative.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As we have explained, this Working Group is currently engaged in a Discovery Phase where we are seeking to build our shared understanding of mandates, supported by empirical evidence, analyses and lessons learned.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As Co Chairs, we want the Discovery Phase to be a safe space where Working Group members feel they can propose ideas, big and small, novel and familiar, for the way ahead.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: There will be ample time in the days and weeks ahead to assess the merit and viability of proposals, so we encourage Working Group members to keep an open mind about what might be possible, keeping in view the opportunity presented by this process for us to achieve the highest possible ambition.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Today, Working Group members will first hear responses to questions posed at the Mandate creation briefing on 13 October.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As you are aware, some answers have already been provided writing on 22nd October and should be available on the UNAT Initiative website.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Further, we wish to note that in response to Working Group members questions on the Mandates Registry website, as co Chairs we have commissioned the Secretariat to provide a technical briefing on the Registry.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This expert level technical briefing will take place virtually on the 28th of October at 10am and the link for that will be provided to the Working Group and the briefing will be recorded and posted on the website.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Most importantly, as advised in our letter of 17 October, working group members will today have the opportunity to convey their views on mandate creation and we are very much looking forward to hearing your ideas and proposals.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also Invite you to please submit your interventions as well as any additional inputs to us in writing via our email address, which is unat mandates co chairsmail.com we intend to compile and publish on the Unity Initiative website Working Group Members contributions unless otherwise indicated by you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I'm now going to pass the floor to my Co Chair, Ambassador Schwal.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Good morning everybody.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Now, as we turn to the questions posed to the briefers at the Mandate creation briefing on 13th October, we wish to respond to the question posed to us as Co Chairs about how lessons learned from the last mandate review and other processes have been reflected in our consideration.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As Co Chairs, we have spoken with several individuals from Member States and the Secretariat who were involved in the last mandate review.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We discovered three key learnings.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Firstly, the previous exercise on review of existing individual mandates was a complex and time consuming process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Ultimately, the value of the technical exercise was undermined by the prevailing political realities.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Secondly, it was apparent that the tools necessary to support a deeper understanding of the overall mandates for framework, such as a mandate registry, were unavailable, underdeveloped or fledgling at best.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thirdly, we learned about the importance of improving understanding between mandate creation and the budgetary process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We have attempted to build these learnings into the approach we are taking in this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Further, in response to another question, we can confirm that we have also begun engaging with Member States who have recently led relevant intergovernmental processes to see what lessons or ideas we can carry over into this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: One example of this is the General assembly revitalization process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We are also engaging with the Chairs of the Main Committees to understand how the issue of mandate creation, implementation and review is being considered in their Committees and what this could mean for the Working Group's own deliberations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: With that, it is now my honour to offer the floor to our briefers to provide additional answers to Questions posed at the 13 October briefing on Mandate Creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, I give the floor to Ms. Ayaka Suzuki, Director in the Executive Office of the Secretary General, to provide further answers to questions posed at the Briefing on Mandate Creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much, Co Chairs, for inviting the Secretariat to provide further information at this meeting.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Excellency, distinguished Delegates, first, thank you so much for your strong interest and many questions after a briefing.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We have tried our best to answer, provide answers in the slides that we have provided yesterday and hope to provide additional clarifications today.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So, let me begin with the registry mandates.un.org There are quite many questions about the timeline, features, content development challenges and future direction.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In short, mandates.un.org will keep improving if Member States find it valuable, but it would also benefit from your support and feedback.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As announced just now, we will be doing a more technical briefing on this registry next Tuesday and I hope that as many of you would be able to participate so that we can introduce how to utilize it to support your work.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And as mentioned by Ambassador Wallace, the briefing will be virtual and a recording will be made available available.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So the timeline for completion of this registry, I mean it's an ongoing work.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It already has some 4,000 mandate sources cited in the regular and peacekeeping budgets for 2026, and obviously we will be adding more as new budgets are issued and then they will be regularly updated.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We will continue expanding features, categorization and functionality.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The focus is on fully covering all mandate sources, especially those that are older, providing more details regarding mandates, such as operative paragraphs, entities named actions that are mandated, and then helping users see the big picture, for example, how mandates cluster across organs and topics.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We already separate preambular and operative paragraphs and identify the actions, entities and deliverables in each resolution.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We were able to do this otherwise very painstaking task by AI, which scans and classifies keywords across thousands of documents, and I will get into that shortly afterwards and how we use the AI.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Our biggest challenge isn't so much the data, because that's all available, but in skills in coding, AI, data science and web development.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To keep the registry robust and user friendly requires coding skills.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And this is what UN 2.0 is about, modern digital capacity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So if you find the registry helpful, we will benefit from continued dialogue with Member States on how to sustain and improve it.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The main constant will be skills, as I just mentioned, not cost.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Most of the skills we need are found among young people, and that is why your support for UN rejuvenation is so critical.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, on scope, the mandates.un.org portal covers identify mandates coming from bodies serviced by the UN Secretariat.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In other words, bodies such as the General Assembly, Security Council, ecosoc and so on.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Specialized agencies are invited to develop their own registries for their mandating bodies, but using the shared data standards so that information can connect across.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So let me now address a group of questions related to resourcing of registries and mandates more generally.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So this was the second bigger group of questions and first on the registry development.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The current version of mandates was built by a very small staff, small team in our office using skills we are promoting through the UN 2.0 initiative, I.e. with new capabilities in data design and digital delivery.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, on the financial impact of mandates themselves.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Each mandate, even a simple one, carries cost for creation, implementation and review at a minimum.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: That could mean staff time, translation, editing, or meetings.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: For such routine tasks, there are standard cost estimates that are transparently laid out in the memorandum, that is before the General Committee at the beginning of each session of the General Assembly.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We refer to this document in our answers about $11,000 per day for meetings of up to two days and $25,000 for editing and translation, not the initial drafting of a report of around 8,500 words.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, on what some of you call the cost of ambiguity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We don't really have a systematic data on the financial impact of vaguely vague language and resolutions, but we know that it matters.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: When the intent of a mandate is not clear, then we need extra consultations, coordination, which takes both time and resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And that is why clarity on intent really matters.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, there are questions on how time intensive certain groups of mandates are in general act.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As the number and complexity of mandates in a pillar grows, so do resource demands on Member states, more meetings, reports and negotiations, and on UN entities that must serve them.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We can show at the registry briefing next week how to find large groups of mandates, if you like.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The simple takeaway here is that resources are not only financial, there is also human and temporal the time, attention and clarity needed to make each mandate deliverable.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The next large group of questions was about artificial intelligence and digital tools and how they're being used to support mandate work.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, on what AI does.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It can augment research capacity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As I just explained, we use that to build up registry of mandates, for example, to help identify keywords, recurring phrases, overlaps and similarities across a large body of mandate text.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It is an analytical support tool, not one to write or negotiate resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: That should of course remain a human process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, on data for mandates.un.org the system processes only publicly available documents, resolutions, decisions and budgets, all sourced from the UN Digital library.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, on data security and quality.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This site only uses open sources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: No internal, confidential or personal data have been used.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: AI helps process large amounts of data quickly with built in checks and human reviews for quality.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Some variation is normal and our team is improving the system over time.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, on future digital tools, we are continuing to build on your feedback over time.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: New digital tools, including AI capabilities, may allow for quicker comparison of text, of visual or of visual mapping of how mandates relate to each other.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The goal is to make information easier to find and to understand.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The simple takeaway is that AI can support analysis, not make final decisions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It can help us save time and improve visibility while we keep human judgment at the center of the process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, let me speak to questions on several broader issues that were made from review clauses and flexibility in tasking to guidance for Member States and the timeline for next steps.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, on review clauses, most mandates still lack explicit review or end mechanisms.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Over 80% of mandates cited in the current program budget do not specify how or when they should be reviewed.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Changing that practice would make mandates easier to assess and adapt over time.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We understand that the Co Chairs will hold another briefing on mandate review later this year.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, on the Secretary General's flexibility, the report recommends allowing the Secretary General to assign tasks based on comparative advantage, meaning the entity best placed to deliver, rather than prescribing one entity in the resolution text.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And in fact, that has been the norm over the years and it's only in recent years that it has become more prescriptive.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So what that means is that referring only to the Secretary General, that the United nations or UN system would be the preferred or the easiest way to do assignment based on comparative advantage.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, to better support Member States, the Secretary General proposed three main actions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Improved human support for delegates during the drafting, Enhanced Inter Secretariat cooperation to support visibility across intergovernmental bodies and digital tools.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fourth, on how to ensure new mandates are backed by resources or accompanied by a review of existing ones.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Our suggestion here included using review clauses, consolidating agenda items, or proposing the discontinuation of outdated outputs, which is an authority that the Secretary General intends to make make purposeful use of.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, on the timeline for Secretary General General related actions, many of these actions are already in progress, including the continued improvements of mandates.un.org Fuller implementation is targeted for 2026 in line with the available capacity and resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We will keep you updated both in a General assembly plenary and in this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The key message here is that we want to support your work on impactful mandate design, efficient delivery and accountable reviews, all grounded in evidence and dialogue.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And with that I wish to conclude Many thanks to Co chairs,

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank Ms. Suzuki and I now give the floor to Mr. Christoph M.E. monier, Director of the Program Planning and Budget Division in the Department of Management Strategy, Policy and Compliance, to provide further answers to questions posed at the briefing on mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much, Madam Chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: You know, adding to what my colleague just said, I'll.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I'll take a few more of those questions that were posed to us.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In particular, there was a few questions that related to what does the Secretariat how does Secretary determine additional resources are needed when mandates are assigned within existing resource mentioned and how is those situations treated?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Just want to mention that in such situations, of course, we consult with all the relevant departments to know whether the implementation can be, you know, can be done within the existing resource, whether it can be absorbed, whether the, you know, synergies can be created with already planned activities and determining if reallocation of resources are, you know, are possible while maintaining the commitments and the deliverables that are supporting them and the delivery already.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Just also want to mention that we understand and also from this dialogue that happened last week that, you know, often when there is such mention, it is also a way for the for the Member States to convey to the Secretariat that the expectation is that such a new mandate would not have a lot of additional activities or costly activities associated to it.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It would not consume significant resources and therefore, you know, it would be implementing through leveraging the resources that are already available or have been planned for other activities and build synergies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: There was a few questions and I'll answer on aspects of what I would call budgetary techniques that could be used to simplify or use anticipation for a more efficient budgetary process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I think that there was a mention, for example, of the concept of threshold.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Whether using threshold to say, under a certain threshold, for example, there is no need to go and present pbis or above a certain threshold, there is the understanding that there wouldn't always be a PBI and there wouldn't be no absorption possible.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So this is not something that we have in place, but it could be something that we can think about with criteria that makes sense so that we avoid ambiguity, a moment of the negotiation of the creation of the mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Also a technique that so far is only used in one area, which could be the inclusion of provision for future program budget implications at the time of preparation of the proposed program budget so that to streamline the mandate resourcing process in, you know, today we are including in the budget only things that have already been approved by Member States without anticipating possible approval.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The only area where we do that is on renewal of certain mandates for human rights and we call that the consolidation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It's been in place now for a few years and it's proven to be quite a useful tool.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It lowers the amount of PBIS that have to be presented in the fall.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And certainly that is a tool that I think could be also an idea that could be considered on the aspect of the mandate creation process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: There was, I think my colleague already mentioned, you know, how much the addition of tools, the registry of tools that help identifying what's already available not only within the Secretariat is being done, but across the UN system will be extremely useful because today we are not really in a capacity to provide that one is about the mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Also, global information of the funding of those mandates is not necessarily available for the UN system, but we should look into how those tools could be enriched with that information so that at the moment of mandate creation, you have access to this information, but that is not a function that is currently happening within the Secretariat and which is not really resourced neither.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So that would be something to be looked into.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: There was also questions related to the possibility we have to understand budgetary implications or that Member States have to understand budgetary implication earlier in the drafting and negotiation process for new mandate, for example, at the stage of the zero draft, rather than waiting at the end of the process when you have more of a final resolution, and that we formally cost it.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So, of course, you know, we could imagine a mechanism where throughout the negotiation there is a support of the Secretariat in terms of the costing of the drafts as they are.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: But again, that is one area where today that is not yet how it is being done and how it's being resourced, neither to have a dedicated team that could accompany Member States throughout the different revisions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: That is an idea that is worth exploring, knowing that it would probably have a cost, but it might be worth it because then it would help creating better mandates, probably, or mandates that are calibrated to what the expectations of Member States are.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So that was an idea that we also wanted to mention as possible to explore.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Madam Chair, I think I will stop here, but of course available for more answers.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much, Mr. Moliere.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I now invite Ms. Mintuvan, co founder and Chief Executive of Project Starling, to provide further answers to questions posed at the briefing on mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much, Madam Chair, and thank you all for being here and for inviting me back to brief you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It's a real privilege.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thought the engagement that we had last week was really energizing, and it was great to see so much thought from all of you in engagement in this really critical subject.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I want to thank especially to those of you who asked such fantastic questions to those of us on the panel.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And I'm grateful to be back here to help you think this through.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As I'd mentioned, I was asked to lead the first UN mandate review 20 years ago when I worked in the office of Secretary General Kofi Annan.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And it was an ambitious task and to do.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So I had to form a team.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And it was a team of about 20, maybe a bit more than that, that included UN staff, including retirees that we pulled back in, student interns to read through UN resolutions, manually type into a database to create the registry, and then people to also look at the, to do the analysis.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And as part of that effort, I personally interviewed everyone I possibly could throughout the Secretariat, Every chief of staff, policy or planning director, head of office, anyone across the system in New York at least, who was willing, this was before zoom, who was willing to meet with me to understand how the UN really worked and how we could help make it work better.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And this culminated in our own mandate registry that we created in 2005, 2006, and an intergovernmental review of all mandates older than five years.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And it totaled over 9,000.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: That meant that some resolutions had more than one mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: But I do want to just emphasize that part of the challenge back then was the mandate creation process itself.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And maybe that is indicative of the challenge that you have here, because the World Summit outcome which gave the mandate to conduct a mandate review, I quote, and this is the World summit outcome in 2005.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The mandate was, we resolved to strengthen and update the program of work of the United nations so that it, it responds to the contemporary requirements of Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To this end, the General assembly and other relevant organs will review all mandates older than five years, originating from resolutions of the General assembly and other organs which would be complementary to the existing periodic reviews of activities.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So the original mandate for that 2006 mandate review was to review all mandates older than five years.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So it was not because the Member States decided to take a different path.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This was the mandate that they had given, that you all had given yourselves back then.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And so what I learned from those discussions is really what I bring to this.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I'm not an expert on management reform, at least not anymore.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I haven't worked on it in over 10 years.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Or am I versed in how the Secretariat currently manages the budgets, which you already have the Secretary of Staff here to do?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: But I did speak to many UN evaluation experts and many, many people, including heads of offices and chiefs of staff throughout the system.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: When we last met, a number of Member states asked me how this mandate implementation review can be successful where the previous one had fallen short.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And I think the first one is that you are not bound by a mandate that you all had issued yourselves to review past mandates, but that you actually have the flexibility now and the opportunity to look forward, to try to figure out and really fix the mandate creation, delivering and review cycle.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: One of you had noted last time that we have the tools today that the team in 2005 and six were unable to offer.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Chief among them, you have artificial intelligence that can ease the burdens of technical detail.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: You also have a much more advanced mandate resource registry that, as you've heard from Ms. Suzuki, that the Secretariat has created.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As I mentioned, 20 years ago, we also had a mandate registry that was manually populated, and Member States found in those consultations that the mandates that we identified lacked and evaluative and budgetary information.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And it sounds like that is still a challenge.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: How then can we make sure that today's mandate Registry provides you, the Member States, with the information that you need?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: What information does it currently provide?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Right now, as you've heard, the mandate Registry allows you to search information on almost 4,000 active mandates that parts of the UN system are citing in their program budget requests.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: You can search by organ, body, implementing entity, title or subject matter.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So, as an example, if you look at the issue of debt relief, for instance, because especially we're only four months after the fourth International Conference on Financing for Development, which I was involved in, debt relief was obviously a big issue in FFD this year if Member States were considering a new resolution on debt relief.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: If you look through the current mandate registry, a quick search shows you that there are 18 existing mandate source documents issued by two UN organs and cited 38 times by 15 UN entities.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This is useful.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Member States can use this information to inform future mandates and see what requests have already made, what you have already asked for in terms of debt relief, and then to shape what you might do in the future.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: However, does this information allow for a review of past or existing mandates?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This is a question that a few of you asked last time.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: What information would you need to consider and decide on to either streamline or decide that the mandate is complete?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: If I were the one undertaking this exercise, I would want to know what actions were taken to implement the mandate that you issued before.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I'd want to know what those actions achieved and whether it was what you had originally intended.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I'd want to know what the impact was and where the effort fell short, and why, and what could be done to make it better next time.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Some of this information may be hard to get, and in fact, we know that in general, impact is hard to measure, but we're still better off in trying to measure it.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I would want to know this information, and lastly, I'd want to know how much it cost and Again, I'm not an expert on the UN's current budgeting and management, but in my conversations with Secretary of Staff and I think what you've just heard here is that that's not available and it doesn't appear to currently be available.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And I recognize it's a huge task.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So it's okay.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I mean, you have a, you've done a gargantuan task in a very short period of time.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: But it's why I urge you to consider improving the UN's ability to evaluate its work and to provide that information back to you in a clear and coherent way so that you can make meaningful decisions on your mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The mandate review tools as they exist don't automatically make, I think a backwards looking mandate easier because you don't have the information to know what happened on your past mandates, the impact that it had and what then, whether it achieved the objectives and whether they can be improved.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So then how can we make this process successful?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: What's needed currently, it would help to have improved evaluation of mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This is something that I mentioned last time, what I've seen, even though I'm not, as I mentioned, an evaluation expert, but just talking to experts and really trying to understand this.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And again, I did this many years ago, but right now it seems that the UN does not adequately finance evaluation, especially as compared to best practices.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In our last meeting I suggested that perhaps 1% of the UN's budget was put towards evaluation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And again that number needs to be fact checked because the information, I base that on a cursory review, but I may not have access to the right sources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: But other institutions and best practices says that we should budget about 3 to 10% of a program to adequate program evaluation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: One way for Member States to address this is to carve out funding for mandates evaluation or to designate in a PBI a program budget implication a certain percentage for rigorous self and independent evaluation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The benchmarks and criteria for evaluation could also be identified in the mandate creation process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Perhaps Member States could request the Secretary to prepare and present criteria for evaluation of a mandated program and the impact as well as importantly the timeline for execution.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I think you've also just heard from the Secretary that they would prefer to have that as well.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And remember, and as I remember it, the budget process looks at inputs, outputs and outcomes.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: But I wonder, could that be applied to specific specific mandates and then done in a rigorous way so that you have the information you need?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Institutionalizing improved evaluation, making that information available to Member States would be a solid step towards helping you all be better custodians of your mandates and make informed decisions on both future mandates and older ones.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: A final thought for me is that, you know, I've been using the term mandates, as we all have, essentially as a proxy for what the UN or the Secretariat works on.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I think really that's what we mean.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: What does the UN do?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Because mandates, at the end of the day, are political decisions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandates indicate you, the member states, your intentions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: What you budget towards them, whether it's existing resources or not, also indicates your intentions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Someone has to turn the outcome of your political negotiations, these mandates, into programs and budgets.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This is why so many mandates repute repeat language, resolution after resolution.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: What it basically means that I think it's an expression of the emphasis that you put on that topic and not necessarily a duplication of activities.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We spent time reading through mandates 20 years ago, and we didn't reduce or eliminate many mandates because the mandates express important intentions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: If we really want to review what the UN does to know if they are outdated or duplicative activities, we may wish to consider reviewing the UN's mandated programs themselves.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And there I'd look to, first of all, reports.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I think the Secretariat has identified that as a ripe area for your examination.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: These massive volumes of reports especially burden the smallest member state missions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I understand and appreciate the very good question that one distinguished representative last week raised about whether shorter mandates mean less staff time spent writing them.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And as I did last time, I'll end with a quote here.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Philosopher and mathematician Blaise Pascal said, quote, I would have written you a short letter, but I did a shorter letter, but I did not have the time.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As many writers know, being clear and concise very often requires much more effort than writing something longer because it takes time to cut excess and to distill what you mean to say.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: If you all want clearer information, you could have better evaluation and much clearer and, I think, shorter reporting.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And thank you to all of the briefers for your willingness to return to answer the questions that were posed to you by working group members, but also for the commitment that you have shown in preparing some of that material in writing, which, of course, as Ambassador Wallace mentioned, is available on the UNAT website.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I now open the floor for working group members to share your views on mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We hope to hear from you ideas and proposals to make mandate creation more efficient, effective and impactful.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Delegations are asked to keep their interventions to 5 minutes for groups and 3 minutes for individual delegations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: If you are speaking for a Group, please identify yourself to the Secretariat.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I now have the honour to give the floor to the Permanent Representative of Iraq.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Distinguished Delegates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I have the honor to deliver this statement on behalf of the group of 77 and China, except the delegation of the Republic of Azerbaijan.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Upon its request at the onset.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Group thanks the Co Chairs of the Informal Ad Hoc Group Working Group on the Review of the Mandate Implementation for sharing the tentative schedule of meetings for the next two months.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Given the integrated nature of all three stages of of the mandate life cycle creation, implementation and review, the Group trusts that written inputs on these stages will be evaluated holistically in the entire life cycle to ensure a coherent and balanced approach.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Group also seeks further clarification regarding the request for input, as there is not yet a common understanding of the final outcome of the ad hoc Working Group and whether it will take the form of a resolution of recommendation, a statement or any type of outcome document.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We would also appreciate clarity on the process and framework through which the suggested input will be considered.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Group reiterates the importance of accelerating the creation of a comprehensive registry of existing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: These registries should include detailed information on the cost of the mandate, the staff assigned to them and their nationality distribution.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Such transparency will allow Member States to make better informed assessments and decisions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Group reaffirmed that any review of mandate creation must remain firmly within the purview of the Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Secretariat's operational discretion must be exercised strictly within the established intergovernmental framework.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It is equally important that the process ensure full and equal participation of all Member States, including developing countries, taking into account capacity constraints and avoiding a hasty or selective approach.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Clear and unambiguous mandates from intergovernmental bodies provide the most solid foundation for the Secretary's successful implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandate texts are political instruments agreed upon by Member States and this review process should not result in the erosion of the substantive content or negotiated language that embody the collective will of the Member States on the use of new technology, including artificial intelligence.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Group recognizes their potential to improve efficiency.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: However, such tools should be used to supplement the human dimension of intergovernmental work.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The personal accountability of UN staff in supporting Member States remain essential.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The use of AI tool without adequate safeguard, privacy and security guarantees and a comprehensive understanding could pose risk, including bias, monopolization, loss of no ones and and distortion of negotiated outcome.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Group reiterates that mandates must be supported by adequate and predictable resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: More clarity is required to understand the downstream implications of having the establishment of new mandate being conditions on the availability of resources, on granting The Secretary General discretionary flexibility to reassign or merger tasks.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Such design features should not undermine the intergovernmental nature of United nations or weaken its operational effectiveness and credibility.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Group considered that we need to find a common understanding between Member States and the Secretariat on the scope and implications of the phrasing within existing resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To conclude, the Group reiterates its commitment to engage constructively in this process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We emphasize that discussions on mandate creation must remain inclusive, transparent and efficient, ensuring full participation of all Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of Iraq and I now give the floor to the representative of Azerbaijan.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Madam. Thank you, Madam Chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, we thank the Co Chairs for convening this important meeting and acknowledge the significance of the subject under discussion.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: However, our delegation is compelled to take the floor on a point of order concerning the statement just being delivered by the delegation of Iraq on behalf of the group of 77 and China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We wish to clarify that our objection is strictly procedural and we do so with the utmost respect for all Member States of the group of 77 and China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Without expressing any position on the substantive content.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We state that this statement has not been agreed upon in accordance with established procedures within the Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Azerbaijan has formally opposed its delivery due to the reason explained to the Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: While the delegation of Iraq began by stating that they speak, I quote, on behalf of the group of 77 and China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Accept the delegation of the Republic Azerbaijan upon its request.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We must point out that this formulation doesn't reflect the reality.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Our delegation emphasized that such a statement can only be made on behalf of the Group following the successful completion of the Group's internal procedures and with a consensus of all its members.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you, Madam Chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of Azerbaijan and I now give the floor to the representative of the European Union, to be followed by the representative of the Solomon Islands.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Go ahead.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Distinguished Co. Chairs, Distinguished colleagues, I have the honor to deliver this statement on behalf of the European Union and its member states.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The candidate countries, Turkey and North Macedonia, Montenegro, Ukraine, the Republic of Moldova, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Georgia, as well as Armenia, Andorra, Monaco and San Marino, align themselves with the Statement on Mandate Creation, a topic of today.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We must acknowledge that effective mandates demand effective design and have full visibility across the entire mandate system, which includes what mandates already exist on the same or related topics, who and how is implementing them and with what results.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Therefore, we welcome measures designed to first amplify the overall impact and sustainability of new mandates and eliminate implementation ambiguities.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This should be done through the adoption of concise action oriented and outcome driven language, the implementation and impact of mandates should be measurable and system wide evaluation will be critical.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, introduce sunset clauses with a robust mechanism for periodic review to minimize perpetual extensions and ensure mandates evolve or conclude in alignment with their objectives, as well as review clauses to ensure that regular assessment and evaluation of the relevance and efficiency of the mandates can take place.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, accompany the creation of new mandates in the UN system with clear resource estimates, timely and transparent program budget implications from the very start.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fourth, strengthen a culture of efficiency and responsibility on mandate resourcing by exploring all options on resource allocation and then make sure that new mandates leading to new activities can be funded by the required corresponding resources and with appropriate oversight as a prerequisite for new mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fifth, further implement comprehensive digital mandate registries, including by an open, transparent and trustworthy use of artificial intelligence to conduct a preliminary review and gain full awareness of active mandates to maximize mandate coordination, clear roles, responsibilities and impact, and eliminate duplication in the creation of new ones.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also encourage the Secretariat to identify and put forward rationalizations in terms of mandate execution among Secretariat entities every time mandates allow it Colleagues the European Union and its Member States strongly support the Secretary General's efforts to enhance mandate visibility and coordination across mandating bodies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To ensure effective implementation, the Secretary General must be able to act with appropriate flexibility.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Therefore, we welcome greater secretarial support to Member States during mandate creation without establishing new bodies or structures, and encourage the Secretary General to assign tasks according to comparative advantages and resource availability across the UN system to ensure the implementation of agreed mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Colleagues it is US Member States that are responsible for mandate creation and we must guide their design and implementation with transparency, accountability, added value, due diligence, fiscal responsibility and a strong sense of common purpose.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It is therefore important that the work under this work stream also links up with the discussions about structural reforms under Work Stream 3.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also believe that the above criteria and lessons learned from earlier processes should also inform in due course the review of existing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In conclusion, we appreciate the opportunity to engage in this important discussion and welcome the Secretary General's proposals and vision under the UNAID Reform Initiative.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As members of the Organization, we encourage further ambitious proposals from the Secretariat and remain committed to sustaining the momentum and ensuring continued ownership of this process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Chairs we will also submit a more detailed written version of our input.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of the European Union and I now give the floor to the Representative of the Solomon Islands, to be followed by Belize

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Co Chairs, Excellencies and Distinguished Colleagues.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I have the honor to deliver this statement on behalf of the Pacific Islands Forum members based in New York, we welcome the opportunity that the UN 80 reform initiative offers to build a United nations that is more effective, efficient, accountable and capable of responding to contemporary needs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We as Member States must seize this opportunity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We want to thank the Co Chairs for an informative briefing on mandate creation on 13 October.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: PIF members are optimistic about the potential benefits to be achieved by improving how mandates are created at the structural level and see three key areas for improvement.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, we want to reduce duplication and inefficiencies in mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We note that most PIF members find the volume of the UN's work program to be highly demanding, especially given the size and capacities of many PIF missions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Small countries are the ones that suffer most from from a lack of discipline in the system as it takes away our attention from the most pressing issues to us, such as the 2030 Development Agenda and focusing on special needs of SIDS like sea level rise and fighting climate change.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Negotiating on the same things in multiple forums is a waste of precious resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, it's in everyone's interest to have a shorter, more focused resolutions with clearer and targeted mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To achieve this, we recognize that we need to give the Secretariat more flexibility on how they deliver on mandates we have created, whilst being clear that it's for Member States to set out what we want to achieve.
