session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We encourage the Secretariat to operate in a way that's more mindful of the limitations of small missions, for example by producing shorter and more focused reports.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, everyone but particularly small states will benefit from some established tools for lead sponsors of resolutions that enable us to draft more efficient and effective mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We welcome the development and expansion of a comprehensive mandate registry which will help us avoid duplication.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: But we also need tools to support mandate design, particularly when it comes to things like resourcing, costing and evaluation, where the words used in the mandate really matter.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, we want to highlight the importance of the UN development system for the Pacific island countries, along with coordination with existing regional architecture and the need for review that supports building a system that is fit for purpose for tackling our unique and urgent challenges.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We look forward to engaging collaboratively with Member States throughout this process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you Co Chairs,

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of the Solomon Islands and I now give the floor to the representative of Belize, to be followed by Australia.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I have the honor to deliver the statement on behalf of the 14 members of the Caribbean Community CARICOM and align our remarks with the statement delivered by Iraq on behalf of the group of 77 and China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We thank the co facilitators and briefers for the information session on mandate creation, which provide valuable insight into the first stage of mandate cycle.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also wish to thank the co facilitators for the helpful webpage and calendar of forthcoming sessions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Key takeaways from our recent exchange on mandate creation include that the entire mandate life cycle creation, implementation and review should be considered as one continuum.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The tracking implementation is essential yet remains uneven and unsystematic and that mandate review should be standardized and evidence based, yet it is rarely conducted in practice.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Two further observations are instructive as we plan the future work of this group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, success should be measured should not be measured by the number of mandates discontinued, but by whether the system delivers mandates more effectively and with greater impact and second, we should take a forward looking approach that strengthens how mandates are created, ensuring that decisions are informed by full visibility across the UN system and that future reviews are grounded in credible evaluative data.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Taking these points into account, CARICOM commends the work done on development of the Mandate Registry.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We consider that an immediate and practical step would be to enhance the use and functionality of the UN Regulation Mandate Source Registry.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Registry should evolve into a genuine visibility and learning tool, one that allows Member States to see existing mandates across the system, understand overlaps and identify the opportunities for synergy.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In that context, we support embedded a structured feedback mechanism to strengthen its utility to delegations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The G77's proposal on the categories of data to be maintained are particularly valuable.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: CARICOM notes that the Secretary General's report and Ms. Pham's briefing emphasize the importance of evidence informed policymaking.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We agree and would support the initiatives that strengthen evaluation capacity across the UN system, including modest dedicated budget lines for independent and internal evaluations at the point of mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: While our intelligence can assist with consolidating publicly available information and enhancing the Registry, CARICOM cautions against delegating or automating any form of critical policy analysis or assessment.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Such responsibilities must remain under the authority of Member States and, where relevant, the Secretariat.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: With full respect for intergovernmental oversight and processes regarding Secretariat's role, we recognize that it already provides technical support to Member States as needed.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We welcome the Secretary General's proposals to improve Secretariat assistance during mandate creation, especially to provide complementary information on related programmatic activities and resources, but underscore that this function must remain strictly technical and non prescriptive, upholding the intergovernmental character of of decision making.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandate creation should occur based on a number of principles that we must come to agree on these could include demonstrable need, broad support, non duplication, transparency, inclusiveness and a genuine appreciation of the means for their implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: CARICOM reiterates that mandates must be accompanied by adequate unpredictable resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This is not only a matter of principle but of good governance.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In closing, CARICOM reaffirms its appreciation to the co facilitators for their leadership and reiterates our commitment to engage constructively in this process to ensure that the UN continues to serve people and planet efficient effectively and equitably.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you, I thank the Representative of Belize and I now give the floor to the Permanent Representative of Australia, to be followed by Kuwait.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you Chairs for creating the opportunity for an inclusive and collaborative consultation on mandate creation and the informative briefing organised last week.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I speak for Canada, New Zealand and my own delegation, Australia.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As Member States, we are committed to the United Nations Charter and upholding the fundamental work of the United nations system.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We welcome this opportunity to reflect on how Member States create mandates and the impact this has on the effectiveness of critical work of the United Nations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: CANS highlights the following points to be considered as we focus on principles and actions to guide mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We need shorter, more focused resolutions with clearer and more targeted mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This will both increase the likelihood that mandates will be actively and effectively implemented and reduce current workloads.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: While we'll need to be clear in what we're asking, we see merit in providing the Secretariat with some flexibility on exactly how they deliver on these mandates to ensure they can do so in the most efficient and effective way possible.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We need more support from the Secretariat to empower Member States to make more informed decisions when drafting resolutions to ensure that mandates avoid duplication and effectively complement relevant work taking place across the United nations system.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We welcome tools such as the comprehensive online Mandate Registry being developed by the Secretariat that can support this, including assisting the lead sponsors of resolutions to draft better mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: There are other tools that could be provided to support mandate design, such as those which institute more effective and efficient drafting.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We need mandates with built in evaluation and review clauses and where appropriate, sunset clauses.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And we need to reduce the number of resolutions introduced year after year with substantially the same content.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We all have an interest in not spending precious time and resources on resolutions that have stopped having any real meaning or relevance.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We must exercise discipline and restraint in making proposals that have resource implications for the United nations core budget, particularly in the current financial context if new resources are required to implement a new proposal, appropriate offsets should also be identified.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: All resolutions should include a dedicated section clearly addressing these budget issues.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Key to this effort is the need better to link mandate decisions with projected costs and to enhance efficiencies in implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Member States must demonstrate maximum restraint in proposing new mandates and a sustained commitment to ensuring the limited resources are directed where they're most needed.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We should also ensure synergies with existing processes related to mandates and take the opportunity to implement and advance work conducted under the General assembly revitalization process Sometimes overlaps between mandates can be helpful in supporting strong implementation, but often we experience wasteful duplication.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We need to eliminate unnecessary duplication of similar mandates within and across various forums.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, while it's appropriate that this ad hoc Working Group focus on the principles guiding mandate creation, implementation and review, we also need to reach agreement on the actions required to apply these principles in practice.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: CAANS proposes the following concrete actions for Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, include time bound provisions or mandate review clauses in new resolutions as appropriate appropriate.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, take steps to reduce unnecessary PBIS or establishment of new costly mandates without identifying appropriate offsets.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, ensure new mandates are linked to the core pillars of the United nations and advance tangible outcomes.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fourth, set and adhere to page limits for new resolutions and ensure these are targeted for maximum effect.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fifth, avoid duplication of mandates within and across forums six, promote multiannual mandates as the default for recurring resolutions and which do not substantively change from year to year and finally, review mandates that have not been active within the past 10 years.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: These actions could be reflected in a new template or guidance for the drafting resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As we've stated previously, the primary responsibility for achieving a UN system capable of delivering on the outcomes our people expect and deserve lies with us, the Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We look forward to engaging further with Member States through the Working Group and working towards an effective reform process that results in a resilient and sustainable UN system able to deliver effectively on all three foundational pillars of its work and into the future.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

text: Allow me first just one observation that I think is fair and that is that over time the United nations system increasingly has evolved into one that reacts to a growing volume of sort of one way requirements from intergovernmental processes and from interagency processes.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Now these requests mandates are often well intentioned, but they have often also become micro mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: They are narrow, they give fragmented instructions that cumulatively this erodes coherence, it erodes efficiency and it erodes strategic alignment across the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So overall I do believe we need a culture change in order to strengthen coherence in mandate creation and implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The UN system should transform itself or transition from a request based responsive model to a more focused on operational viability in which the organization acts on the basis of member State agree strategic direction rather than fragmented smaller requests.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So, but to be practical, we have very good proposed solutions in the Secretary General's report on mandate design.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So we fully endorse that.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And now we should also look at what Member States can do when creating mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And despite what you said, Mintu, we do like the idea of shorter texts.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Wherever it's possible, that should be a goal in itself and perhaps we could even go further could we agree on a voluntary basis for a sort of target length that would be the maximum for a resolution or a text.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: You could also have a sort of automatically triggered PBI if the text was too long.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So that should could be useful.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: But more seriously, I think we need to perhaps establish a checklist that we all look at before we create mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Now, this is very much inspired, but what we as Norwegian civil servants have to do, anytime the Norwegian government should propose to do something, we need to make sure what the purpose and the scope of the action is.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We have to confirm that there is no duplication in how, that no one else is doing what we're proposing to be done.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: There needs to be a clear time frame.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: There needs to be proof of financial sustainability and impact assessment and always also an inbuilt evaluation or review mechanism from the very creation of a mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So I mean to be discussed in detail, but I think we need some sort of checklist that all those that propose mandates need to go through and show to the rest of us that this is thought through to be within the Charter, to be.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To have thought about that it's not duplicated by anyone else.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And then thirdly, perhaps we should refrain from mandating new tasks which are not backed by corresponding resources or an explicit reduction in other mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So on a trial basis, could we agree that we don't request any new reports from the Secretary General for one year, only modify the scope of existing reports?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It's possible we can decide this and then just finally, I think our colleague from Costa Rica mentioned at the briefing last week that we could have a test to evaluate mandates, whether they are similar.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: You could, for example, test to see, well, this mandate that we had agreed on in the past before we agree on a new one.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Well, how many countries actually spoke in the debate on that mandate?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: How many times was the.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The report downloaded from the UN website?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We could do all things like this before we, before we request new mandates or new things for the Secretariat to do.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So all this and more will come to you in writing.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Norway.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to the United Kingdom, to be followed by the Russian Federation Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you for your leadership of this ad hoc working group and for convening last week's briefing.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The UK supports Jamaica and New Zealand's vision for the discovery phase, taking time to gather Member States views, clarify priorities and build the evidence base.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And I think we've heard already today a lot of interesting ideas in this regard.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As set out previously, we strongly support UN80 as a critical opportunity to refocus the organization on its three core pillars.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As we consider the Secretary General's proposals, we should maintain high ambition and encourage creativity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This Working Group's central focus is to develop a common set of principles that would apply to future mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As long as we set the bar high.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: That approach will help us reduce duplication, ensure effective implementation of mandates, free up resources for priority areas, and ideally reduce the burden on Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Expanding and improving the Registry of existing mandates will also be important to enable a process of review and streamlining, and we welcome the update from the Secretariat on this issue.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In the Inaugural Session of this Working Group, USG Rider updated us on the Secretary General's proposals on mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Operationalizing these proposals, including how to ensure improved Secretariat support for Member States, will be key.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I understand the Co Chairs are in the market for ideas and in that spirit I would propose that the Secretariat could do more to enhance the visibility of complementary work streams.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This could include producing analysis to help Member States determine the utility of a mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: For example, the Secretariat might produce a short operational note circulated to Member States at the start of a negotiation process that details existing relevant work, particularly mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Drawing on the Registry identifies gaps to determine additional mandated activity that might add value and highlights potential budgetary implications and possible efficiencies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Collectively, we should consider enhanced use of modern technology to drive forward efficiency, including to identify duplication and reduce the length of mandate text.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This will require oversight, but early investment here will pay off for us all.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We are open to further ideas, including the possibility of word limits, while noting the need to safeguard normative standards.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, we should acknowledge that many mandates are driven by political considerations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: While the Secretariat can help promote governance coherence across the UN system, it is incumbent on us all as Member States to design mandates that prioritize utility, efficiency and impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the Distinguished Representative of the United Kingdom.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor to the Distinguished Representative of the Russian Federation, to be followed by Switzerland.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Dear Co Facilitators, the Russian Federation supports efforts aimed at enhancing transparency and coordination in the formulation of mandates and including the development of comprehensive registries and such tool can facilitate access to information and help avoid duplication.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I think this is the main target of the UN 80 which is pronounced in the resolution 79, 318, but it should be provided that it remains fully under Member State supervision.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I think many Member States stated it today and it should be used exclusively for informational purposes without prejudice to the right of the Member States to submit proposals for consideration.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: That's important qualifier.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We recognize the value of drafting mandates that are consigned, action oriented, but must never come at the expense of substantive content or negotiated language.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandate texts are political instruments, expression of political will and they cannot be simplified or reformulated through administrative or technical means.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As to new technologies such as artificial intelligence that could strengthen efficiency and better support Member States during meetings or during drafting mandates, we underline that those technologies cannot alter any personal accountability of UN staff which must be fully at the disposal of Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Support Member States if and when requested, but cannot shift any responsibility to AI.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Russia welcomes proposals to improve the presentation of financial and programmatic information accompanying new mandates as this enhances transparency in decision making.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Separate identification of voluntary financed activities or planned voluntary financed activities is very important.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: However, we are firmly opposed to any ideas that could condition the adoption of new mandates or resource availability on resource availability or grant the Secretary General discretionary flexibility for assign or merge tasks across entities as proposed by the sg.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Such measures would erode the intergovernmental nature of the organizations, which is, I think, supported by almost all speakers here today.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of the Russian Federation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to Switzerland, to be followed by Japan.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Distinguished Co Chairs Switzerland thanks you for convening this important meeting and in particular your careful calibration of the proceedings of this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandate creation is essential to the UN's ability to deliver.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We need clear and coherent mandates that build on existing expertise and avoid unnecessary overlap.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Co Chairs, allow me to make the following comments.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, Switzerland welcomes the use and development of new tools as outlined in par 23 of the report, in particular the Mandate Registry which enhances transparency and the suggestion of carefully using AI and other digital technologies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We take good note of your follow up document that was circulated in writing as well as the briefing provided this morning that indicates that the Registry can cover all mandating bodies serviced by the UN Secretariat and we welcome that session.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, we support stronger Secretariat assistance during mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This may include systematic provision of information on potential overlaps.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In addition, we see merit in shorter mandate texts and longer mandate cycles.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, we welcome and support the recommendation made in para 29 to enable the Secretary General to reassign tasks between UN entities to ensure maximum efficiency based on comparative advantages and resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this context, allow me the following could this matter, which partly also touches on mandate delivery, be addressed and discussed at the ceb?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, new mandates must be adequately financed, as was also mentioned in para 29, an indicative price tag or Resource estimate should be introduced earlier, early in the negotiation process to provide guidance to Member States in their deliberations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Switzerland.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to the distinguished representative of Japan, to be followed by India.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Madam and Mr. Co Chairs, thank you very much for giving me the floor.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As this is the first time for this delegation to take the floor, I would like to express express our sincere appreciation to you both Co Chairs for taking up this important role.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I would like to assure you of this delegation's full support and cooperation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In the un, we have seen an increased number of mandates over the years, often created without sufficient consideration for overlap with existing mandates or their financial implications.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This unchecked expansion has contributed significant duplications and budget growth which are ultimately unsustainable.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: There are two ways to address this.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, when establishing new mandates, we must ensure there is no duplication with existing ones.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, we should consider budgetary implications, including setting budgetary ceiling to introduce financial discipline.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, Japan would like to propose three key actions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, it is essential that Member States be able to systematically verify whether any newly proposed mandate overlaps with existing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We welcome the SCG's intention to set up registry designed in the manner that allows such verification to be conducted with a simple one click process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, when the resolution includes a new mandate which may incur budgetary implications, the proposing Member States should consult with the same secretariat and provide clear written information on the budgetary implications to all Members.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, as proposed in the SDG's report, all resolutions creating new mandates should include expiry clauses requiring the mandate to be reviewed and renewed after a certain period in order to prevent unchecked and unlimited mandate expansion.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The same principle should also apply to existing mandates which we will discuss further when we take up the mandate review phase.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We believe that these steps will strengthen the UN's ability to deliver its mandate more effectively and sustainably.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Japan.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to the distinguished representative of India, to be followed by Iran.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Excellency, Mr. Co Chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Let me begin by thanking the Co Chairs of the Ad Hoc Working Group for convening today's important meeting and sharing the calendar of forthcoming meetings.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also appreciate the Co Chairs for the briefing organized earlier this month and look forward to the upcoming briefings.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also thank all the briefers for their valuable presentations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: India aligns with the statement delivered by the representative of Iraq on behalf of G770 China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Allow me to highlight five points in my national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, for comprehensive visibility of the mandate landscape, it is essential that online mandate registries provide additional information on each mandate, including reporting cycles, costing since mandate creation, implementing partner, etc. To facilitate effective and efficient action by Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, we recognize the importance of using AI tools with necessary safeguards to identify duplicative mandates and duplicative implementing architecture across mandating bodies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, information on the existing AI tools available with the circuit will be helpful.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Additional features such as evaluating mandates may by their impact and effectiveness could be added later to assist Member States in designing more effective, concise and non duplicative mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, without prejudice to any mandate, it is essential that all mandates include sunset clauses for effective implementation, monitoring, transition and eventual exit.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It will also facilitate plugging any systemic automaticity in the budget preparation process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fourth, a Christmas tree approach to mandate creation dilutes both impact and accountability framework.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Often it increases the length of mandate text.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Additionally, it demands greater coordination across implementing entities, thus necessitating more resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We consider a plain vanilla approach should guide mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Such approach could shorten length of the text, ensure effective implementation and produce greater impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fifth, since all three stages of mandate life cycle are interconnected, Member States should be allowed to submit written inputs on three stages after all briefings are completed.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Such flexibility can yield holistic and practical insight to guide our work throughout the entire mandate life cycle and deliver ambitious outcomes.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In conclusion, Mr. Co Chair, India reaffirms its commitment to remain constructively engaged in this process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of India.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Give the floor.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Noted Representative of Iran,

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Bismillahirrahman Ar Rahim thank you, Co Chairs Excellencies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: My delegation wishes to express its appreciation for organizing the briefings and for the opportunities to engage further on the issue of mandate implementation review.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: My delegation aligns with the statement delivered by Representative of Iraq on behalf of Group 77 and China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The task before this Ad hoc Working Group is critical and important in our endeavors towards the review of mandate implementation in our organization.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Having in mind the fact that the mandates have been and are being created by Member States through various mechanisms and forums, ranging from conventions, protocols, agreements to decisions and resolutions in the UN relevant bodies and Executive Boards, we believe that mandate implementation review must focus on exploring the ways and means to enhance efficiency, effectiveness and strengthening, not redefining the UN's intergovernmental mandate create implementation in this regard.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First and foremost we need to agree on the scope of our deliberations and the format of expected outcome of this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Given the integrated nature of mandate cycle, any written submission needs to be considered after completion of discussions on the entire life cycle, including creation, implementation and review of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, any review of mandate creation must remain firmly within the purview of Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The process must ensure full and equal participation of all Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, while reiterate that the clear mandate that the clear mandates from intergovernmental bodies provide solid foundation for UN system and their successful implementation, we emphasized that the mandates are agreed by Member States and cannot be simplified, reformulated, merged or reinterpreted through administrative, technical or technological means.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This exercise must never come at the expense of substantive content or negotiated language.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In conclusion, Co Chairs, my delegation wishes to assure of all constructive engagement for fruitful deliberation and outcome of this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you Ran. I give the floor now to Indonesia to be followed by Moldova.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: At the outset, Indonesia appreciate continued engagement by you, including by convening series of meetings and inviting relevant resource people to our meetings.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The presentations help provide us with broader view of the context and linkages among different aspect of our discussion in this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So Co Chairs and distinguished delegates allow us to share our two views on the continuation of this process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, we need to ensure coherence between the UNHE Initiative with other relevant processes.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This Working Group meets at a time when all committees are actively negotiating their solutions, each with the potential to create new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Yet, our core task here is to review, not to multiply mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Therefore, our ongoing work must be well coordinated with other parallel processes so that no new mandates are created inadvertently before this review is accomplished.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In addition, we are also of the view that a consolidated timeline and work plan among work streams are critical.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We take note of progress from other work streams, including Work Stream 3, which report was recently issued.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: While taking notes of the importance of the intergovernmental nature to adjust mandate, the suggestions in the report, if implemented, could significantly affect existing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Hence, a consolidated timeline and work plan among the work streams will be crucial.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To avoid overlaps.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Particularly, all tracks must converge back to this Working Group, which screen serve as the intergovernmental forum for the UNHC on mandate implementation review.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, we need to ensure that ambition should always be matched with necessary resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As highlighted in the last briefing, conducting resource analysis from the initial stage of mandate creation would allow Member States to have better visibility.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: These resources entail not only financial resources but also human capital, among others.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this slide, we are of the view that an initial resource review by the initiators, through close coordination with relevant entities should accompany any draft resolution or outcome documents from Day one Co Chairs finally, rest assured of Indonesia's commitment to support you and in this regard, Indonesia will also continue our engagement in this process to ensure this review leads to a UN that is more coherent and truly fits for purpose.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you Co Chairs,

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the Representative of Indonesia and I now give the floor to the Permanent Representative of Moldova, to be followed by Germany.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Distinguished Co Chairs My delegation aligns itself to the European Union statement and wishes to add the following remarks in international capacity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Distinguished Colleagues Mandate creation lies in the head heart of the organization's effectiveness and credibility.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: At the same time, the growing number of complexity of mandates, as highlighted in the Secretary General's report, have created challenges of fragmentation, overlap and limited coordination which risk undermining this very effectiveness.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: From our perspective, this review process is an opportunity to reaffirm several guiding principles for mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, new mandates should be firmly anchored in the Charter and aligned with the Organization's strategic objectives, responding to current realities rather than institutions inertia.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, the mandate should build upon existing efforts, avoiding duplication and maximizing synergies across entities and pillars of United nations system.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, fraud, mandate creation, negotiation and implementation, transparency and accountability must be ensured through clear benchmarks, timelines and reporting mechanisms.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fourth, the review of existing mandates should be institutionalized as a constructive exercise, not for reducing ambition but for ensuring effectiveness, coherence and measurable results.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In reviewing the process of mandate creation, we wish to highlight three critical three key challenges that, in our view, continue to affect the organization's overall performance.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, mandates are generated across multiple UN bodies the General assembly, ecosoc, Human Rights Council, and various specialized agencies, often without sufficient coordination.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This fragmentation leads to duplication, thematic overlap and inconsistent reporting, ultimately with awakening impact and straining the Secretariat's limited capacity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, for many smaller delegations, including my own, the process is constrained by limited visibility and transparency.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Without a united and accessible registry of active mandates, it becomes difficult to track commitments and engage meaningfully in new initiatives.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We therefore support the accelerated development of an integrated digital mandate registry such as mandates.unorg and stronger secretariat support to ensure equal participation of all Member States throughout the mandate cycle.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, there remains a persistent gap between mandate creation and resource allocation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Too often mandates are approved within existing resources, leading to underfunding and inconsistent implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This disconnect undermines for both the credibility of decisions and the impact of UN work on the ground.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Each new mandate should therefore be accompanied by transparent costing and clear program budget implications, ensuring the political ambition is matched by realistic and sustainable resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Looking ahead, we support continued dialogue on practical measures to Strengthen the review of mandate creation process, including greater coherence among mandating bodies, enhanced coordination between the Secretariat and Member States and the use of digital tools to improve transparency and accessibility.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Ultimately, effective mandate creation is not merely of a procedural exercise.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It is a matter of credibility, efficiency and trust.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: By improving how we formulate, design and align mandates, we can ensure that every decision adopted in the organization truly responds to the evolving priorities and need of the people who we serve.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you, I thank the representative of Moldova and I now give the floor to the representative of Germany, to be followed by Costa rica.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We have 22 more speakers, so we'll leave it to you to do the mathematics.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: But Germany, the floor is yours.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Distinguished Co Chairs, Colleagues, Germany fully aligns with a statement made by the eu.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We once again thank you for your leadership and and for organizing the very insightful briefing in our last session.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Building on what we learned, I would like to make three proposals.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, we agree with the assessment of the SG and many delegations that one key challenge is the poor visibility and comparability across mandates and mandating bodies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Here, Member States need more guidance and support.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We propose to introduce a mandatory mandate landscape briefing.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The idea is as a prelude to negotiations of new mandates, there should be an obligation that the Secretariat, together with penholders facilitators, jointly informs the Membership about the overall landscape of existing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We believe that a clearer understanding of potential overlaps between existing and potentially new mandates will have a refraining effect and could lead to to a future reduction of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, in the end, we, the Member States decide how mandates look like it's on us to be more stringent, for example Avoid unnecessary cross references.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We therefore propose that Member States agree to a voluntary code of conduct with the aim of limit the length of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: For instance, a ceiling of 1000 words per mandate could be considered.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This will help to put pressure on delegations to focus on critical operative elements in mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It will also make the implementation of mandates easier and increase their impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, on the better use of technology, we thank the Secretariat for establishing the online UN mandate source registry and for the additional information presented today.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This is a very positive step towards creating a unified UN Registry.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We should collectively think about tools that will make such a registry as useful as possible for all delegations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Germany also supports the idea of using an automized, possibly AI based tool to check resolution mandates text, for example on inconsistencies and duplications.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The final decision, however, obviously remains with Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of Germany and I now give the floor to the representative of Costa Rica, to be followed by Iceland

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Excellencies, Distinguished colleagues.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Costa Rica thanks the Co Chairs for their leadership and inclusive approach.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The work of this group is vital to improving how the United nations delivers on its mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Every mandate is a reflection of our political will to act together.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Translating principles into concrete outcomes by examining how mandates are conceived, coordinated and implemented, we're also refining the way multilateralism works in practice.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this sense, Costa Rica has three observations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We considered that effective mandates are those that move from general aspirations to specific measurable outcomes.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Informal reflections from thematic areas, including disarmament, showed that mandates created with clear objectives, well structured negotiation processes and, when possible, strong capacity building components have greater impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: A deliberate design encompassing a realistic scope and actionable targets ensures that political will is translated into meaningful results.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, leadership and purpose are enablers of effective mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: A successful mandate depends on leadership that can guide diverse perspectives towards a shared purpose.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Skilled chairs and facilitators help shape clarity and balance in negotiations, ensuring that the resulting mandates reflect both ambition and feasibility.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, realism in resource logistics and coordination.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The phrase within existing resources or subject to the availability of resources no longer reflects the complexity of today's institutional environment.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Early engagement with the Secretariat and timely access to operational and budgetary information are essential in all negotiations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: System wide visibility and active coordination can prevent duplication, optimize resources and strengthen delivery.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To conclude, mandates start with US Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: They express our priorities and our commitment to fulfill the purposes and principles of the Charter.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: By working to better align our determination with realism, design, with leadership and purpose, with means, we can make the United nations more effective for the peoples we serve.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of Costa Rica.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And I now give the floor to the representative of Iceland, to be followed by the representative of China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Madam Chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And first, many thanks to Jamaica and New Zealand as Co Chairs of this process, for your strong and inclusive leadership and thanks to all the briefers that have spoken.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: A key element of an effective system is inclusivity and the full participation of all states.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As a small state, we struggle to navigate the plethora of resolutions and processes and multiple lengthy reports.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So I would like to make a few concrete proposals.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Our guiding question is how can we make mandates more impactful and give them the attention they deserve?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The repetition of resolutions on an annual basis carries the risk that important subjects get buried in the routine.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Reducing the number of annual resolutions by reducing the frequency would give more air and attention for those resolutions we are considering, provided that we don't fill the void with new resolutions, fewer resolutions each year should mean more careful consideration of each one.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: How to get there?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We could consider taking thematic groups of of resolutions in each Main Committee and rotating them over several years.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We agree with others who have pointed to sunset clauses and review courses as a way of allowing us to assess at an appropriate point the ongoing relevance and necessity of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We appreciate the work the Secretariat has put into establishing a Mandate Registry.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This tool should be further developed to give Member States the best possible transparency on what mandates already exist, where overlap may occur with new mandates, and so forth.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: AI can be used while ensuring that it meets standards of impartiality.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, we could look at the idea raised at previous meeting of establishing templates for the drafting of resolutions, also referred to by many delegations here today, today, which in concert with stronger secretarial support, would help to strengthen the process of mandate review and creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you, I thank the Permanent Representative of Iceland and I now give the floor to the representative of China, to be followed by the Philippines.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Co Chairs China aligns itself with the statement delivered by Iraq on behalf of the G77 and China at present, the three work streams of the UN80 initiative are becoming interconnected.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: From the overall perspective of UN80 initiative and in light of the topic today on mandate creation, China believes that it is essential to properly handle four key relationships.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, the relationship between streamlining and delivery.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The goal of the Unity Initiative is not to make the UN smaller, but to make it leaner, more agile, more resilient and better able to provide high quality, efficient and direct support and services to Member States while eliminating redundancy and overlap.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The UN should also increase the investment in key areas based on the needs of Member States, particularly developing countries, and promote balanced progress across its three pillars.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Similarly, the purpose of the mandate reform is not to reduce mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We should not bluntly cut mandates, tax reports or meetings simply for the sake of streamlining.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: What we should focus on is the results that such reform would deliver.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We must conduct in depth analysis and make targeted efforts so as to maximize resources, effectiveness in effectiveness and expand the US Overall impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, the relationship between Member States and the Secretariat Mandate creation is both the prerogative and responsibility of the Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandatory reform requires Member States to shoulder their primary responsibility and exercise due diligence from the outset.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: At the same time, the Secretariat should strengthen its support.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To do that, Secretary Staff should be well versed in their respective areas and related fields and provide comprehensive assistance to Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It is also important for various departments and entities within the UN system to break down barriers and enhance coordination and strengthen their communication with Member States, including during the early stages of the work.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: While artificial intelligence can serve as a supplementary role, the Secretariat must ensure robust security safeguards, verification and oversight.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The development of online mandatory registry should be pursued with due consideration of cost effectiveness.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, the relationship between mandate creation and mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandates can only have impact when effectively carried out and their implementation is directly affected by their creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Like fasting the first button on a shirt, Member States must ensure that things are properly done from the very start of mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: When creating mandates, it is imperative to focus on core issues so that the implementation efforts can be well targeted and resource not diluted during mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Providing previous implementation and available financial resources can help Member States better get the general picture and make informed decisions and thus create favorable conditions for for effective implementation of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fourth, and lastly, the relationship between reform and continuity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: While the Unity Initiative should address long standing institutional challenges by fighting formalism and bureaucracy and practicing frugality, it is also crucial to maintain the stability and continuity of the UN's work and preserve the core value of UN, including multilingualism, so as to instill renewed confidence and momentum in multilateralism through concrete actions and results.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Co Chairs China stands ready to work with all Member States and the Secretariat to continue our constructive role in improving the work of the UN and in advancing global governance towards a more just and equitable direction.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you Kyle Chair

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the Representative China and I now give the floor to the Representative of the Philippines, to be followed by Maldives.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you Co Chairs the Philippines aligns itself with the statement of the G77 in China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We appreciate the briefing held on the 13th of October.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We acknowledge the Secretary's role in increasing the visibility of the mandates landscape, including by assisting Member States in identifying potential overlaps and duplications and by developing the online Mandates Registry.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Despite the existence of tools, improving the effectiveness and efficiency of mandates will ultimately depend on Member States who have the ownership of and prerogative over them.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, the Philippines is pleased to share its recent experience on streamlining of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: At the 16 Human Rights Council session, a groundbreaking resolution was adopted to merge the mandates of the Special Rapporteur on Contemporary Forms of Slavery, including its causes and consequences, and the Special Rapporteur on Trafficking in Persons, especially Women and Girls, into one new Special Rapporteur on Contemporary Forms of Slavery and Trafficking in Persons.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Philippines, part of the Core Group on the Mandate on Trafficking in Persons, worked together with the Core Group on the Mandate on Contemporary Forms of slavery to unify the two mandates towards a more agile and integrated response to challenges that are distinct yet strongly linked to each other.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The HRC resolution is considered as a historic first and can be viewed as an example of how with strong strong political will and commitment and shared commitment to improving efficiency and impact, Member States can come together to streamline long established mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
