text: Nevertheless, the Philippines underscores that mandate creation should be guided by the need to address specific challenges improving efficiency and delivering real impact, and should not be driven by cost cutting concerns alone.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Any potential merger of mandates should only be undertaken after a thorough analysis of its implications for the peoples and the communities that we seek to serve.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, for the work of the informal ad hoc Working Group, the Philippines likewise recommends working closely with other UN organs and processes in Geneva, Vienna, Nairobi and other duty stations for possible exchange of best practices and lessons learned on strengthening officials efficiencies and impact of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of the Philippines and I now give the floor to the representative of Maldives to be followed by Mexico.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Maldives, the floor is yours.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you Coaches. The Maldives alliance with the statement delivered by the group of 77 and China the objective of this exercise should not be to simply reduce the number of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Rather, it must be to make the UN more efficient and adept at handling mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We must focus on eliminating duplications, harmonizing mandates and improving the way they are implemented.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To advance this goal, the Moldist proposes three practical steps to make mandate creation and follow up more effective.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, equip Member States with clearer information before new mandates are approved.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Decisions on new mandates are often made without a full understanding of existing ones that may already address similar issues.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Maldives therefore proposes that the General assembly establish a light review process to assess overlaps and complementarities before adoption.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This could draw on existing procedures such as the PBI review and make full use of the mandate's website.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Better information will help Member States to place each other and each mandates where it can deliver the greatest value.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, strengthen how we assess implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Secretary General's reports to the General assembly usually describe actions taken but seldom evaluate their effectiveness.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The moralist therefore proposes updating reporting methodologies to emphasize outcomes and outputs, giving Member States a clearer view of what has been achieved.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The UN's field offices can support this by guaranteeing data and supplying information and reducing reporting burdens on governments, particularly that of the small island developing states.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, introduce mechanism for regular review and adjustment.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandates should evolve as circumstances change.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: An alternative process within the existing Secretariat structure could provide a periodic feedback from inception to completion, ensuring that each mandate remains relevant and aligned with its objective.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Reforms should create a UN that is efficient in process and impactful in results.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The focus must be on clarity, accountability and learning from experience.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Maldives remains committed to ensuring that the UN80 process builds on the system that works smarter, collaborates better and delivers real value to the people it serves.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you, I thank the Permanent Representative of Maldives and I now give the floor to the Representative of Mexico, to be followed by Qatar.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you Co Chairs and first of all, let me thank for your dedication and these efforts and also the information provided by the Briefers.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: A full text of our intervention will be shared with you and let me concentrate now in our proposals.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Madam Couture in his Report of Mandate Implementation Review, the Secretary General makes available proposals on how to better align, deliver and assess mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: For instance, to address the aforementioned challenges, the Secretary General proposes strengthening the Secretariat's support to Member States during the formulation of mandates to identify potential duplications among draft resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mexico welcomes this proposal.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also value the Secretariat's efforts to ensure that Member States have full insight into what already exists across the United nations system when designing new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, we particularly welcome the initiative to introduce new tools that allow Member States to visualize and interrelate mandates during intergovernmental processes.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We believe that a proactive and technologically enabled Secretariat role is indispensable in providing timely information, specialized expertise and strategic guidance to Member States to assess the relevance, coherence and necessity of new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Now looking ahead, Mexico also believes that the success of this process will depend on the honesty and discipline of Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As we strongly advocated during the discussions on the revitalization of the General assembly.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We must avoid introducing new resolutions that do not bring substantial changes beyond technical or factual updates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also need to make commitment to reduce the length of mandate text to decide on biennial or triennial resolutions, and even include, whenever possible, the so called sunset clauses.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Similarly, it will be rational to discontinue the practice of adopting the same resolutions both in the Committees and in the Plenary.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This should include other governing bodies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Streamlining this practice will make our work less duplicative.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mexico is convinced that this process is an opportunity to assess and to optimize the mandates we have created, ensuring that remain relevant, effective and aligned with today's priorities.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you, I thank the Representative of Mexico and I now give the floor to the Representative of Qatar, to be followed by Croatia.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: At the outset, I'd like to thank the Co Chairs for convening this meeting, we align ourselves with the statements delivered on behalf of the group of 77 in China and on behalf of the Gulf Cooperation Council.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Allow me to share a few key points in our national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, the establishment of comprehensive registries of mandates is essential to ensure full visibility across the mandate landscape and to facilitate the creation of impactful and coherent mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Given the fragmentation of mandating bodies, we call for accelerating the creation of these registries for all existing mandates across the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, we support enhanced inter Secretariat cooperation to promote coherence across bodies and to avoid unproductive duplication such as parallel reporting on the same subject matter.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, we should seek to harness the potential of artificial intelligence tools to assist Member States in the mandate drafting process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: At the same time, human oversight remains indispensable to ensure that appropriate safeguards are maintained.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Lastly, we recognize the difficult financial situation facing the United nations even as it is tasked with undertaking more activities within existing resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Resources Many resolutions are increasingly long and prescriptive and lack actual resources to implement them.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, we underscore the importance of establishing new mandates supported by corresponding resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We thank you for your continued efforts and wish to assure you of Qatar's full support in your endeavors.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of Qatar and I now give the floor to the representative of Croatia, to be followed by Algeria.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Co facilitators.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you for the opportunity to share our views on mandate creation and for organizing the informative briefing held on October 13th.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: My delegation aligns itself with a statement delivered by the European Union on behalf of its Member States, and I would like to add a few remarks in my national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We appreciate your comprehensive approach to examining mandates across their full cycle.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As today's focus is on mandate creation, I will concentrate on three key elements we consider essential for crafting mandates that are both implementable and conducive to effective delivery.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, mandates must be concise, clear, flexible, focused and adequately resourced.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: These qualities ensure mandates can serve as solid foundation for program planning and budgeting and ultimately for achieving meaningful impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Ambiguity in mandates can lead to misinterpretation and hinder efficient implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this context, early and robust support from the Secretariat, including the Budget Office, is crucial.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, mandate visibility must be enhanced across the entire UN system.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Centralized and accessible information is vital to prevent duplication and overlap, and we welcome the establishment of the UN Mandate Source Registry by the Secretariat and encourage its continued development and refinement.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, mandate creation should incorporate mechanisms for evaluating impact and delivery.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandates are not end in themselves.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We must be able to Assess, based on evidence, their contribution to improving lives.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And this is, after all, the the core mission of the United nations to serve the people of the world.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of Croatia.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And I now give the floor to the representative of Algeria, to be followed by Turkey.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Algeria aligns itself with a statement delivered by Iraq on behalf of G77 and China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And I would like to highlight the following points on my national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The discussion on the UNH process and the reflections on how mandates are created and managed go to the heart of how the United nations translate political will into action.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Reform, in our view, should help the organization become clearer in purpose, more transparent in process, and more accountable in delivery.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We value the development of of tools that map the UN's mandates and make them more accessible.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: They can certainly help us see the broader picture.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: However, these tools must support deliberation, not replace it.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: No platform or algorithm can capture the nuance, intent and compromise that come from negotiation among Member states.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Technology should simplify information, not oversimplify politics or replace unstaff.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandates are not technical outputs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: They are expressions of collective intent.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Their wording carries meaning, imbalance that must be preserved.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Efficiency in form should never come at the cost of substance, of inclusiveness.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also welcome the push for greater financial transparency.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Clarity on the cost and scope of mandate strengthens trusts.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Yet it remains essential that mandates drive resources, not the contrary.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Political priorities must continue to guide budgetary ones.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: What will determine the success of unity is whether it results in better coordination, credible data and genuine ownership by all national member states.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: If reform delivers this, it will make the UN more agile without losing its soul.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: An organization that is modern in its tools but faithful to its intergovernmental nature.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you, I thank the representative of Algeria, and we thank all of you for being so concise in your interventions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We have 13 more speakers, so if we continue in this manner, we should be able to finish before the lunch break today.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So I now give the floor to the representative of Turkey, to be followed by South Africa and then Ecuador.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Turkey, the floor is yours.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Distinguished Co Chairs, colleagues, I'd like to thank the Co Chairs for initiating these important consultations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It is crucial for the UN to continue fulfilling its mandate while evolving into an effective and efficient organization to meet the challenges of today.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Turkey has long been a strong advocate for the reform efforts aimed at achieving this goal.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The UN 80 initiative holds significant potential to bring about meaningful improvements to the UN structure and operational modalities across the three key work streams.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The interconnectivity between these work streams remains evident.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandates reflect the UN's intergovernmental nature and the exclusive jurisdiction of Member States, as well as their differing needs and priorities within the UN's three pillars.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: As such, this work stream requires particular attention.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Secretary General's report on this issue provides a valuable reference for Member States in their decision making processes.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The report underscores the importance of keeping mandates concise, clear, clear and focused.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Moreover, the financial implications of mandate development should be carefully considered.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Periodic reviews of mandates are essential.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Efforts must be made to ensure complementarity, avoid duplication, and promote synergy between the General assembly and ECOSOC mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: While we agree that attention should be given to the increased number of meetings and associated costs, we must also recognize that facilitating multilateralism and international diplomacy by bringing Member States together remains one of the UN's core functions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It is also important to seek potential savings within the UN80 process grounded in a balanced cost benefit analysis.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We must approach any changes that could undermine the authority of other key decisions making bodies, such as such as the General assembly and its main committees, with caution.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: These bodies, after all, represent all Member States equally, while ECOSOC offers a general inclusive platform for all countries to engage in its work.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In conclusion, as we address work stream two, we must strike a careful balance between the UN's urgent need for reform, the goal of increasing its effectiveness and efficiency, and the authority of Member States to formulate mandates consistent with the UN's intergovernmental nature.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of Turkey.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I now give the floor to the representative of South Africa, to be followed by Ecuador and then Republic of Korea.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you Coaches.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: My delegation aligns itself with with the group of 77 in China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Statement delivered by the distinguished representative of Iraq.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: South Africa would like to make the following remarks in its national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Firstly, regarding mandate creation, General assembly resolution 77335 calling for the expanded use of digital repositories to strengthen institutional memory in is a key factor in assisting us to shape future mandates and avoid unproductive duplication that comes with additional costs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, the immediate implementation of this resolution should be heeded in order to facilitate an operational digital mandate registry, reduce the length of mandates, and ensure that exit clauses are firmly in place.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Secondly, it is crucial that the appropriate attention is given to the development of the appropriate new technology and artificial intelligence tools to root out complementarities and duplications across UN entities at the inception stage of mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thirdly, it is of the utmost importance to ensure that at the point of mandate design the required financial and human resources are duly allocated.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: These new mandates must be complemented with regular budget estimates while simultaneously rooting out prescriptive assignments.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Without these early linkages, mandates immediately become obsolete and ineffective.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We have an obligation to correct the oversight during our review process while taking into consideration the ever looming financial constraints of the organization.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, we support the proposal to refrain from mandating new tasks that are not backed by corresponding resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fourthly, the Secretary General proposes improved Secretariat support for Member States that during mandate creation we would need clarity on how this proposal that focuses on human and financial resource allocation would be realistically factored into future budget projections, considering the reductions and revised estimates for the 2026 budgetary process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, consideration would also have to be given to how Member State ownership of resolutions can be maintained.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Drafting resolutions as a combined effort may have the positive benefit of assured commitment to implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Coaches.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of South Africa and I now give the floor to the representative of Ecuador, to be followed by the Republic of Korea and then France.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: My delegation allies itself with the statement delivered by Iraq on on behalf of the Group 77 and China.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Ecuador thanks the Co Chairs for presenting a clear schedule for the coming months.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: A transparent and predictable process is key for all delegations, especially for smaller emissions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Managing multiple Reform Tracks Ecuador agrees that this process should not be about reducing the United nations ambitions or scope, but about ensuring that what we decide can truly be delivered.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Moderation supports the Secretary General's recommendations aimed at enhancing visibility, coherence and accountability across the full cycle of mandates, while ensuring that these reforms remain guided by the intergovernmental oversight and the inclusive participation of all Member states.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandates are the backbone of multilateral cooperation and often reflect a very delicate balance to the position of Member states.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Yet the proliferation of resolutions, the growing prescriptiveness of their text, coupled with the tendency to add tasks within existing resources, may have created structural inefficiencies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: New mandates must therefore be realistic, adequately funded and designed with clarity and feasibility at their core.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: At the same time, we should remember that mandates reflect the interests of Member States and as such cannot follow a one size fits all approach.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Rather, it should be assessed on its own merits.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Ecuador also welcomes the Secretary General's initiative to establish the UN Mandate Registry as a tangible step toward transparency.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Looking ahead, Ecuador considers important the following discussions take into account the interconnection among the three UN 80 work streams and that we approach them with a balance between ambition and a good sense of realism.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To conclude, my delegation looks forward to further clarity regarding the expected outcome of this process and the framework through which Member States contributions will be considered.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of Ecuador.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to the representative of the Republic of Korea, to be followed by France.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you Co Chairs for this consultation and also we briefers for their clarification.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Today, my delegation would like to suggest the following considerations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, regarding mandate registry, as Director Suzuki explained today, we would like to encourage the Secretariat to develop more analytical functionality that extend beyond merely compiling text, thus enabling Member States to have a better informed decisions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, the mandate registries alone cannot reveal the whole picture.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We should explore mechanism for early engagement with the Secretariat during the design phase, similar to legislative consultation practices in many domestic settings.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: To facilitate such engagement, we would welcome consideration of streamlined coordination arrangement or one stop channel within the Secretariat, potentially resulting in information or analytical notes to check duplication, to ensure coherence and to verify resource availability, including the additional information indicated by Director Monia today.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, the persistent mismatch between mandates and available resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This challenge cannot be entirely resolved resolved when mandates are created.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Nevertheless, we should develop procedures facilitating resources, reallocation from existing programs toward new mandates where possible and drawing from result based budgeting methodology that are already in place.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We should address this structural impediment more systematically.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fourth, we advocate incorporating review of sunset closes in new resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Newly created mandates should face a periodic assessment.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fifth, regarding implementation flexibility, we should develop guidance through dialogue with the Secretariat to give Secretary General appropriate discretion and authority to optimize delivery arrangement.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, on lengthier resolutions, we should submit set explicit standards or ceiling on drafting practices that foster conciseness and actionability.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Colleagues, mandate creation is a Member State prerogative.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Yet it is also our shared duty duty to design mandates that can deliver.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So we should remind ourselves this exercise demands bolder steps and greater self discipline on our part.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: From the design phase, I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the Representative of the Republic of Korea.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Give the floor now to France, to be followed by Argentina and then paraguay.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Many thanks, Mr. President.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I would like first to thank also Mrs. Suzuki, Mrs. Pham and Mr. Mounier for their remarks and complimentary to the Statement of the eu.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I would like to make four remarks and address two requests.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, we fully support the idea of systematic introduction of sunset and review closes of mandates to make sure that in a few years from now, what we have asked the UN to do continues to be relevant and could be fine tuned or updated.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, we fully support the principle to give more flexibility to the Secretariat to implement mandates, decide on which department, agency or fundamental is responsible for an activity based on the comparative advantage of each?

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This is linked to our strong support of the role of the Secretary General as Chief Administrative Coordinator of the whole UN system.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: However, this new responsibility should come with the understanding that the number of Secretariat entities or agencies tasked with one given mandate is systematic, systematically limited to the required minimum.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, we fully support measures to build awareness of Member States on existing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The UN Mandates Registry, complemented by artificial intelligence, may provide a strong basis to this end.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Secretariat guidance before the negotiation process and during mandate elaboration will also be key in this regard, as proposed, for example, by the eu, Germany or UK previously.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fourth, yes, of course we need to be able to fund correctly new mandates fully and yet we believe that systematic introduction of resource requirements, be it financial or in human resources, may also contribute to the piling up of budgetary resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Therefore, resource demands to Member States need to come up only after an internal, careful and thorough review has been done internally, based on clear criteria, to see if the new mandate cannot be absorbed within existing resources with new relocation of work or priorisation of resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We need to avoid the practice of small PBIs, for instance, as this contributes to budgetary fragmentation increase.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I am sure we can work toward a new way of functioning in line with the requests already made by the Fifth Committee to the Secretariat to intensify its efforts towards zero based budgeting.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We'll propose this in writing, but we would be interested in receiving communication from the Secretariat on two points.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, the list of reports and recommendations on which ones could be given up or merged with others.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Second, more details about the heating map showing duplications to identify the areas where we need to work most.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Enfin affin de conclude travail de plus.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Initiative Au nu quatrovin.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank the representative of France.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to Argentina, to be followed by Paraguay.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mucha heracia Presidente.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I will also switch to English, but firstly allow me to thank for the responses that we received from all the very good questions that were raised in the previous meeting.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We appreciate the effort to have the response in written and today.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Regarding the discussions today, allow me to make some remarks based on the Secretary General report on the issue of poor visibility across existing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We have some comments.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, we believe that there is a need to have collective responsibility or collective accountability.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This has to be promoted in order to identify overlaps, prior mandates or overlapping in the impacts of existing work.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We do believe there is a primary political responsibility among proponents of resolutions or also co FACILITATORS of negotiating process on this issue.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: There has to be of course an active and neutral technical support from the Secretariat to identify these overlappings.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Also IT tools I would say and this Secretary of support is important but these do not accept exempt our collective responsibility and the primary responsibility from proponents when new mandates are created.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also do believe that the Secretariat should or could play a more neutral role on some issues.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We all know that some mandates tend to be Secretariat driven or Secretariat influence.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: That's something that we need to address at some point and also we need to better integrate not only mandates from New York based bodies, but also what's happening in other UN headquarters, Geneva, Vienna, Nairobi and other agencies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Sometimes we are discussing here things that have been already addressed in ILO who or other issues.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And also we would like to recall what we said at the beginning on this general rule that UNGA resolutions remain valid until they are fully implemented.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So this is a very important element that cannot be under my band sunset clauses.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So what we are saying here is that the there is no one size fits all when we address these issues.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Regarding challenges in demanded design, the SG report propose specific ideas that we welcome.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I think it's necessary to reduce the length of texts and mandates and make them more focused, effective and action oriented.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Again, this has to be a collective understanding and a collective agreement.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And at some point we will have to link this collective understanding and agreement or what we are saying here, what's actually or currently happening in the basement.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: If you go to 1B the discussions are going in a very different way of some interventions or things that we say here.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: But also while this is a collective responsibility, we do believe that there could be an active and joint leadership from those who decide member states or individual who decides to assume positions on committee bureaus, executive boards and governing bodies of the UN system as well from presidencies, from unga, ECOSOC and designated co facilitators in negotiating process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We thank for the response.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Also on the PBI implications in advance for us, I think it's important to have some consideration of PBI implications in initial stage of negotiations and not at the end.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So having this report ex ante will be useful for negotiations at some point.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We do believe that maybe we will need to have a common understanding on the scope of implications of the phrase within existing resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Secretary has an explanation in negotiations sometimes that is used as a political way out to okay, you have the mandate, but only if you get the money.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: That doesn't mean new budgetary implications.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: So I believe that we might have to have an understanding of that, and we do believe that some budget allocations or funding at some point will have to be tied to verifiable and concrete results on the ground.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thanks to Argentina.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to Paraguay, to be followed by Cuba.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Chair.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: My delegation wishes to express a few considerations in addition to the statement delivered by the group of 77 in China and first makes a strong call not to miss the current opportunity that arises from the UN 80 initiative.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, it supports the effort of this working Group and appreciates the roadmap that has been outlayed outlined when referring specifically to the creation of mandates, my delegation took note of two challenges highlighted in the Secretary General's report the limited visibility of the overall landscape of existing mandates and of the work carried out by the various bodies that established them, and the difficulties in mandate design that can restrict their impact during implementation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: PARAGUIDE recognizes that a clear vision of the full set of mandates is essential to maximize their impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this sense, it supports initiatives aimed at improving their visibility, such as the digital registries under the UN 80 initiative, which help Member States avoid unnecessary duplications.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: It also underscores the importance of strengthening the duplication complementary among the headquarters and agencies of the United nations systems in order to prevent overlaps and optimize resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: My country also reiterates its supports for the use of technology in the mandate creation process, in particular highlights the potential of artificial intelligence to streamline information analysis and provide inputs that guide more informed decision making both for Member States and for the Secretariat in planning its work.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Furthermore, with the aim of maximizing efficiency and impact and recognizing that the direct cost of meetings in reports exceeded $360 million in 2024, as stated in paragraph 33 of the Secretary General's report, Paraguay calls for reconsiderations based on evidence and factual demonstrations of repetitions of the frequency of resolutions presented annually on recurring issues, especially when their texts reproduce previous versions.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, it proposes moving towards BNL or triennial cycles in order to use resources more efficiently and reduce the burden these repetitions impose on Member states and the system.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Finally, PARAGUIDE deems it imperative to prevent committees or technical administrative bodies from turning into arenas of geopolitical confrontation as excessive politicization during the mandate creation stage weakens the ability to deliver concrete results and erodes trust in the organization.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank Paraguay.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to Cuba and then Belarus.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Chairs, we appreciate the convening of these informal consultations on the Creation of Mandates under the Unity Initiative Cuba aligns itself to the statement made by Iraq on behalf of the group of G77 and China, and we would like to make the following comments.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In national capacity we emphasize that the review of mandate implementation as defined in Work Stream 2 of the UN80 initiative should be focused on analyzing how to improve and ensure optimal compliance with the organization's mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Mandates and their validity should not be analyzed for their longevity, but rather for where they have fulfilled the fundamental purpose for which they were created.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We are reaffirmed that it is prerogative of Member States to make decisions on the creation of new mandates as well as the modification or termination of the existing ones.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We also emphasize that the review of mandate creation should remain under the authority of Member States States and that the operational discretion of the Secretariat should be consistent with the established intergovernmental frameworks.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We appreciate that the use of artificial intelligence will be subject to appropriate human oversight and will only be used as a tool to increase investigative capacity in the mandate design process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Furthermore, while we believe that mandates should be clear and as concise as possible, this should not undermine the presence of nuances that are of interest to all Member States.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Taking into account, for example, the sensitivity, longevity and scope of a given issue.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Cuba reiterates its commitment for constructive participation in in discussions of the UN80 initiative.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Cuba.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to Belarus and then Pakistan.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Distinguished Co Chairs Dear Colleagues, the Republic of Belarus supports the efforts to strengthen the impact of the United nations and enhancing its agility, responsiveness and resilience while addressing the issue of arbitrary interpretation and duplication of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, we welcome the creation of a digital mandate registry created through the UN80 initiative.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The recommendation to create shorter action oriented texts to facilitate mandate implementary should not impact the effectiveness of the mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We are cautious about the proposal to use artificial intelligence to assist with mandate drafting.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: While this recommendation could be useful for flagging potential complementarities or duplication in draft texts or meeting agendas across mandatory bodies, we emphasize that those tools should not replace the personal engagement of experts and responsibility of UN staff, which is essential for ensuring the quality and integrity of the work of the organization, we also skeptical that involving system wide coordination platforms will help avoid duplication and ensure the strategic use of resources across the United nations system.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Belarus reaffirms its support for the efforts of the Secretary General and the Secretariat as a whole, while emphasizing the intergovernmental nature of both their organization and the process of creating, delivering and reviewing mandates, as well as prioritizing or streamlining mandates activities.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We underline that decisions and the actual process of resource redeployment cannot be adopted and implemented internally by United nations system entities without the approval of the UN General assembly, even if there is a reasonable justification.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Belarus emphasized that financial or operational factors should not be used as justification for modifications, delays or non implementation of mandates adopted by intergovernmental bodies.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank Belarus.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to Pakistan, to be followed by Brazil.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Distinguished Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Moving straight to the point in terms of procedure, we would like to request that all inputs received to today be published on the dedicated website for this process to ensure transparency.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Coming to substance, we would like to raise the following points.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: First, we would propose that one of the key points Member States should agree on are principles of mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The Secretary should provide requisite support in this regard.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: 2. We do not support the inclusion of review clauses in mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This has been extensively debated before also and did not garner consensus.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thus, we do not see the utility of repeating this conversation in this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Third, we do not support the proposal of refraining from mandating new tasks which are not backed by corresponding resources or an explicit reduction in other mandated tasks.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We believe this is not practical implementable if PBI is to become the defining factor.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: This would in effect make the UN unable to respond to new and emerging challenges.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fourth, we believe that there needs to be a more faithful application of the phrase within existing resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: At the time of mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: The relevant implementing entity should confirm that they would in actuality be able to implement a given mandate within existing resources.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Fifth, on the task within the Secretary General's purview, we stress that combining reports is not within the authority of the Secretariat.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Reports are mandated by Member States and cannot be combined unless Member States agreed to do so.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Sixth, we believe that the Mandate Registry needs improvement to be more practical in utility.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: For example, we believe for mandates it should only list those operative paragraphs which lead to a PBI impact.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Currently it just seems to list all of these.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Pakistan.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: I give the floor now to Brazil, who will be our final Speaker.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: My delegation aligns itself with the statement delivery by Iraq on behalf of the group of G77 China and adds the following remarks in international capacity from a holistic point of view and perspective, the creation of mandate should be part of a rationalized and coherent process.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this regard, before initiating any new mandate, we must ensure that existing initiatives addressing the same issue are thoroughly mapped and analyzed.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: A prior and systematic phase of identifying possible overlaps and readiness would be of fundamental importance to prevent the proliferation of duplicative mandates.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this respect, the use of data analysis, AI based agents and tools could greatly assist in mapping such overlaps and provide objective evidence to inform the decisions before we start a new mandate.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Secondly and last, we have heard suggestions regarding the possibility of bring certain budgetary aspects of the mandates to this phase of creation, in particular the program implications PBIS to an early stage of their creation.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: In this context, it would be useful to receive clarification on how such approach could operate in practice and whether it might entail even directly transfer of the budgetary discussion away from the Fifth Committee, which remains the competent technical firm for such deliberations.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Thank you thank you, Reza. We have heard the last speaker on the list of speakers for this meeting.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Given the time, we will not attempt to do a summary here.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We will provide that kind of summary at the beginning of the next meeting, which will be a briefing on mandate implementation of on 30 October, which will be then followed by consultations on 14 November.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Further information on the mandate implementation briefing will be communicated to Working Group members shortly.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: Just to remind you that we are available as co Chairs for you to reach out to us directly or by email.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: We are flexible in terms of the submission of written inputs or suggestions that you may have to us and in that regard let me just finally thank our briefers for their stick to it iveness and for their forthrightness in providing responses.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: There are still a few remaining questions that emanated from today that we will attempt to provide you with answers for either in writing or at the next briefing.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And thank you for demonstrating that we are able to self impose discipline.

session_title: Mandate Creation consultations - Statements from members of the working group
text: And to finish exactly at 1pm the meeting is adjourned.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Good afternoon.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Again, I call to order the informal meeting of the Working Group to hear a technical briefing on mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We warmly welcome all of you to this technical briefing.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We recognize the presence on screen for everyone of Mr. Guy Ryder, under Secretary General for Policy and chair of the UN 80 task force.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Also His Excellency Christian Venavesa, Permanent representative of Liechtenstein Mr. Martin Kamani, President and Chief Executive Officer of the Africa Centre and former Permanent Representative of Kenya and Ms. Amerihak, the former United Nations Under Secretary General for the Department of Field Support, former CO Chair of the High Level Independent Panel on Peace Operations and former Secretary General Special Representative for Timor Leste and Head of the United Nations Integrated Mission in East Timor.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Before handing the floor to our briefers, please allow me to deliver some opening remarks on behalf of the CO Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We wish to take this opportunity to warmly thank all of you for your continued engagement in this important process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The briefing we convened on mandate creation on 13th October was fruitful.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It delivered useful information, data and analysis to Working Group members.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Your questions to the briefers were incisive and brought to light areas of shared interest.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This included questions around the lessons we have learned from previous attempts to to review mandates, the tools we might employ to support visibility of the mandate landscape and the relationship between the mandate creation process and the budgetary cycle.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Your remarks at the subsequent mandate creation consultations on 23 October demonstrated that the briefings had stimulated some useful inputs from the Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You presented new ideas about how we might improve the way we work together to create mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we also heard a desire to return to some of the ideas that have been raised in the past.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In addition to offering suggestions on general principles that could guide our work, you made concrete proposals of actions to be taken.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This included ideas around enhanced support from the Secretariat for those leading resolutions, improved working methods in the Committees and UN bodies where mandates are created, and a recasting of the budgetary process so the financial and time costs of mandates are better understood.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Many of you expressed a desire for more discipline in the creation of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Your desire to embrace technology to support our work was tempered with clear statements about the need for human oversight.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And you reaffirmed the centrality of Member States as the drivers of mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have taken careful note of your inputs to the Working Group and we encourage you to start thinking about the merit of some of the proposals made by your fellow Working Group members and in addition to discussions in this room.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That's right.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: At least you have really great taste in music.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Yeah.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In addition to discussions in this room, Working Group member inputs are being made available on the UN80 website.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Further, we will continue to make ourselves available to you for smaller group discussions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we really do appreciate the engagement with many of you that we have had to date.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Some of you are interested in having a clearer idea of where this process is heading.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As we said at the outset, we will be guided by you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: At the same time, please be sure that we, as co Chairs, are striving for the highest level of ambition.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We believe that reform of the UN is not only desirable, but but inevitable.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We want to work with you to ensure that mandates that we create are more impactful, that the resources to deliver them are used wisely and efficiently, and that the processes and working methods we deploy to create, implement and review mandates are less laborious, while remaining inclusive and transparent.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have many options available to us in terms of the outcome of this process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Options include pledges, recommendations, guidelines, reports, decisions and resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But none of these options will be meaningful unless we are genuinely committed to collective implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This will require a shift in behaviour, a shift in psychology and a shift in how we communicate with each other.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And it will take sustained leadership.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Before we settle on the specific modality or outcome from this process, you need to tell us your level of ambition for reform and a demonstrated commitment to implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: With that, I would now like to pass the floor to my co Chair, Ambassador Wallace, to get us underway with today's discussion.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Ambassador Carolyn.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Colleagues, we hope that today's briefing on mandate implementation will be as fruitful as our recent discussions on mandate creation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Each of our briefers today have or have had leadership roles in different aspects of mandate implementation across the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have asked our briefers to share their perspectives on how the mandates are implemented, whether it be well or poorly or unevenly, and ask them to share their ideas on how implementation might be improved.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Understanding that the stages of the mandate lifecycle are intricately connected, they may also wish to share insights into the relationship between mandate creation and implementation and review.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Before they begin, allow us to share a few thoughts from our perspective.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In our many discussions with Member States, the Secretariat, the UN system more broadly and with stakeholders, we have heard widespread agreement that reform is urgently needed to restore public trust and the confidence of political decision makers in the UN and to strengthen its ability to deliver across the its core mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: During our recent mandate creation briefing and consultations, we could see that Working Group members clearly understand the link between mandate creation and mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mandates that are carefully crafted, assigned and costed that is, those that are created as a result of a deliberate and sound process are well set up for effective implementation from the moment of their creation.
