session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Effective implementation of mandates sits at the core of the UN's legitimacy.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We encourage Working Group members to keep open minds as you listen to the data and analysis presented to you today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Once you've had a chance to ask questions of the briefers and reflect on what you have heard, we hope you will bring concrete, ambitious and creative ideas to the Working Group at the Mandate implementation consultations on 14 November.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: From the discussion so far, we are confident that many of your conclusions and suggestions will align with the Co Chair's desire to achieve the most ambitious outcome from this process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As we noted earlier, today's briefers have been selected for their varied experience and perspectives with mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Like all of us here today, they are invested in the good functioning of the un.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Following the presentations by the briefers, there will be an opportunity for questions from the floor.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I will now give the floor to Mr.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Guy Ryder, Undersecretary General for Policy and chair of the UN 80 task force.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Guy, the floor is yours and thank you for taking the time.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Well, thank you very much, Co Chairs, Excellencies, dear participants, let me first thank you for inviting me to speak at this session of the Working Group focusing on the delivery phase of the mandate life cycle, and allow me at the outset an expression of solidarity and support through you, Ambassador Wallace, to the government and people of Jamaica in the wake of the passage of Hurricane Melissa.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I would also like to express appreciation to all of you for your investment in the UN 80 initiative, particularly over the past couple of weeks, which have been really quite intensive.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The Secretary General, my colleagues and I have benefited from the multiple engagements with you on the various work streams and the thoughtful feedback and strong commitment you have provided, not least right here in this Working group.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Progress is being made.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I believe we are on the right path and that working together can and will make a real difference.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But I think we all recognize as well that we have a long way to go.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Perhaps it would be useful before turning to today's topic, mandate Delivery, to provide you with a very brief update on current developments across the whole of the UN 80 initiative.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: By way of context, I am joining you virtually because we are currently holding the UN system's Chief Executive Board, which twice a year brings together senior leaders from across the UN system to align on strategic issues and one of the main items on the agenda, and it will be discussed tomorrow morning, concerns next steps in the UN 80 initiative.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As the Secretary General said when he briefed you all two weeks ago on Work stream three of the initiative, we are developing an action plan that would establish an internal architecture, assign lead responsibilities and establish timelines to deliver on all action points across the entirety of the UN 80 work streams.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I want to stress that this is an internal process and the Action Plan will operate, of course, in the fullest respect of established procedures and Member State prerogatives, in full transparency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Accordingly, we'll be informing Member States about the Action Plan once it is finalized.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Dear Co Chairs, Dear Participants, Let me turn then to today's topic, Mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Now, mandates set out the actions which Member States instruct the UN to undertake, and mandate delivery is how we carry out those mandated actions today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As you all know, our mandates are quite numerous, very varied.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: By way of example, your decisions and your resolutions provide for such things as the establishment of subsidiary organs of the General Assembly, ECOSOC or the Security Council, for reports of the Secretary General, for the holding of meetings or workshops on particular subjects, for the establishment of of a peace operation, or for the establishment of an envoy, for example, to undertake good offices, and a great deal else.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So we can see the great variety of issues dealt with under mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Colleagues we currently have more than 400 intergovernmental bodies in New York, Geneva, Nairobi and Vienna alone.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: All of these bodies have their own agenda, meetings and documents.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So let me give you a bit of an insight into some of the implications of your decisions in these areas.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: When Member States mandate the production of a report, for example, they should perhaps be aware that the costs related to to the issuance of an additional report in all six languages of 8,500 words amounts to US$24,500 at headquarters.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is just the cost of editing, translation and issuance of the document doesn't include the drafting, consultation and review of content.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And in 2024 alone, 1/4 billion that's billion with a b words were translated by the Secretariat in New York, Geneva, Vienna and Nairobi.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If Member States mandate the holding of a meeting, they might keep in mind that the cost of holding an additional two sessions at headquarters in all six official languages lasting up to three hours for each session, comes to $15,900 per day.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This includes the costs related to interpretation and meeting services, but does not include the cost of substantive support by a Secretariat office or webcast services.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And in 2024 alone, nearly 27,000 meetings were held again in New York, Geneva, Vienna and Nairobi.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And if Member States choose to mandate the establishment of a peacekeeping operation or special political mission.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Costs can range from around US$68 million per year for a small mission such as the UN Mission for the referendum in Western Sahara Minoso, with around 400 military and civilian personnel, to a large mission such as the UN Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo Monusco, which costs almost a billion dollars per year and has over 13,000 personnel in all.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Now this information perhaps gives you a sense of the breadth of what we are referring to, what we mean by mandate delivery and the significant implications that your decisions have in terms of financial and opportunity costs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And with that sort of introduction, let me turn to the key issues which are identified in the Secretary General's report in respect of mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We believe that the report presents an objective, data driven analysis of our current situation and three basic concerns arise from this analysis.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Firstly, the proliferation of meetings and reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Secondly, the inadequate coordination in the distribution of tasks and responsibilities in the Secretariat for Mandate delivery and thirdly, misaligned funding modalities which can amplify challenges in the effective delivery of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So a few comments from me on each of these three concerns with a view to help frame your deliberations in the Working Group on the question of meetings and reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Quantitatively, over one in every ten dollars in the UN's regular budget is spent on direct costs associated with with meetings and reports, with indirect costs coming on top of that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Despite this I think remarkable output, most of these reports are not widely read.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Last year more than half of reports were downloaded less than 2,000 times worldwide.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Another example, the UN observes almost 250 international days and weeks every year, each of them established by a specific resolution, there is a significant time and cost resource cost both in negotiating and observing these international days and weeks.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And whilst the General assembly decided in Resolution 79, 327 to pause the consideration of new proposals for international days, the fact remains that so many international days already vie for attention and that situation remains.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: No less than six international days have been proclaimed for 21 March alone.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Co chairs Dear Participants, it is of course for you Member States to determine whether all of this represents the best use of both time and constrained financial resources, or whether there may be value in redirecting some of these resources to alternatives that might deliver greater impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As you know, the Ad Hoc Working Group on the work of the General assembly has in recent years already taken steps towards streamlining the agenda of the assembly and improving the working methods of the main Committees.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The Secretary General's report points to the option of such steps being taken further across various organs, Member States could consider prioritizing requests for reports and meetings, could combine requests for reports on similar themes, or could adjust the frequency or the format of reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And if the Working Group is interested in examining this topic further, we of course stand ready to support you with analytics, including for example, a list of reports mandated to the Secretariat by topic and by periodicity, and that could perhaps help all of you to get a better insight into the volume and the types of report currently mandated.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have also committed to publishing download statistics for the reports we produce so that Member States can have full understanding of of the readership of the different reports, and we are working on an online tool to make that data accessible and to help to inform your work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Turning to the second concern, which relates to the management of mandate delivery, there is evidence that in the absence of appropriate management and coordination arrangements, too often individual UN entities work in isolation rather than seeking to ensure strategic alignment across the system to drive impact and efficiency in mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The result is an unclear or a poor division of labour, which risks duplication that can generate waste and weaken impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The Secretary General's report also points to the need to strengthen internal oversight to ensure a better division of labour across entities and stronger accountability for our performance.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I would note also that proposals in the SG's recent report under UN 80 Work Stream 3 develop some aspects of this area and the thinking that we have upon it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thirdly, and finally, the question of funding misalignment.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Dear Participants, A great majority of UN funds comes from voluntary contributions and not from assessed contributions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Voluntary contributions were about 80% of total UN income in 2023, and this has important consequences for the ability of the UN to allocate resources optimally.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Moreover, most voluntary funding is both earmarked and provided in small grants.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In 2023, 85% of voluntary funding was earmarked and 60% of government grants were below US$1 million.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: All of this limits our ability to deploy resources where they are needed most and imposes high transaction costs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As already acknowledged in the discussions on the 2019 Funding Compact, pooled funds can enable more strategic and more cost efficient approaches for the work of the United nations as a whole, and we look forward to working with you to develop ideas on how to make pooled funding a more attractive option, a preferred option to overcome fragmented delivery that can result from fragmented funding Co Chairs, Distinguished Delegates to conclude, let me reiterate that my colleagues and myself are at your disposal to provide all additional support that you might consider helpful and appropriate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I have unfortunately to leave the meeting at this point I I have to return to the Chief Executive Board discussion but members of my team are with you there in the room and I look forward to finding out through them the readout of your deliberations today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I look forward as well to continuing and resuming our dialogue on the 14th of November.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much for this opportunity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much, Mr. Ryder.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we completely understand that you have to return to the ceb, but thank you for that presentation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I will now give the floor to His Excellency Christian Beneveso, Permanent Representative of Liechtenstein.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much to both of you and it's a pleasure to be here.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you for the invitation to talk about our experience in putting resolutions forward and on both on mandate design and and the implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have over the past nine years put forward five resolutions in the General assembly in chronological order.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The first in 2016, the creation of the so called IIM, the accountability mechanism for Syria.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Then in the times of the lockdown.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First the so called Laguna Group resolution and I'm pleased to see some of the members of the group in the room.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That was a resolution on Solidarity in the times of COVID 19.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Third again during the lockdown procedural decision on electronic voting in the channel assembly in 2021, a resolution on the situation in Myanmar and finally and maybe best known the Veto initiative in 2022.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The first resolution on the IIIM obviously created a mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In fact it created an entity that is now located in Geneva and interestingly it did not at the time of the adoption create a pbi, even though that entity had has now an annual budget of about US$20 million.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That happened for technical reasons that would be too lengthy to go into.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But if somebody wants to take this up in the Q and A, I'll be happy to go a bit deeper on it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So this mechanism was first financed through voluntary contributions, then moved to the regular budget and today, for better or worse, it relies again heavily on voluntary contributions, but still still has a core funding from the regular budget.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The COVID 19 solidarity resolution has been cited by parts of the UN system, did not create a mandate and did not mean to create a mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I will not go deeper on this resolution, therefore, because we are talking about mandates here.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The Myanmar resolution in 2021 was primarily a political resolution in the absence of of action in the Security Council advocating for action after the unconstitutional military seizure of power and again and actually intentionally did not create a mandate either, but was an impactful text nonetheless.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The other two Texts are perhaps, from a mandate perspective, the most interesting ones.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: While they did not directly mandate specific activities, they did create overarching mandates that can be triggered and then also result in costs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The decision that we put forward during the pandemic, and for those who were not here, this was a time when obviously we were not able to meet in person.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The General assembly continued its work, but.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But because we were not able to meet in person, the view emerged that only resolutions that found consensus in the membership could be adopted.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we found that to be, with many others, an untenable situation for the Council to be subject to a permanent threat of veto de facto by one member of the organization.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is why the E voting procedure was introduced so today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If, for whatever reason we are not able to meet in the General assembly, we are nonetheless able to vote without being in the same room together.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is a mechanism that was technically complicated to develop and that was done certainly with the help from the Secretariat.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And it has not since been used and triggered.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If it were to be used, of course it would lead to costs in application, but it did not incur a PBI or had any sort of costing attached to it at the time of adoption.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The veto initiative.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And maybe good to read out the technical title of this resolution.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's called a standing mandate for the General assembly debate when a veto is cast in the Security Council.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: End of quote, end of title.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So obviously this creates a mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But. It did not incur any cost because the costs only arise if and when the Channel assembly meets as a result of a veto.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So that means the costs incurred are actually caused in the Security Council and through the veto cast in the Security Council.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: There was for this reason also no PBI and no costing attached to this, to this resolution, as for us, has become clear in discussion, one of the problems that we have is that sometimes it's unclear what counts as a mandate and what does not.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: For the resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I have talked about our resolutions, we do believe that this is clear.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: While some people may question whether mandate is the correct term to describe the e voting procedure, we think it is.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But maybe that is up for discussion.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But I think one of the things that we certainly need to get clarity on is what is a mandate, what creates a mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And that should be a building block of how we move forward and mandate creation in other cases, and I'll use the triple IM here, it is clear that there is a mandate created and literally people working for a body laid out by a resolution.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So in our view, the triple IM and the Veto initiative clearly create mandates, and I have already talked about E voting with respect to whether that is a mandate or not.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: For us, a key observation is that the strength of resolutions relied in our case very heavily on the extensive consultations we had with the relevant parts of the UN system, sometimes also with outside actors.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That was the case to a very significant extent for the triple im, where we talked very extensively with the Commission of Inquiry established by the Office of the High Commissioner, the Office of the High Commissioner itself, and other parts of the UN system, but also with independent experts on international criminal law from the outside.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Also, importantly, after the adoption of the mandate, we were part of the implementation, in particular in the discussions on the terms of reference with ohchr, and I really cannot overemphasize how important that is and how important that conversation is both at the phase of the creation of the mandate and thereafter.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Similarly, for the E voting decision, we consulted very closely with the relevant parts of the Secretariat, in particular the jcm, on feasibility and technical modalities, and without the active support and the positive mindset from the Secretariat, we would not have been able to create this mechanism either.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We also engaged very extensively with the Secretariat on technical and practical questions raised in the drafting of the veto initiative.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: One of the questions I think that are key here are fragmentation and maybe more importantly, duplication.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If there are ways to address this issue from a terminological perspective using AI tool, that is great.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But the tools we have do not yet, in our view, manage to do this, partly because mandates can be arrived at with many different terms, many different turns of phrase in a resolution.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So we should, at the phase of drafting a mandate, again, I think, benefit in particular from the input from the Secretariat and to have an overview of what is already happening.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: One thing on mandate implementation that we can clearly do is to give guidance to the SG to determine who carries out what mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Part of the duplication appears to come from a reality today where departments look for mandates to implement.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: There is a bit of a place for that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But we do believe it is more important to have the SG use the discretion vested in his office, in her office, to give guidance to the system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we think that is certainly key in avoiding duplication.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And it's something we're drafters of resolutions, and those who have ownership over them can play a significant role.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: On a side note, I think worth noting that both the Myanmar and the veto initiative resolutions were aimed at the same goal, namely to have the GA act on issues of peace and security when the Council is unable to do so in line with the Charter's mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The GA of course does adopt many resolutions with mandates for peace and security, which we believe the Secretariat implements accordingly.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: With respect to the recent report of the sg, one resolution that comes up relatively often is of course the GA revitalization resolution which recommends shorter action oriented text, something that is clearly beneficial, and the introduction of expiration clauses where appropriate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This has double benefit of making mandates clearer so they can be delivered more effectively and reducing the amount of text being processed.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: On the issue of periodicity, again, I think a key aspect of our conversation certainly interesting and probably unusual, all the resolutions that we presented were one off resolutions, so none of them needed to be adopted again to be in force or to be or to have an impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You know, we do not really have the capacity as a small state to put forward five resolutions a year and we're certainly very happy that we don't have to because otherwise that's how we would be spending our time.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But that's not the main reason why we drafted the resolutions this way.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We simply did not feel that it was necessary or in fact helpful, even though in context of a couple of them it was discussed.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I really want to encourage states to think about this when they present resolutions that the one off resolution certainly can be as meaningful, as impactful as other resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As a minimum, I believe we should move away from this prevailing logic that the default position is that resolution is an annual resolution.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I think that is clearly wrong.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I see actually pretty much no reason for that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And there are at the end, if you look at everything together, it's probably a minority of resolutions where that is in fact justified.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: On a similar note, there is not per se a need to ask for NSG report every year.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Again, I think there is a certain automaticity in how we think about this.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You write a resolution, so obviously the last para you write is you request a report from the sg and that does not necessarily mean that you know why you want the report, except that that is the basis for the discussion that you have next year.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So again, none of our resolutions did have a report and we don't think they're any less meaningful for that matter.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Of course they are a bit sui generis, at least some of them.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But again, I think it's extremely important to think about this and also to think about the proposal made by our colleague from Costa Rica here that perhaps at the beginning when you have a new mandate, it may be helpful to have an SG report that helps you frame the discussion.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But that does not mean that you have to have a report every single year or at the very least you should ask for something more specific.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A primary point that is rarely clear at the point of adoption is how much a resolution might cost in terms of budget.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We think that as a matter of transparency, every resolution should be costed and that this should happen as a matter of course so we know how much we are spending.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Last point on the interrelated nature of mandate creation, implementation and review.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The tools we use to build a mandate are inextricably linked to the overall design of the mandate and the purpose for which we build it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So we should not separate these two things.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And if you write a mandate, if you write a resolution, you should at the same time already think about the implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And again, that's why the dialogue with the Secretariat is so important.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So in conclusion, just you know, the takeaways from our perspective, the first is a one off resolution can be fine.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Some of the most famous resolutions that the General assembly in particular has adopted, of course were adopted one time only.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And that maybe is something that is worth thinking about BE 26, 25, 3314 or many others.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And at the very least we should look, and that's the second point, at the periodicity of a resolution on the basis of of the merits of the text at a time of creation, an SG report is not required to mandate action or in our view to make a resolution impactful.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As a minimum, it should be understood that there is no automaticity in asking for NSG report.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We should have an estimate of how much a resolution may cost, including if provisions are triggered by another body or or by a Member State later.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In our case, that was the example given was the veto initiative.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And certainly Member States should engage very extensively with the Secretariat on products and to achieve different purposes to improve the quality of the resolutions, but also of the mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: To ensure that a mandate is well understood in the Secretariat and implement it accordingly and probably most importantly, to avoid duplication and to know what is already happening.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And that may well be part of a mandate that you're about to create.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And finally there is a responsibility for follow up and implementation with a view to ensuring that Secretariat has the assistance and the guidance needed to process a mandate as efficiently as possible.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you, Christian.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I'll give the floor to Mr. Martin Kimani, President and Chief Executive Officer of the Africa center and former Permanent Representative of Kenya.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's good to see you, Martin.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Good afternoon.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much for giving me the floor.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Dear Chairs Excellencies and distinguished colleagues, I'm very glad to be participating in these important deliberations as we discuss gaps in mandates and implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Our sense of urgency must be sharpened by the atrocities unfolding in El Fascia, Sudan.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Yesterday, the WHO condemned reports of killings and abduction of hundreds inside a maternity ward.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The unfortunate reality is that human beings are impelled to make the most radical changes due to emergency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Such indeed was a necessity that impelled the creation of the un.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The world is beset by emergency today, especially, as I've just mentioned, in Sudan and Gaza and here in headquarters, there is a budget crisis.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We should use them to build the un.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The world needs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As you know, the reality of being a permanent representative or a delegate here is that one is constantly busy and yet finds that business quite frustrating.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Many times during the day you sit in the machinery that is built to maintain peace and protect life, yet you see it falter repeatedly in real time.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That helplessness is not abstract to me.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It was my daily experience, including during Kenya's term on the Security Council a few years ago.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We increased our staff, had two substantive DPRs at ambassador level, and our experts tried to be present across the system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Yet we still worked seven days a week from early morning into the night.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And while I am proud of our work, so much was left undone due to the weaknesses of the implementation system here.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: My focus today, however, goes beyond the time constraints of delegations to the role of knowledge in implementation, especially across the peace and development nexus.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: While I served as the president of one of the executive boards, I used to quip quite often that the UN is the world's most knowledgeable organization.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But its inability to effectively manage knowledge means that its workers seldom have what they need at the moment of decision.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It knows a lot, but it doesn't know what it knows.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: An American study of knowledge workers found that they spend nearly a fifth of their time searching for information.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: With thousands of meetings, overlapping mandates and siloed repositories, the figure at the UN is likely to be higher.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is a direct financial and effectiveness tax on implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We face three linked weak points or failures.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: First is information asymmetry.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Agencies and departments meet, learn and decide in isolation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Insights stay where they are produced and entities cite the same mandates without a shared implementation picture.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Second is search inefficiency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Staff spend a large share of time hunting across unconnected systems.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Time that should fund analysis and delivery is consumed by retrieval.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Included in this are delegations with their oversight function, which is consequently weakened.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Third, we suffer knowledge loss at scale rotation in Peace operations and turnover in country teams drain institutional memory.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: When countries move from peacekeeping to peace building, they often build initiatives such as community policing from scratch.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Despite the UN's years of mission experience that should contribute to that task.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The knowledge exists here, but it's too often inaccessible.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: There have been attempts to change this before, of course.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: There have been lessons learned.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Units launched knowledge networks and individual agencies have built repositories.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But most have underperformed for three reasons.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: They were siloed by entity under resourced aside projects rather than core infrastructure, and had no accountability for usage or contribution.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What is different now is technology and of course, the emergency that we are facing.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: For instance, artificial intelligence can search across silos.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It can surface patterns and cut retrieval time by orders of magnitude.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Recent advances in Australia, for instance, demonstrate how institutions are experimenting with multimodal AI systems to deploy autonomous digital workers that perform entire workflows.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: These AI systems are being tested to manage routine back office functions, freeing human staff for analysis, judgment and partnership building.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Early evidence suggests substantial productivity gains and error reduction when standardized processes are automated, provided that oversight and ethical safeguards remain strong.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The relevance to the work of the UN is clear.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Much of its administrative and reporting work is repeatable and rule based, while implementation decisions are human and contextual.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A similar division of labor could release significant capacity across the system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Machines handle structured workflows.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: People focus on diplomacy, negotiation and learning.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The goal here is augmentation, not to just replace UN staff.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The question is whether we have the discipline to deploy it with clear governance and joint ownership.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I very much recall talking to different executive directors about the data flows and asking them if they could pool knowledge information in one data pool.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And of course all of them, because I was president of the board that year, were very welcoming of my remarks, but they went nowhere with it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So I propose three integrated moves.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Each addresses a past weak point and I think together they can change how we deliver.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The first is to build country knowledge infrastructure with joint ownership.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So in every nexus context on peace and development established an index repository that surfaces conflict analysis, the political economy program evidence, human rights reporting and financing data to all UN actors and key partners.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And this of course can build on already the reforms and the existence of the resident coordinator working with mission leadership to ensure that no single entity controls access or content standards.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That infrastructure should include an AI enabled layer that allows queries across resolutions, SG reports, evaluations and lessons databases.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A practitioner should be able to ask what worked for demobilization in a context like theirs and receive some form of design elements, contact details for implementers and ready to use indicators within minutes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Let's make usage visible in senior compacts.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If a product is not discoverable through this system, do not ask the field to produce it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Assign executive ownership at the ASG level, perhaps in each entity to ensure that this is core business, not a side project.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: 2. We need to link tacit knowledge to accountability structures.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Tacit knowledge is how so much of the great work in this organization is done.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It travels through people.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So we should establish more practitioner networks that connect peace operations, special political missions, resident coordinator offices and humanitarian workers.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Let's name nexus coordinators with dual reporting to the resident coordinators and mission leads.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Let's give them shared indicators, e.g. sustained reduction in violence incidents around key project areas and time to transition to specific services from mission to national systems.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Let's have budget lines that must acknowledge nexus work even if they're not joint budget lines.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Let's rationalize reporting and measure knowledge use.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As Christian was saying, we can replace bundles of low use reports with consolidated decision briefs in each context.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We can track open rates, references in decisions and follow through.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We can percentage of new programs at site and apply evaluation lessons and share of joint analysis actually used at decision points.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We can track all these.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We really.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: You know I have to say that I was really struck when I visited N. Nigeria to go to the Northeast and see the development and peace building work that was done.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I felt the power of the tacit knowledge that was there.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The depth of communication between the UN system and the national authorities and the decision making participation by the national authorities in operations in the Northeast showed the UN at its best.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I am pretty much convinced that after the movement of those UN staff that instituted that that the new ones had to learn all those lessons all over again.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It's too expensive.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Centralizing knowledge raises legitimate concerns about sensitive information.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Let's keep the systems that I'm proposing on secure UN infrastructure.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Default access should be here to the UN and delegations and and pre agreed partners such as the African Union.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Let's restrict sensitive material through role based permissions that are managed and lets member states receive consolidated products, not raw field analysis.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We want our technology to produce productivity, not be an intelligence gathering exercise.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And you can establish a small interagency board to set standards and resolve access disputes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And of course you have to protect sources while making inclusion the operating principle.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As I come to a close, we all know that most of the nexus contexts are in Africa.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I think that is an opportunity to use that concentration of effort to lead the agenda.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Let's establish an Africa Nexus knowledge hub that connects AU structures, regional economic communities and UN teams.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In a first regional pilot of this approach, let's build regional learning networks around shared problems such as cross border transhumans or urban violence.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: For a field team, less time searching, more time tailoring.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: When a mission planner rotates out, successors will inherit a living record of their decisions, why they were taken, and what they achieved.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: For you member states, it comes up with fewer, better products that synthesize across organs and entities and allow smaller delegations to enter debates with the same factual base as the larger ones.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But of course, knowledge management is not a substitute for political will, adequate resources or clear mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Christian spoke deeply and knowledgeably about that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It cannot resolve policy agreements among Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It cannot make up for chronic underfunding.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: What it can do is ensure that we have agreement and resources and we do not waste them relearning what we already know.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The best knowledge systems fail without the right people to use them.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We must hire for both excellence and inclusion.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Excellence means recruiting staff with the technical skills, contextual knowledge and judgment.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Inclusion means drawing that talent from the broadest possible pool, particularly from the regions where we work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: A country team without nationals in senior roles will miss context that determines whether programs succeed or fail.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I am constantly approached by young people and professionals who want to work for the un.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: People who I find utterly brilliant.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I find many UN staff utterly brilliant.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But I have to say it seems like a rigged game where a lot of people who have the qualifications that would uplift this organization are just not given the chance.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: If that doesn't happen, it doesn't matter how much knowledge management you put in the system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The whole system will not work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Geographic and gender balance are key to operational effectiveness.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So let me close by just finishing by noting the obvious.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Our problem is not lack of knowledge.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It is really how to build systems that harness that knowledge, direct it and allow access to it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Humanity and countries and states and philanthropists, so many have contributed many billions of dollars to the work of the un.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The collected knowledge and expertise is humanity's great prize, not only for the work of the un, but all those civil society organizations that would like access to the same information subject to reasonable limits.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much for giving me the chance to contribute to this debate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I wish all of you all the best in delivering to us the United nations that we so solely need.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you so much Martin, for that intervention.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It was almost as if you never left us.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I now give the floor to Mr. Meera Haq former UN Under Secretary General for the Department of Field Support, former co Chair of the High Level Independent Panel on Peace Operations, former Secretary General, Special Representative for Timor Lester, and head of the UN Integrated Mission Initiative, East Timor.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Ms. Hack, you have the floor and welcome.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I will try to go through very quickly, but first just want to say that all protocols observed I have had a career in the United nations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: My career spanned 40 years.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Of that 40 years, I spent 21 years in the field where the implementation was taking place in many countries.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But I spent 19 years, obviously in headquarters where I think it was also very important to get the perspective of the political frameworks, policy frameworks and other things that go into mandate creation and implementation that many of the speakers have have touched on this morning.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I also feel very fortunate because in the course of my career in the UN I had the opportunity to work in all three specific areas of the un, namely in development, in humanitarian and in the peace and security sectors.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So, you know, and I've looked at implementation in all of these areas.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I retired 10 years ago and obviously once you're retired you have time to reflect and very often I do.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I Wonder Whether my 40 years, you know, made an impact because sometimes when I see where the world is, particularly countries that I worked in, you know, the crisis situations that they are still in, as the earlier speaker referred to in, in Sudan, you know, you have to sit back and wonder, you know, what, what is it that we did?

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Did we do everything, you know, correctly?

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Is there something that we could have done better?

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So I hope today in talking to you, I'll be able to reflect some of that in the context of what you're discussing, which is so important in terms of the UN at 80 years.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So let me start by speaking of the development work, because I spent of the 40 years, I spent 20 years in development primarily with UNDP.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And let me say that in 1976, when I started my career, it was in Jakarta, Indonesia.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And I remember going to the UNDP office and I was ushered into a meeting with the UN DP in Jakarta and the resident representative there introduced me.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And then he went on to introduce everyone else who was sitting around the table.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And he introduced me to someone who he said was the senior agricultural advisor and that was the representative from fao.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And then sitting next to him was the senior industrial advisor and that was the representative from unido, and then there was the UN Population advisor who was the representative of the UN FPA and so on.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We all worked in the Same building in Jakarta.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: There were two agencies, the ILO and the and UNESCO, that had their own offices and country representatives, but those representatives were also in that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: In that meeting.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And UNDP at the time was the central funding agency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And the meetings that we had there was very much anchored in national ownership of the UN program.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And we worked with the Indonesian Planning Agency with their national development plan to see how the UN could intervene and work with the government on certain aspects of the plan.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So it was the discussions were, you know, how much should go into agriculture, how much should go into, you know, manpower and, you know, setting up social safety nets in terms of Social Security administration, how much should we be supporting the national census that was going to be built there?

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It all came under one funding.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But I should also tell you that in the two years that I was in Indonesia, in the course of those two years, the senior agricultural advisor of FAO became the FAO country representative, and FAO set up a separate representation outside of those premises.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The same happened with unido, the same happened with unfpa.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: So this fragmentation that Guy Rider talked about, I witnessed that in the course.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And part of what I, you know, what I want to call attention to is that many countries then, you know, that central pooled funding or the central funding that was there for the country program of Indonesia got broken up and fragmented into direct funding to the agency programs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
