text: For the first time it showed a state sponsored actor using an AI model to conduct reconnaissance, exploitation and essentially to undertake the attack at scale with minimal human oversight.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The operational cost for adversaries has dropped while the speed and automation of the attacks has increased.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The UN is exposed.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Its digital environment is fragmented, it's unevenly secured and it's filled with sensitive political and humanitarian data.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The risks are theft and contamination of its knowledge systems, disruption of mission communications, and of course, erosion of trust in its analysis.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So what's a realistic UN response?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think that requires three actions as I close.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: One, the UN has to harden its systems.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It has to establish a single minimum security standard across the Secretariat funds and programs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And it has to focus on practical steps that reduce fragmentation in the UN's digital environment.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This is achievable with the SG's direction and your support financially in the fifth committee.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, it needs AI assisted threat detection.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And third, it needs support to Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The UN should offer simple, cost effective cyber resilience packages to LDCs and fragile states.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: These should include basic protection measures, guidance on secure digital services and help with incident response.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The UN cannot defend countries against every cyber threat, but it can raise the minimum level of security for those with the least resources.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I highly recommend this to the LDCs and other developing states.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In terms of its workforce implications and the realistic constraints.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We know that AI will transform global labor markets.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We know that it will transform education systems and industrial strategies.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: If the UN development system remains centered on project cycles and reporting, it will not meet what Member States need.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The UN will need more policy expertise in economics, education reform, labor market design, industrial transformation and digital governance that is aware and expert on AI.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And AI can support these experts with modeling and evidence synthesis.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The UN cannot compete with industry for elite AI engineers or cyber specialists, but it can bring in targeted expertise through second men's partnerships and short term consultancies.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It can also go further.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It can build a fellowship, something that we can call an AI core or some other name, which is a structured global fellowship program that would bring engineers, alignment researchers and cyber AI specialists into the UN for a period of time.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: They would work on secure architecture, digital public goods and knowledge systems.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In return, they gain exposure to context they would never otherwise encounter.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I meet so many young people who would love to work at the un.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Give them that opportunity in the AI realm and I'm sure some top talent will come for some period of time.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This model would be realistic if it's funded by member states, philanthropies and universities perhaps, and it supplements political and development staff rather than replacing them.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So in closing, what's a future ready AI?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In quick point form?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It treats knowledge infrastructure as core institutional infrastructure.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It automates rule based and repetitive workflows.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It protects political functions as entirely human.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It modernizes cybersecurity to confront AI enabled threats.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It adjusts workforce composition towards technical and analytical expertise.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It establishes a standing experimentation unit with the authority to test and iterate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It anchors regional pilots in Africa where most nexus contexts lie.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It publishes evidence on gains in search, retrieval speed, analysis time and decision speed.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In conclusion, AI will not solve political disagreements or compensate for unclear mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It will not replace diplomacy, conflict analysis or negotiation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But it can remove mechanical burdens that limit the UN's capacity to act.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It can expand the time available for human judgment which is at the heart of conflict prevention and crisis response.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It can harden the organizations against the new threat landscape and strengthen its service to member states.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think you have the chance to build a UN that can do all these things that I have spoken about and I encourage you in the working group to recommend a piloting of these approaches as soon as possible.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Measure the effect and scale what the evidence supports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thanks Martin.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: You've deeply thought about these issues and I really appreciate, and I'm sure Brian does too, the clarity of the recommendations you've put in front of us as well.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We'd now like to invite Ms. Amirah Hark, former United Nations Under Secretary General for the Department of Field Support Support, to provide an answer to a couple of questions that were in her field.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: One of those questions relates to how can system wide coordination mechanisms such as the ceb, un, sdg, IASC be used to improve coherent mandate implementation?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And the other question is what drives so many entities to spread themselves so thin across so many mandates?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And how can better coordination reduce competition for resources?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And of course you're also welcome to share any brief reactions to other questions posed.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The floor is yours.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In response to the first question, in terms of system wide coordination mechanisms, I mean, there is absolutely, I think, no debate whatsoever on the need for coordination mechanisms.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But I think where we need to investigate the time, the transactional costs that are incurred in these mechanisms is the key question.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So coordination mechanisms absolutely necessary at the level of CEB and the UNSDG and iasc.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But I think when Guy was speaking, I, you know, noted that in the implementation he had written that, you know, we need to focus constantly on improving people's lives.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And you know, I can, I can sort of think of if we start each one of these meetings, numerous meetings and other mechanisms that we have in terms of saying, is the time spent, is the time that we're going to spend on this meeting.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: What is the direct correlation of the time spent in this meeting to actually making an impact and improving someone's lives?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think, you know, that kind of cross sectional analysis is very good in terms of, you know, how much time are we spending, to what effect and what are the actual results.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The second thing with respect to these coordination mechanisms and which I observed in the field, particularly when I was in the field in these coordination roles, is that what is discussed and agreed at headquarters doesn't necessarily find its way down to the field representatives.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So sometimes we have a situation where I think headquarters and the policy level feels quite, you know, satisfied that yes, we have made these kind of agreements and, you know, certain policies are in place.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But I think when you go down to the field level, sometimes at the field, the same kind of discussions which have already been agreed to at headquarters are taking place at the field level.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So there is that duplicative nature and that the decisions of headquarters not being transmitted in, I would have to say, in a rather forceful way to representatives on the ground to adhere to what has already been agreed.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And so there is a lot of repetitiveness and there's a lot of time spent again at the field level.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The third in terms of coordination mechanism is also the host government's role that the UN does not do this coordination, whether it's at the CEB or the UNSDG or iasc in isolation it is working.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is in a host government.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And likewise there has to be a parallel mechanism at the host country level that accepts this.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So Guy made a very good example of Health and gavi.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But very often we would see that a ministry of, say, Maternal and Child Health doesn't necessarily, you know, adhere to something that has come from the planning ministry.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And so even at the host government level, there is sometimes a reluctance to come together, to assume a kind of coordination or a leadership maybe of one technical ministry.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So the UN in its coordination mechanisms has to have that translated at a host government, host nation level as well.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And that also proves one of the challenges of this system wide coordination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And the last point that I would make on this is that member states who are providing the funding are also, you know, I think, bear some responsibility in terms of this fragmentation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And, you know, I was struck by, by the number of grants that are below $1 million, because whether a grant is $1 million or below $1 million or $20 million or more, you know, the same level of administrative and other things, you know, Ambassador Kimani talked about, maybe AI can, you know, can take some of these, but, you know, it still requires the same amount of work because the accountabilities that are set in for a project or a program that is below $1 million is the same accountability of something that is $20 million.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So there again is where the transactional costs of these kinds of coordination mechanisms I think, have just gone way beyond, as I said, if we measure, what do all these levels of reports, meetings, discussions and everything else translate actually into improving people's lives?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So that is my few words on the system wide coordination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As I said, it is absolutely necessary, but I think it can be streamlined.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think it can be more disciplined.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think there can be more, you know, reaching out to both member states who are providing funding and to the host nations where we are working to also embrace and, you know, try and work within these mechanisms in their respective sides.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The second question was, what drives so many entities to spread themselves so thin across many mandates?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And how can better coordination reduce competition for resources?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And when I read that question, I said, you know, the answer is actually in the, in the question itself because all entities, all UN entities are competing for limited number, limited amount of resources.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And that is why sometimes if again, to take the example of the health sector, but, you know, it applies equally if someone is doing the implementation and the, you know, the procurement, for example, of vaccines and all the, you know, equipment and other things that are required for it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But if the, you know, the sort of the supply chain in terms of a policy within the government is not there, it's very difficult for the procurement to happen in isolation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And so what happens is there is a tendency then for someone who wants to make sure that the vaccines are implemented and that go right down to the deep field where all this is so essential, they automatically want to get involved also in the policy, in the funding.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So it's very difficult.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Even though we may have specializations, it's very difficult to kind of separate that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And the other thing that is so evident in the chart that was put up on the voluntary funding and the assessment funding is that, particularly when I was in the peacekeeping and peace operations, a lot of what came in the assist contributions should have been passed on to UN agencies who have the expertise and the experience and the knowledge of the country, you know, where they have been working for a long time.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And a lot could, could be done there.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It was, I think I mentioned that it was very, very difficult.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is very difficult still to have that kind of passage between voluntary and assessed fundings again, you know, with, with having the chapeau of is this improving people's lives.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But what happens is that we get into more thinking about silos and accountabilities and being able to deliver on something in order to be able to attract resources.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So again, here I feel there are responsibilities, and in this context, I would say more with member states who are providing the funding.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In the PC peacekeeping world that I was in, there was a total disconnect between those members of the foreign affairs ministries who were working to prepare the implementation and for example, the ministries of planning or development, and others who needed to look at early recovery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So sometimes we had, in different parts of the UN almost at the same time, resolutions of funding decisions that were taking that were, that were not coordinated within that member state itself.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I think that's where, you know, a lot of improvement in, within the coordination mechanisms and this ability to have each entity spread themselves so thin, thinking that, okay, if I have this in this program, it'll attract a little more money from this member state, because that's one of their country's priorities, too.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And so you kind of, you're fitting what you're going to do based on where you might align yourself with a member state's priorities, other than looking at, again, that central thing of improving people's lives where we are present.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So I think it's difficult to see one element of a mandate in isolation and also the accountability sometimes become very difficult.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I think that's why so many entities are spreading themselves thin just in order to be able to capitalize on the very limited resources that are available for this particular issue.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I'll leave it at that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you so much, Amira.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It's so helpful to be reminded of the realities on the ground, and so we've really appreciated having you as a briefer.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: That now brings us to the end of the briefers responding to your questions, and I pass the floor back to Ambassador Wallace.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you, Carolyn.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I now open the floor for Working Group members to share their views on mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We continue to look forward to hearing your ideas and proposals to make mandate implementation more efficient, effective and impactful.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As usual, delegations are asked to keep their interventions to five minutes for groups and three minutes for individual delegations, and I see already quite a number of delegations who are interested to speak, so we're going to ask you to be disciplined on maintaining the time.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I now give the floor to the distinguished representative of Iraq on behalf of the Group of 77 and China

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Excellencies Co Chairs. Good morning.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I have the honor to deliver this statement on behalf of the group of 77 and Chan at the House of the Group wishes to express its appreciation to the Co Chairs for convening this important discussion and for the informative briefing held on 30th October which provided valuable insights into this important topic.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Group further extends its gratitude to the panelists for their insightful presentations and valuable contributions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Group emphasizes that mandates achieve impact only through effective implementation, often requiring concerted efforts across multiple entities and areas of work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Reflecting the Organization's multidimensional and cross cutting nature, the Group reaffirms that the overarching goal of the UNAT Initiative is to make the United nations more agile, resilient and capable of delivering high quality and efficient services while eliminating redundancy and overlap in mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Group notes proposals for a common administrative platform and merging several of ongoing entities, departments, offices under the UNAT Initiative, emphasizing that any such process should enhance mandates implementation and service delivery while remaining fully guided by intergovernmental oversight and the authority of Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Group believes that the successful implementation of mandates requires translating general aspirations into specific, measurable outcomes with clearly defined objectives.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is therefore essential to engage closely with with the Secretariat, whose role should remain supportive in nature on the modalities of implementation while reaffirming the prerogative of Member States to define objectives and expected outcomes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs the Group recognized that artificial intelligence tools may offer advantages in identifying potential duplicative mandates and overlapping implementation across mandating bodies.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: However, their use must be approached with caution given risks related to privacy, security, and the sensitive nature of intergovernmental work, as well as concerns about accuracy and transparency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Any consideration of such tools should therefore ensure adequate safeguards and that budgetary implications remain imaginable in the current challenging financial context.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Group considers it important to receive comprehensive information on the intergovernmental bodies that have established and overseen the implementation of specific mandates, including updates on the status of implementation and the underlining reasons for any non or partial implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Such information would contribute to a clearer understanding of challenges and facilitate more informed discussions among Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Group also underscores the importance of ensuring that the Secretariat maintains a neutral and balanced role in mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is essential that all entities act strictly in accordance with mandates approved by Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Group further calls for mandate implementation to be measurable and supported by a system wide evaluation mechanism.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: A key component of this effort is the need to link mandate decisions with projected costs and to identify opportunities to enhance efficiency, coherence and accountability throughout the implementation process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs to conclude, the Group of 77 and China retreats a strong commitment to engage constructively in this process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We emphasize that discussions to mandate implementation or mandate implementation must remain inclusive, transparent and efficient, ensuring full oversight and participation by all Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the G77 and China.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor now to the European Union.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you, Mr. Co Chair and dear colleagues.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I delivered this statement on behalf of the EU and its Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The candidate countries, Turkey, North Macedonia, Montenegro, Ukraine, the Republic of Moldova, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Georgia, as well as Armenia, Monaco and San Marino, align themselves with this statement.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We thank the Co Chairs for your remarkable coordination of this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We also would like to thank the Secretariat for the responses provided and for issuing a structured action plan to further consolidate the work on UN80 and establish a system wide framework for action.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: On today's topic of mandate implementation, allow me to highlight the following three points to address the proliferation of meetings and reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The EU calls for a system wide review to reduce duplication and create efficiencies, limiting meetings and reports in number, length and frequency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Take for example the First Committee, which managed to finish its work earlier than scheduled this year.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We encourage the streamlining and rationalization of mandated meetings and reporting requests, as well as any measures aimed at reducing repetition across organs and bodies and resources.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We fully support the proposal to produce shorter reports and to combine them wherever possible.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In this regard, the work on revitalization of the General assembly and its Committee, as well as reform efforts across other bodies, takes on added significance.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: 2 We recognize that misaligned funding modalities and resource fragmentation constitute a serious challenge for the effective implementation of UN mandates, especially in times of liquidity crisis.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Therefore, we support granting flexibility to the Secretariat for the allocation of resources across programs and regions when justified by operational priorities or crisis, and following the implementation of accountability frameworks regulated by clear criteria.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The EU also underlines the importance of applying the mutual commitments as agreed in the Funding Compact to strengthen the predictability, quality and transparency of financial contributions and the third point on the division of labor among UN entities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This must be further clarified to avoid unnecessary duplication and functional overlaps.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: To enhance coordination and information exchange, we support the strategic use of resources through existing system wide coordination platforms and the enhancement of interagency coordination to effectively manage mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Also in the field, the integration of open, transparent and trustworthy use of AI into the mandate registry to showcase substantial similarities, potential duplications, risks and overlaps is also something that we support.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We also welcome the integration of digital technologies aimed at modernizing the UN system through shared data platforms, digital dashboards and analytics, paired with human oversight and clear accountability frameworks.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Lastly, we also support a more adaptive approach to mandate implementation, implementation based on agility, exchange of best practices and measurable impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Implementation plans should allow for adjustments in methods, timelines or resource allocation in response to evolving contexts and evidence of impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Dear Colleagues, the UN AD initiative demands more than compartmentalized efforts.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It requires an ambitious and truly system wide approach across the Secretariat, organs, committees, agencies and Member States in order to ensure that reform outputs directly translate into more coherent, cost effective, impactful and field responsive operations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Work streams may advance in parallel, but they are not isolated from one another and therefore we must make sure that they mutually inform each other.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We also encourage continuous coordination between our discussions on the mandate implementation review and other processes, including GA revitalization efforts, ongoing GA Committee work, and the review of working methods and information exchanges between the Secretariat and Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In their capacities as members of the Boards of agencies, funds and programs, the European Union and its Member States stand ready to continue to contribute constructively to the next steps and I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the European Union colleagues, I'm going to ask for your indulgence to allow me to use the Chair's prerogative to invite to depart from the group statements momentarily to allow our colleague Bob Ray of Canada to make what will be undoubtedly his actual final statement here before his actual imminent departure from New York.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I'm a little overwhelmed by the alacrity with which this has been done.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It really stems from a conversation that I had with Carolyn about her job and some of the challenges that we face.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And although I did give a farewell speech yesterday, this will be the last statement that I'll make.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I don't want to take anything away from James, who is going to be giving the joint statement on behalf of Cans, which is.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Provides in greater detail and much more substance what I'm.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: What I wanted to share with you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think we need to have the most honest dialogue we can about how this place works and doesn't work and what it's going to take to make it change.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I really just want to encourage everyone to try in conversation and in discussion as much as possible, to actually engage in conversation and dialogue about what we need to do in private conversation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I've noticed that everyone agrees that our work could be more productive, more pleasant and ultimately more impactful if we recognize that to a certain extent we're all caught up in simply doing a series of ritual activities which are there because they're ritual activities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Now, to those who say we've got to go back to the basics of the Charter, let me remind everyone the Charter doesn't actually tell us all the things we the structure of meetings, how long mandates last for, whether we can change mandates, whether we can simplify processes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: None of that is in the Charter.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It's simply in the operational side of our decision making, which we can change and which we are free to change.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Changing the Charter is very difficult.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Changing our methods of work should not be difficult.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: These are real time, real life decisions in the UN 80 process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The three pillars that have been set up.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: May produce some results, may produce some changes, but at the very least, we need to start from the premise that the reason we're having this conversation now in this way is because of money.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So if somebody says this has nothing to do with money, it has to do with money.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: If it wasn't for the cuts that have been imposed on us by our funders Member States, we wouldn't be going through the changes that we're being asked to consider.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The mandates exercise, in my opinion, and I offer it only as an opinion, is exceptionally important part of this exercise because it speaks to the extent to which we have turned the methods of work into a kind of iconography.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We worship at the altar of these ways in which we do things without regard to whether we can afford it or whether it's actually useful.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And that speaks to everything that we do with respect to the volume of work which we generate and which we then ask the Secretariat in turn to generate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I do not spend the day reading every report that's produced by the Secretariat and I would be very surprised if any of you did either.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Nor do any of us in reality take entirely at face value the extent to which our lives are dominated by a set of practices and rules which are arcane, outdated and could be changed.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And so I would encourage you to keep the faith in being as straightforward as possible in confronting the need for change.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I would encourage the co chairs to continue with their ambition of trying to create as much real discussion as possible on the changes that are in fact possible.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We are the prisoners of our own making, but we each have a key to break the lock.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We just have to have the courage to find the key and use it and not be afraid of the fact that across various geographical groupings, ideological groupings, other divisions which exist among us, there's actually more consensus among us about the changes that we could make if we wanted to make them.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So I'm not here to offer you a magic plan or to say you must do this or that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I'm only here to say that it's a mistake to think that this is another ritual exercise.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It's not.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
