session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As we say to each other, colleagues, Co chairs, I have the honor to deliver this statement on behalf of the Small States Group.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: A cross regional grouping of small states comprising both developed and developing countries and a list of 53 countries have aligned with the statement.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And for the sake of efficient time management, we will make available the list of countries later to the Co Chairs Co Chairs the mandates are essentially an expression of the will and priorities of Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Every mandate is a political commitment established with the expectation that it will be fully implemented.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Mandates should therefore be drafted in an informed and intentional manner and clearly articulated so that meaningful impact can be achieved through effective delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Allow me to make three points on how mandate implementation can be improved.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First, strong knowledge management and effective use of technology can play an important enabling role in successful mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Improved data systems will allow Member States and the Secretariat to better fulfill their respective roles in requesting for and implementing mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: For instance, enhanced data systems could include the capacity to view the status of mandate implementation and the entity that is responsible for implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Broadly speaking, the establishment of a comprehensive registry would inform users of areas for potential streamlining, which can then be tabled as proposals for consideration by Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: While the creation of a robust registry will require time and resources, it will be a powerful tool to reduce duplications.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, the creation and implementation of UN activities and reports would benefit from greater coordination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This is part of a necessary shift in mindset and culture.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We should seek to incentivise a stronger sense of shared ownership and collective responsibility over the mandate life cycle.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Member States should be open to new configurations of mandated products or modalities of mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The aim is to achieve mandated objectives through more efficient and measurable outcomes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As for reports, Member States should empower the Secretariat to produce more concise and useful reports, with a focus on content and analysis that contribute to impactful mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thirdly, the Secretariat and UN entities must address fragmentations in mandate delivery and strengthen internal coordination as an ongoing practice.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: These two entails a shift in organizational mindset and culture.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: A number of factors contribute to the problem of duplication and inefficiency, which include different parts of the system working in silos and competition for resources between agencies.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Stronger internal coordination and division of labor must be embedded as a matter of course in the process of mandate implementation and delivery management within the UN.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We note the Secretariat's proposal in the UN 80 Initiative Action Plan and welcome further efforts by the Secretariat to improve internal coordination and streamlining of mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs, small States have always been consistent supporters of the UN and the multilateral system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: At the same time, we are also among the most affected when the system becomes overburdened.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We reiterate our strong commitment to engaging constructively with all Member States and the Secretariat to ensure that the process of mandate implementation is more coordinated, accountable and efficient so as to meet our common objective of effective mandate delivery Co Chairs, Please allow me to make a few additional points in my national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First, I want to thank the briefers for their very insightful opening remarks.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I found them very useful and and I hope that this will give us additional material for reflection.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, I agree with our colleague from Liechtenstein that fundamentally, implementation has to be related to the question of how mandates are crafted in the first place.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The greater the clarity and specificity, the better it will be for all of us in terms of measuring and monitoring the implementation of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In this regard, I think there is a case to be made to look at the length of resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: A longer and more voluminous resolution does not necessarily make the mandate broader or deeper.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It may well end up providing very vague and confusing instructions or guidelines, not just to the Secretariat but also to other Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is worth thinking, in my view, of a standardized template for resolutions that States can use as a guide as they begin to craft mandates, especially for resolutions that are new.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Ultimately, of course, states would have the sovereign rights and the option to craft their own mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But I think it is time that we make the mindset mindset shift to look at shorter and more succinct resolutions, aided hopefully by the idea of a guiding of some guidelines or templates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The second point that I wanted to make in my national capacity has to do with the question of periodicity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This has come up quite regularly.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think we need to make a distinction between activity and accomplishment.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So the greater frequency of activity does not mean that we are accelerating accomplishment or mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We can adopt a resolution every six months.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: That does not mean that we are accelerating the implementation of a mandate or making a difference to improving people's lives in the field.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So that's the first point that I wanted to make with regard to this larger point about periodicity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, we need to make a distinction between an agenda item, a resolution or a draft decision, and reports of the UN Secretary General.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: An agenda item can be discussed annually, but a resolution need not be adopted annually.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And a report of the Secretary General, even if there is a request for such a report, need not be done annually.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So let me offer the example of the revitalization we have co chairs here present with us this morning.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We look at there's an agenda item on revitalization that is discussed annually, but the resolution is adopted biannually.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So it's entirely possible that an item is placed on the agenda, and that's the decision of the General Committee that looks at the list of the agenda item.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: An item is placed on the agenda possibly annually, but we don't need a resolution to be adopted annually.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It could be done biannually or triannually.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And we don't need a report of the SG on every agenda item on an annual basis.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It could be done biannually, triennially or even beyond.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So I really think the data presented by the Secretariat Under Secretary General Guy Ryder about how we spend 10% of our budget on writing reports is not just financially not sustainable.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is simply not possible for any of us to read all the reports that we ourselves demand.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So I hope to have further discussions with all Member States on these important issues.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Once again, thank you Co Chairs for your leadership.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Singapore.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor now to the Philippines on behalf of the middle Income countries.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I have the honor to speak on behalf of the Like Minded Group for Middle Income Countries or LMG Mix, composed of Armenia, Belarus, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Jamaica, Lebanon, Mexico, Morocco, Namibia, Panama, Peru, the Philippines and Uruguay.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As this is the first time that the Group is addressing this process, we wish to express our support and thank the Co Chairs for the consultations held thus far as well as the panelists for their insights.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs Middle income countries represent more than half of the UN membership, are home to more than 70% of the global population and contribute as the third of the global GDP.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Most of the world's poor, nearly 2/3 also reside within our countries.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Further, even countries that achieve graduation from LDCs to middle income status and those middle income countries that aim for high income status continue to face structural barriers on their paths to sustainable development and well being of their people.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It does needs to be emphasized that middle income countries are a group of countries facing specific challenges that need to be addressed and these realities should also inform the UN process including mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs allow me to highlight the following first, review of mandates across the UN system should be towards effectiveness and efficiency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We underscore the importance of the potential range and impact of mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, the LMG MIX has so far requested and mandated very few and very reasonable concrete deliverables from the UN system which are intended to create greater impact on the ground.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Group looks forward to the elaboration of an interagency system wide response plan for middle income countries and reiterates the call for the UN Sustainable Development Group to fill leadership gaps on mixed issues.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Third, the LMG MICS appreciates the continued support by DESA as well as its reporting functions and substantive contributions to the Intergovernmental processes on the agenda of middle income countries.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Fourth, the LMG mix supports advancing a pragmatic approach to delivering results.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Addressing the middle income trap through tailored support for middle income countries requires collaboration.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Hence the Group is pushing for a strategic plan of action for mics.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Lastly, this review process on mandate implementation should be geared towards accelerating efforts to fulfill unfinished business or those that are still in its very early stages of implementation, such as the system wide and increased support for middle income countries for a truly impactful outcome to benefit the vast majority of the world's population and ultimately all of us.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you Co Chairs and please be assured of our continued engagement in the process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank Philippines I give the floor now to the distinguished representative of Barbados on behalf of CARICOM

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I have the honor to deliver this statement on behalf of the 14 member states of the Caribbean Community and I align these remarks with a statement delivered by Iraq on behalf of the group of 77 and China at the outset.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We thank you for today's consultations and in particular for the insightful briefing on 30 October.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: That session offered a clear understanding of the practical realities within which mandate delivery takes place and has helped shape our contribution here today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I'd also like to extend our thanks to the Briefers for their valuable and in some cases thought provoking insights.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It's also worth noting, I think, Co Chairs colleagues, that yesterday's discussion in the General assembly on the revitalization of the General assembly highlighted the important convergence between that process and this process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We must use this convergence to generate synergies.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In discussing mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We are dealing with a stage of the mandate life cycle where Member State decisions must translate into coherent action.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This is where clarity, coordination and adequate resources matter the most.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: For small missions, including those small island developing States such as those of caricom, predictability in how mandates are carried out is essential to effective oversight and to our ability to participate meaningfully.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Across the breadth of the UN's work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: CO Chair's implementation occurs within a wide and complex institutional landscape.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The diversity of entities involved reflects the multidimensional character of global challenges, yet it can also result in uneven fragmented responsibilities in delivery and overlapping activities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: CARICOM sees merit in strengthening internal coordination and ensuring that roles are clearly communicated and understood.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: When entities work to their respective strengths, mandate delivery becomes more coherent, more efficient and ultimately more impactful.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We further recognize that reporting forms a significant part of implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Reports serve as a key tool for transparency and oversight and they must continue to provide Member States with information that is relevant, clear and analytically useful.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: CARICOM supports efforts that focus on enhancing the quality and value of reports while ensuring that any adjustments remain firmly rooted in intergovernmental guidance.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chair's colleagues Funding modalities also shape implementation in profound ways.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The continued reliance on highly earmarked voluntary contributions, combined with the limited flexibility of assessed resources creates challenges for planning and coherence.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: CARICOM reiterates a long standing principle mandates must be supported by resources that are predictable and proportionate to the tasks required.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Bridging the gap between expectations and available resources is fundamental to the credibility of the organization and to the confidence of Member States in this regard.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is critical also for CARICOM that the important and meaningful work being undertaken in the implementation of mandates in the field in our countries and regions and the capacity to do so sustainably does not fall victim to this exercise.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: What this stage of the discussion underscores is the importance of an organizational approach that promotes coherence, reduces unnecessary duplication and strengthens accountability.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: These are not technical issues alone as they go to the very core of how the United nations delivers on the priorities that Member States have collectively agreed.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs CARICOM remains committed to engaging constructively as we move through this process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Our interest is in a mandate implementation environment that is transparent, coordinative, coordinated and responsive one that respects intergovernment, the intergovernmental nature of the mandates while enabling the system to operate effectively and one that supports the ability of small delegations to follow and contribute to the work of the organization in a meaningful way.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We thank you Co Chairs for your continued leadership and look forward to contributing to the forthcoming discussions on Mandate review, completing our examination of the life cycle in a way that strengthens the ability of the UN to deliver for all and with your permission I would like to offer one brief comment in my national capacity and it connects to the points underlined in particular by former Undersecretary General Amirah Haq.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is Barbados View that we must pay particular attention in the framing of mandates to their on the ground in the field implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is here as she so powerfully underlined, that the lives of the people we represent can truly be touched.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank you Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank Barbados.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I now give the floor to the Solomon Islands on behalf of the pif.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I'm honored to speak on behalf of the Pacific Island Forum members based in New York.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We thank the Co Chairs for the helpful briefing on mandate implementation on 30th October and also for the briefest this morning The Unity Reform Initiative is an important opportunity to make the United nations more effective, efficient and accountable and better able meet today's challenges.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This is especially critical for small island developing states, including those in the Pacific, which depend heavily on the UN for support, expertise and development financing.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As others have said, how well we implement agreed mandates is a key measure of the UN's performance and of us as member states.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Unfortunately, current weaknesses in the mandate implementation, such as poor coordination, too many priorities and lack of restraint, are felt mostly strongly by seeds, including the Pacific Island Forum states.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The UN development system is fragmented and lacks coherence on the ground, which limits its ability to deliver for seats and makes it harder for us to access essential assistance.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs the growing number of resolutions, processes, meetings and report is challenging for all, but it can overwhelm smaller delegations who are supported by small policy teams in their capitals.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Fifth, missions are displeased about the recurring overlap between the work of the main committees.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: For example, earlier this week, on Wednesday, the General assembly plenary held a secret ballot to fill one vacancy at the International Court of Justice.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: At the same time, recorded votes were held both in the second and the fourth Committees.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We are mindful that overlaps can never be entirely prevented.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: However, it is extremely difficult for small delegations to be in three places at once.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: There are clear steps we can take to ease these burdens.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: One, we as Member States should be more disciplined in the meetings we mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Fewer, shorter and more focused meetings in core priorities should be outboard.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, we should only request reports when they serve a clear purpose and justify their cost.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Reports should be clear, concise and focused on the key information needed for decision making.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Pasig Island Forum countries are especially concerned about the fragmentation of activities and resources across the event system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We urge the Secretariat to continue improving coordination and coherence, especially in the field, so that scarce resources go to activities with real impact rather than duplicated programs or administrative overhead.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs Coordination mechanisms should strengthen UN impact, not add more bureaucracy.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Member states also have a role in reducing duplication and fragmentation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We encourage donors, UN entities and development partners to align their support with regional, national and local priorities and to work through existing plans and coordination mechanisms.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Finally, Co Chairs we join others in calling for more stable and flexible financing for the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Uncertainty around voluntary funding and rigid funding models make planning difficult, waste resources, and force UN leadership to spend more time fundraising than implementing mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The current liquidity crisis is also paralyzing mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We repeat our call for all Member States to pay their assist contributions on time in full and without conditions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We look forward to working closely with all members throughout this process and I thank you for Chairs, I thank the Solomon Islands.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I now give the floor to Kuwait.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: On behalf of the GCC Excellencies, Co Chairs and Distinguished Colleagues, I have the honor to deliver this statement on behalf of the Member States of the Gulf Cooperation Council, the gcc, the Kingdom of Bahrain, the Sultan of Oman, the State of Qatar, the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and my own country, the State of Kuwait.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The GCC aligns itself with the statement delivered by the Republic of Iraq on behalf of the Group of 77 and China Excellencies, let me begin by reiterating our appreciation to Jamaica and New Zealand, the Co Chairs of the Informal Ad Hoc Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As we approach the point of implementation of the mandate review, the responsibility entrusted in this process becomes ever more critical.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We would also like to express our gratitude to the panelists for their insightful briefings, perspectives and lessons learned.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We echo that the best practices cannot be underplayed to achieve the successful implementation of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The GCC believes that the Secretary General's initiative continues to be a timely and genuine opportunity to achieve qualitative transformations in the methods of work of the United nations, thus strengthening multilateralism and the overall efficiency in the functions of the un.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We reaffirm that the process of mandate review and the mechanisms for implementing the findings is imperative and must be conducted through careful assessment and with the highest degree of transparency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Excellencies we welcome the establishment of the UN Mandate Source Registry.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: While it is still in its beta version.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We emphasize that the website serves as a marked achievement in ensuring transparency and accessibility that truly feeds into more robust dialogue regarding mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We look forward to advancing the Registry to become a comprehensive source for Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We further encourage the utilization of technology in improving the accessibility of Member States to the Registry as well as providing relevant stakeholders with tools to enable their effective engagement with a large amount of data related to mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Excellencies, we emphasize the benefit of considering integrating an evaluation mechanism into the text of mandates during mandate design as that would enable relevant stakeholders to assess the different elements that would inform the next iteration of the mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We also see the importance of enabling Member States and the Secretariat with the necessary knowledge and capacities to fully engage with the design and creation of said mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Moreover, the process of negotiating and drafting falls to the established procedures, yet we consider it essential to provide the required skills for creating mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: To achieve the effective implementation and review of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: True engagement requires a full scope understanding of the material at hand.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: While the Designation of roles and functions can be left to establish practices and procedures in relation to the use of technology and specifically AI.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In the process of drafting mandate setting texts, it is crucial that the human element is preserved and takes precedence wherein the human element is the direct engagement of Member States and certified stakeholders.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: AI must be utilized as a tool to assist in our prerogatives, while data security and accuracy should remain at the forefront of any and all decisions taken.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In conclusion, the GCC reiterates the core principles of the Charter that the IHWG must be beholden to.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The process itself must always prioritize the inclusion and leadership of member states.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The UN 80 initiative and within all of its precepts is not a downsizing exercise, but an opportunity to increase efficiencies and streamline processes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you, your Excellencies.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank Kuwait.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor now to Australia.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: On behalf of Cairns.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you very much indeed, Chair.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I thank the briefers who've contributed this morning.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And let me just say thank you so much indeed, Bob, for your final remarks.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think the notion that we are indeed the masters of a fair degree of our own destiny and that we don't need to be prisoners of established processes really is the critical reflection we should take away from this morning.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I speak of course, on behalf of Canada, New Zealand and Australia.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And as the Secretary General states in the Mandate Implementation Review, mandate delivery is the basis on which Member States and the wider public assess the value of the United nations system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It's critical to the implementation of the United nations three pillars, and we need absolutely to get this process right.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Many of the recommendations on mandate delivery sit with the Secretariat and we encourage the Secretary General to implement these without delay.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But Member States must also play their part.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We must recognise that the United nations mandates and operating model have become unsustainable due to our own actions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: By mandating thousands of activities in multiple settings, we have left United nations entities spread too thin and promoted duplication and fragmentation of effort across the United nations system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And we have to recognize that that is in very much part our own responsibility.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We need to ensure that we're using UN resources in a coordinated and effective manner.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Firstly, we need to show restraint in the activities we mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This means being mindful of the costs associated with requesting reports, both commissioning new ones and continuing recurring ones, without clear justification.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And this point has already been made several times this morning.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We encourage the Secretariat to implement recommendations, to shorten reports, combine reports covering similar issues and explore alternative formats, to present information more concisely and to decrease the burden of reporting and improve overall accessibility.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We must also exercise restraint in mandating other activities that have resources.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Implications for the United nations budget and at a minimum, be clear on the implications, both monetary and staffing, of delivering the mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This includes the proliferation of high level meetings and the agreement to limit the number of such meetings due during High Level Week is a useful start, but we all know that we have started that many times before.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We suggest we next consider limiting the number of high level meetings, summits and conferences that are held throughout the year.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The forthcoming moratorium on new international days is another useful step, although every one of us in this room knows full well that there's a current rush to approve new ones before the moratorium comes into place.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Secondly, where mandates with financial implications are agreed, we need to ensure that the United nations has the financial means to implement it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And to this end, it's essential that Member States pay their assessed contributions in full, on time and without conditions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Our final point is on coherence and coordination, which is a shared responsibility between Member States and the Secretariat.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Member States need to take a more coherent approach in our engagement across different multilateral settings and be more aware when we are proposing a mandate that already exists creating duplication across the system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Secretariat also has a critical role to play in addressing duplication and fragmentation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We encourage the Secretary General to implement recommendations on enhanced strategic oversight and transparency over the United nations system to achieve a better division of labour and allocation of resources to deliver on mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We also need to strengthen Member State mechanisms for coordinating our work in the General Assembly.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Existing mechanisms such as the General Committee and the Committee on Program Coordination, they are not delivering.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We need an honest conversation about how we can do better.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Mr. Kamani's briefing this morning highlighted the problem of there being no shared implementation picture across the United Nations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And don't we know that well?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We need better centralised knowledge shared between the Secretariat and all Member States to enable us to to better track mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Achieving more coherent and integrated mandate delivery across the UN system needs to be a key criterion for considering proposals for structural reform and program realignment under Work Stream 3.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We want to see a clearer relationship between effective mandate delivery and any proposed structural reform to enable list.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Fundamentally, we want a modern, functional, forward looking organisation with the capacity to deliver high quality results.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And the above proposals, which cover both Member State and Secretariat responsibilities, in our view form a series of concrete actions that we can all take towards achieving this.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank Australia.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But since I have only three minutes, I'd like to accept the invitation that the distinguished Pierromene just made us to be, to change our own ways of doing things, including this meeting, and be as interactive as possible.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First of all, and this will be a bit disorganized, but trying to refer to the issue at hand, Brazil will be.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Will continue to be very open to considering all good ideas to achieve our collective goals in terms of gaining efficiencies, et cetera.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But at the same time, I think we should be very clear that there are risks along the way.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
