session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In light of the Secretary General's report and other briefings, I wish to share the following points.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First, internal coordination within the Secretariat should be strengthened.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Action Plan for advancing the UN 80 initiative submitted by the Secretary General will help ensure that the UN 80 initiative is implemented in a more substantive and effective manner which China fully supports the action plan, proposes measures to enhance senior management coordination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: China looks forward to detailed recommendations in this regard.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The UN system comprises more than 140 entities, each of which has its own areas of expertise.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We hope that all entities will focus on their core mandates, leverage their competitive strength, minimize duplication of efforts and make the best possible use of the limited resources.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, meetings and reports should be concrete and concise.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: There is a broad consensus on the need for the improvement of meetings and reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: China suggests we focus on the following three aspects.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First is to adopt a swift, proactive, programmatic and effective working style focusing on improving people's lives.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Meetings should start on time and statements and reports should go straight to the points and avoid lengthy and repetitive discussions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second is to enhance the quality of meetings and reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Secretariat has already proposed ideas such as adapting reports formats, enhanced data representation and focus on key issues.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We look forward to to detail the plans to translate these ideas into actions and practical proposals for improving meeting and report quality.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: At the same time, China stress that the importance and value of the UN's report it has provided tremendous insights to the governments, academias, NGOs across the board.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Third is to streamline the number of meetings and reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Secretariat has established a work package on Secretary General's reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We hope this mechanism will view review reports with similar content and release time and make specific recommendations for their streamlining.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Secretariat could also provide specific recommendations to Member States on combining meetings, shortening the length of meeting sessions and reducing reviews frequency with a view to achieving tangible results.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Third, on funding.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Voluntary contributions are an important supplement to the UN's work, but the assessed contributions are the foundation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As the second largest contributor to the UN regular budget, China has always actively fulfilled its financial obligations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We have already fully paid our assessed contributions this year, a total of US$680 million, and we will continue to firmly support the UN and multilateralism through concrete actions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: At the same time, we urge the largest contributor to fulfill its own financial obligations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank China for its statement.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor now to Chile and then Switzerland and then the Kingdom of the Netherlands.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you, Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Chile aligns itself with the statement delivered by Iraq on behalf of the group of 77 and China and with Philippines on behalf of MICS.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I also would like to express my appreciation to both of you, the Co Chairs for the organization of the latest briefing and to the panelists for sharing their experiences.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: An effective and coherent implementation of mandates across the United nations system is fundamental to ensuring that the organizations remain strong agile and credible.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: For this reason, the implementation stage of the mandate life cycle must be further reinforced and continuously improved.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Chile recognized the various challenges that persist during the mandate delivery phase of the life cycle, notably the risks of duplication, misaligned funding modalities, and the excessive volume and duration of meetings and reports, which often outweigh their actual impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As a former President of ecosoc, I would like to share an example from our work on the 2024 HLPF Ministerial Declaration, which one negotiated must be submitted in parallel to both the General assembly and ECOSOC for adoption in 2024.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The submission of an amendment to a vote in the HLPF and the subsequent adoption of the amendment declaration created a lack of clarity on the way forward, as previous practice suggested that the ECOSOC should consider two original text.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: After initially doing so and following extensive consultations, I ultimately decided to submit to ECOSOC the amended version of the Declaration in order to avoid ending up with two different versions of the same Ministerial Declaration.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This example illustrates how procedural arrangement can lead to duplications requiring additional time and resources to resolve matters that should ideally follow a streamlined process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The coordination segment of the ECOSOC itself is a good platform to strengthen the coordination capacity within the Sustainable Development Pillar.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The new ECOSOC revision should be coordinated with this work of this Working Group as well.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Another challenge lights in the current financial situation of the organization, which continues to erode the capacity of UN entities to fully implement the mandate entrusted to them.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: These entities face an increasingly difficult environment in this sense, as spending reduction targets further constrain their ability to execute their approved budgets.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Decisive and collective action is therefore needed to reverse this trend.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Let's turn the funding challenge into an opportunity because, as Brazil mentioned, because even if we had all the money available, we will still need to do this work the way we have been doing its it is losing meaning for the people we are meant to serve.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In conclusion, I would like to reiterate our support for the Co Chairs and reaffirm Chile's commitment to engaging constructively in the work of this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank Chile.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor to Switzerland and then the Netherlands.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs, colleagues, Switzerland thanks you for your continued leadership.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: During our tenure as an elected member of the UN Security Council, Switzerland led efforts to establish a resolution on the protection of humanitarian personnel.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: During the course of the consultation, we reached out to the Secretariat sharing wording suggestions and we were advised that in this particular instance it was preferred preferable to opt for a requirement of regular oral briefings of senior UN officials rather than a regular written report.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We took this on board and this helped us to devise the mandate accordingly and go into the direction of effective mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This example illustrates what previous briefings have shown in more detail, which is that well crafted mandates are key enablers for effective implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs allow me to make three points.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First, we would like to have clearer understanding of what the Secretary General can already do under his or her own authority, especially to improve delivery management.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: For example, in a quote, making better use of system wide coordination platforms to avoid duplication, end of quote, such as the Interagency Standing Committee or the CEBU are measures that we believe the SG can already act upon today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, regarding meetings and reports, Switzerland supports efforts to reduce their number.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Reports should be clearer, shorter, more focused and wherever feasible, reports could be combined.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We also encourage the use of different formats such as short update reports instead of lengthy annual documents.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In our own system, Swiss diplomats across the world have been instructed to privilege shorter reporting and analysis formats for their daily work, as opposed to more detailed reports at specific situations and for lesser frequency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: There is no doubt that we can learn and get inspiration from how the 192 other diplomatic representations and services represented here deal with these very same challenges of information overload, acceleration, limited staffing and so on.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Switzerland is also open to exploring technical solutions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Could artificial intelligence tool under human supervision be used to cross check reports for redundancies or provide cross references to related reports?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Given the successful experience of setting up the mandate Registry, how about improving the technical interface for reporting by creating an online space that allows for user friendly access to all participants products of existing mandates, taking into consideration multilingualism and accessibility for all.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Switzerland, including with our academic partners, stands ready to share its experience in this regard and we take good note of suggestions made earlier, including by Ambassador Kimani and others.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Third, and finally, real impact in mandate delivery depends on coordination and tapping into synergies.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Efficient mandate delivery requires entities to share knowledge and work hand in hand across UN hubs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Take human rights.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Human Rights Council in Geneva and the General assembly here in New York must operate in lockstep.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We gain valuable insights from the Council mandates implementation that are of relevance for our work here.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So let's break down silos not only thematically but also geographically.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thanks Switzerland.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor now to the Kingdom of the Netherlands, to be followed by Iran and Mexico.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you and dear co Chairs, I'd like to thank you for your leadership in conducting this intergovernmental process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We welcome the proposed solutions in The Secretary General's report on mandate implementation review.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I'm particularly happy to see USG Ryder here present in this debate the Kingdom of the Netherlands alliance itself with the Statement of the European Union.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I would like to add a few elements in my national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I would like to focus on three points with regard to recommendations put forward in the SG report.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First, regarding prioritization and streamlining meetings and reporting obligations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This requires a clear sense of direction, taking into account what a UN should look like in the future, taking into account the needs of future generations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In particular, we urge the Secretary General to act as swiftly as possible.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We consider these recommendations as low hanging fruit and necessary to execute.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Given the financial situation the organization is facing.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We would encourage the formulation of criteria on the basis of which meetings and reports could be prioritized and streamlined.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: These criteria in our view could include, for example, relevance and strategic alignment, impact and utilization, duplication and overlap, synergies and integration, potential cost and resource efficiency, legal and political feasibility and digital and procedural efficiency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Secondly, the SG's report contains interesting statistics on mandate delivery, management and coordination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And according to the report and the so called heat map, the risk of duplication in the development cluster is about 51%.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I think we all want to make sure that we increase the impact of our development assistance.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I think that this is a joint commitment that we share.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So it should not be a taboo to look at the way to talk about how we do that, how we make sure that we increase the impact by lowering the duplication.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And it would be helpful if the Secretary General could provide greater insight into the specific areas where duplication is actually occurring and where positive overlap is also taking place.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Third and last, we would be in favor of asking the Secretary General for recommendations on how to further optimize the functioning of existing bodies in coordinating performing the oversight role in the UN mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So, for example, we believe optimization could be found in better functioning and cooperation between the Committee of Programming and Coordination, the UN Sustainable Development Group, the UN System Chief Executives Board for Coordination, the Joint Inspection Unit, the coordination role of the ecosoc and most importantly with a strong two regional bodies and empowered Resident Coordinator system and reconfigured UN country teams.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank you for your attention.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished representative of the Netherlands and I now give the floor to the distinguished distinguished representative of Iran, to be followed by Mexico.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you, Madam Chair.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: At the outset we thank you for convening this meeting which provides an opportunity to exchange views on enhancing the delivery and coherence of United Nations Mandates the Islamic Republic of Iran aligns itself with the statement delivered by Iraq on behalf of Group 77 and China.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We recognize that the proposals on the demanded delivery aims at enhancing efficiency and effectiveness through streamlining the meetings and reporting process, make funding mechanism more impactful and less fragmentation and enhanced coherence and coordination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We attach great importance to ensuring that the implementation of mandates is fully aligned with nationally defined development priorities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Such alignment is essential to achieve tangible and sustainable results that respond to the realities and aspirations of Member States and offer greater likelihood of success in this regard.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We believe that the successful implementation of mandates must be accompanied by systematic investment in institutional and human capacity in developing countries.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Any reduction in resources could constrain training programs, capacity building initiatives and the transfer of technology, thereby weakening our collective ability to address global challenges effectively.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The role of regional and sub regional structures is also indispensable for ensuring responsiveness and inclusiveness in mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The preservation and adequate resourcing of regional commissions and field offices are vital to enable them to respond effectively to regional priorities and specific local contexts.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Downsizing or reducing staff in these offices would risk eroding institutional memory and limiting the ability of developing countries to access timely and equitable support from the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Further, we stressed that the Secretariat should maintain a neutral and balanced role in implementing mandates and supporting Member States in achieving their objectives.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We also underscore that the UN entities must operate within the parameters set by Member States, adhering strictly to intergovernmentally agreed language and avoiding any perception of Secretariat driven initiatives.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We believe this approach is essential for preserving the credibility and technical integrity of Secretariat's work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Finally, we encourage enhanced transparency and regular update on the status of mandate implementation, including clear explanations for any non or partial implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We believe that mandates should be treated fairly and for the benefit of the entire membership.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Comprehensive information sharing will enable Member States to identify gaps, improve coordination and ensure that the organization's work remains guided by the collective priorities of all members in an efficient and effective manner.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you, Madam Chair.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Iran.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I now give the floor to the distinguished representative of Mexico, to be followed by Argentina.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you for giving me the floor, Madam Chair.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Mexico expresses its gratitude to the Co Chairs for their dedicated leadership and reference its support for the proposals.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But forward in the Secretary's General Report, Co Chairs allow me to outline four proposals Mexico believes are relevant for our collective exchange on the implementation phase of the mandate life cycle.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First, breaking counterproductive practices.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Our long standing practice of layering new directions upon existing ones without allowing Time to fully implement or assess them has generated an accumulation of tasks, overlapping duplications and bottlenecks.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: A prudent cooling off period would enable mandates to be properly implemented before new decisions are introduced on the symptomatic area.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This will help restore coherence and prevent the continuous pileup of paragraphs, requests and reporting lines that ultimately hinder the purpose they seek to advance.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, a forward looking approach Implementation should not be conceived in isolation from evaluation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: A preventive system wide mindset, one that anticipates how a mandate will be assessed, must guide the design and implementation of activities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Ensuring alignment between objectives, indicators and institutional capacities is the only way to secure relevance, pertinence and meaningful impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: 3. Strengthening coherence Improving implementation requires system wide solutions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We propose developing a centralized and transparent architecture for mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: A dedicated implementation section in the UN Mandate Source Registry should be established to enhance accounting interpretability, prevent unintentional duplication and enable evidence based decision making.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It would allow identifying the responsible entity, expected deliverables, timelines, resource requirements and potential overlap with existing tasks.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: At the organizational level, the Committee on Program and Coordination CPC is the bridge between mandates and programs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is the institutional body specifically designed to ensure coherence and coordination during implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Strengthening and modernizing the CPC must be central component of the UN reform.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This requires elevating the level and quality of its deliberations and outcomes and enhancing its visibility according to its responsibility.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Fourth, and lastly, clarity and continuity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Persistent inconsistencies in the interpretation of mandates, combined with dispersed institutional memory and internal coordination across the system, have undermined coherent implementation among agencies.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The Secretariat should be equipped and authorized to provide formal system wide interpretative guidance on mandates, especially when discrepancies or ambiguities arise.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: A strengthened duty to warm Mechanism will be enabled to Secretariat to alert Member States when a mandate contradicts an existing instruction, exceeds available capacities or risk duplication.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank you, Madam Chair.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Mexico and I now give the floor to the distinguished representative of Argentina to be followed by ourselves.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Salvador, thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Good morning all Protocol observes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So allow me to share some inputs from our point of view and we will try to follow some of the items in the Secretary General's report on this.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So when it comes to proliferation of meetings and reports, we believe that this is an area we could have impactful changes immediately regarding the report proliferation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We agree that there is a report proliferation in terms of quantity and length.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This proliferation undermines also the quality of reports and we are supportive of the idea of Shorter reports that maintain a high quality, a level of high quality.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Many annual reports could be issued every two or three years.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Indeed, but there is no one size fits all on this we should assess the merit.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But also the different dynamics on the different UN bodies.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It's not the same dynamic in the Security Council, the ecosocial, the General assembly, even its committee have different dynamics.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And if we go to the whole UN system, I mean different governing bodies have different dynamics.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So it's a challenging process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Maybe to reduce the quantity of reports, the idea of joint reports could be explored among the several structures of the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Regional perspective could be also integrated in a single report.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And this idea of joint reports should not undermine the different views that the system might have on the same issue.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Also, reports by thematic clusters could be explored based on the work organization of each committee of the General assembly or in the dynamics of each body regarding meetings proliferation, we see this as a problem that within the UN system that we could resolve shortly if we have political will.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It's a collective responsibility, as we said, among Member states, but also among the Secretariat.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In our view, part of this problem of the proliferation of meeting is closely related to the over dimension and proliferation of certain political agendas within the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As we said before, we need a realistic diagnostic on this issue.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And it's not only a problem with the quality, with the quantity, but also with the quality of meetings, because in the long term dilutes the quality of interaction between Member states.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And we see also as part of this problem the proliferation of parallel meeting and processes or Secretary initiatives that do not have intergovernmental mandates that are also part of this proliferation meeting.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: When it comes to, I would say delivery, management and coordination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I mean, the issue of fragmentation, overlap, duplication, as has been said, is more a comprehensive discussion.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But the way maybe of citing mandates along the UN entities when it comes to program at budget is something that needs to be improved and revisit maybe also the discussion on the role of the cpc.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But we have seen in the reports that more than 20 entities are putting budget implications with the same mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So when we create a mandate, we should maybe evaluate a specific assignment for an entity to be the primary responsible for implementation, or maybe give to the Secretary General the prerogative to indicate which entity should coordinate that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And maybe when we set, when we give broad mandates or open mandates, I've seen many resolutions we request the UN system to do this.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Maybe that should be avoided because not only generates duplication and fragmentation, but also competition for resources and to finalize link this with the idea of funding.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I mean the discussion around funding.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We see this also a part of a link between some over dimension agendas, fragmentation of the UN system and funding modalities that at some point are in our view undermining the core mandate that the United nations should have.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank you,

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished representative of Argentina.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I now give the floor to the distinguished permanent representative of El Salvador, to be followed by Paraguay.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Madam Co Chair.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: My delegation align itself with the statements that were delivered previously by Iraq and the Philippines and in national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We would like to mention the following Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Mandate implementation, as we have been expressing before, is not an abstract notion.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It is actually the day to day, day to day work that translate the intergovernmental decisions into concrete impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So therefore, the efforts to strengthen efficiency, we believe that must not be equated with reducing programmatic ambition.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Rather, they should focus on refining the mechanisms, processes and also the resources necessary to ensure full and timely implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So efficiency must enhance delivery, not dilute the mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And in that sense, our delegation is really open to discuss some measures that have been previously expressed, like the length of the reports that we definitely agreed and also the discussion, periodic discussions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In the same manner.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Addressing fragmentation during implementation cannot be limited to a funding discussion.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: For us, it requires a serious examination of coordination across the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So fragmentation is often felt mostly in the field, where the overlaps and duplications can hinder coherence.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It can also complicate partnerships and reduce the quality of support provided to the governments.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And in that sense, an honest field based assessment of these dynamics is essential to improving the mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We are concerned by the competition for resource among entities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This is nothing new.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Other delegations have also mentioned and this should never compromise the quality, consistency and also the credibility of the UN presence on the ground.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And Member States have the responsibility to ensure that the system function precisely as a system, not as a collection of competing institutions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We emphasize that increased flexibility in redeploying resources can only be contemplated if delegations have a clear common understanding of its scope and also the limit limitations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So flexibility Co Chairs cannot become a substitute for proper oversight.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: It must operate strictly within the frameworks that safeguard full accountability.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So any discussions on optimizing restricting the existing structures must take into account the distinct mandates, working methods, timelines of entities, and also the headquarters in Vienna, Geneva and and idobi.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Because these differences matter.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Yes, they shape operational realities and therefore require a tailored and thoughtful consideration.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So close consultations with their secretariats is crucial.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: If we are to achieve coherence and also a comprehensive outcome.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs allow me to conclude with a simple through our biggest challenge do not come from lack of rules, but from lack of implementation and also a sustained engagement by Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And the reason why I'm saying this is if the agreements of the GA revitalization process were applied were rigor, we will not be debating mandate accumulation or work cycle pressure today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So these lessons must inform precisely the UN 80 initiative because when Member States engage seriously and follow through, the revitalization delivers true results.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So El Salvador definitely will continue supporting you Co Chairs and we support any approach that definitely delivers and change over current situation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think the distinguished Permanent Representative of El Salvador and I now give the floor to the distinguished Permanent Representative of Paraguay to be followed by the Russian Federation Couture.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Good morning to everyone.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: My delegation wishes to express its recognition, appreciation and full support for the work carried out by you both, Brian and Carolyn, as a co facilitator, we truly value your constructive efforts in this process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Turning to step two on Monday Delivery, we consider this discussion essential to strengthening the United nations capacity to deliver effectively and currently on hinge mandates, we took note of the three main challenges that continue to hinder mandate delivery and reduce our collective impact according to the Secretary General report.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First, we are really worried as a small mission, as many other delegations in this room, about the growing number of meeting and length reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We are really worried this situation has created an administrative burden that often outweigh the benefits.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Many reports are not only long but also repetitive and rarely consult to tackle.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This preparation is key and in that sense we suggest establishing a system that identifies which meeting reports at a greatest strategic value, suspend or merge those that are redundant and optimize report format with clear length limits.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Once again, we support the secure and responsible use of artificial intelligence to help summarize, translate and link related reports, making information more accessible and cost efficient.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, regarding the management of mandate delivery, stating that there is still a lack of clarity in how responsibilities are divided which lead to duplication and efficiency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: According to point number 41 of the report, existing oversight in the United nations system focuses mainly on program planning, budgets and operational issues of individual United nations entities in isolation, rather than seeking to ensure strategic alignment across the system to drive impact and efficiency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: To overcome this, we support the idea of having a centralized oversight mechanism within the Secretariat to monitor coherence across man mandates and we see value in establishing permanent interagency coordination platform to ensure better collaboration across entities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Third, with regard the misaligned funding modalities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We encourage the proposed solution to fully apply all commitments by Member States and the United nations system through the founding compact and strengthened dialogue.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: To this end couture, we need to be pragmatic and we believe this practical step could make mandate delivery more current, efficient and aligned with our shared vision of a stronger multilateral system, one that delivers real results for people and communities on the ground.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And finally, we wish to underline the need for greater and better better coordination with the Secretariat so that its perspective and concerns are heard and seriously considered.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Especially since the implementation of mandate relies heavily on their daily work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished Permanent Representative of Paraguay.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I now give the floor to the distinguished representative of the Russian Federation, to be followed by the United States.

text: United States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you, Madam Chair.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I would like to say that we support the practical steps to improve coordination and efficiency in the delivery of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Existing interagency platforms can be used more effectively to reduce duplication while respecting the independent and mandates of each entity and division of labor.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think a lot of delegations speak to this end today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: At the same time, Russia cannot agree with proposals that would expand the Secretariat's autonomy in prioritizing or streamlining mandated activities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Decisions of priority must remain with the Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Financial operational considerations cannot justify the modification, delay or non implementation of mandates adopted by intergovernmental organs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I would echo what Mr. Ray said about the money and this position.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: To all questions, the answer is money is as old as our Bible, the book of Ecclesiastes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But still we think that we should not allow, as they say, the tail wag the dog.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And the Member States have to finally determine what they want and then decide how to provide for it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We are concerned by suggestions to to shorten, merge or reprioritize mandated reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We totally agree we should have shorter resolutions, but we don't agree we should have shorter reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Reporting is essential accountability and transparency tool and must remain comprehensive, accurate and accessible.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Moreover, the UN 80 is an initiative which is a good opportunity to instruct the UN Secretary General to improve the quality of the Secretary General reports by addressing the issue of methodology of report preparation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In particular, we are very concerned about the sources of information which become, so to say, legitimized by the Secretary General reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And of course, these improvements must go hand in hand with enhanced methodology for the Secretariat's self evaluation of mandate delivery, which needs to be reflected.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And special attention should be given to the sources of information as well as separate review of mandates that are delivered at the cost of voluntary contributions, especially with the information that we have reconfirmed today by Guy Ryder by the amount of voluntary contributions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Proposals to align or redeploy resources internally without the approval of the General assembly would undermine the budgetary prerogatives of the member states.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Russia also stresses that we cannot support the reference in the Secretary General reports to the Resident Coordinator system as a successful tool of strengthening internal oversight of the UN division of labor.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think that there are a lot of challenges to this so called successes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished representative of the Russian Federation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I now give the floor to the distinguished representative of the United States to be followed by followed by Croatia.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you Co chairs and colleagues.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I'm inspired by the remarks of our distinguished colleague who's retiring, the permanent representative from Canada.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think his remarks were spot on and in the spirit of honoring that and being very inspired by what he said, I'm going to throw out most of what I wrote here because it's duplicative of what many of you, almost all of you have said here this morning.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Not everyone.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Some people like long reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Some people like overlapping mandates, Some people like spending money on paper in meetings instead of impact on the ground.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But I would say that if we took a poll amongst this room, reforming how we write and implement mandates would have more popularity than ice cream.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And ice cream is pretty popular.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So I'm going to throw out my remarks and make one general point and two specific points.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I submit.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We submit that efficient and effective delivery and measurable impact should be at the heart of everything we do in our work here at the United Nations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And it's worth noting that in 2024 alone we spent, the United nations spent $360 million on the direct costs, meetings and reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Let me repeat that in case it wasn't clear.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: $360 million not on maintaining and promoting international peace and security or providing life saving aid, but on meetings and reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And These reports are 40% longer than they were 20 years ago.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Now if anyone can show me that we are 40% more useful, insightful and actionable because of these reports, are we achieving better, faster or smarter decisions because of these 40% increase in the reports?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I'll buy dinner.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But I don't think you're going to be able to prove that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So this is great and I really appreciate the hard work and focus of the co chairs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We are fully, we the United States, stand ready to work with every member state and with the co Chairs who are focused on this most important and critical work But I would ask you, as you leave here today and get ready for a nice weekend, if we're all agreeing, or almost all of us are agreeing that this needs to happen, then let's make it happen.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We don't need four hour meetings and lots of talking in the halls.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Let's get this going and we stand ready to support and help Co Chairs in anything you need to put this into action.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you so much for your hard work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished representative of the United States and I now give the floor to the distinguished Representative of Croatia to be followed by Japan.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Implementation and we would also like to commend your leadership in steering this important process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Croatia aligns itself with the statement delivered by the European Union on behalf of its Member States and I would like to add a few remarks in my national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We welcome the continued focus on mandate implementation as noted in the previous meeting and reflected in the Secretary General's report on Stream 2.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Three key concerns the proliferation of meetings and reports, the inadequate management of mandate delivery and misaligned funding modalities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We share these concerns.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: However, we wish to emphasize that many of these issues stem from the way mandates are created.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As we stressed previously, mandates must be concise, clear and purpose driven to ensure effective implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Mandates should also be flexible enough to allow the Secretary General and the UN management to allocate responsibility to in the most efficient manner without micromanagement from Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In this period, we underline four key points.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First, clarity of scope and objectives.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Mandates should establish measurable goals aligned with strategic priorities to reduce overlap and sharpen focus.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: 2. Integrated delivery frameworks we support the SGE's proposal for common administrative platforms and consolidated functions to unify efforts and reduce fragmentation across UN entities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: 3. Enhanced field level Coordination Coordination must improve not only at the country level but also regionally to ensure mandates are context sensitive and impactful.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Data driven monitoring and robust metrics and real time reporting will support adaptive implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: 4. Flexible funding with accountability Member States should uphold the Funding Compact and enable the Secretariat to redeploy resources swiftly, especially to safeguard essential country level delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This flexibility must be paired with accountability and transparent justification.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In conclusion, effective mandate implementation begins with thoughtful mandate design.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: By ensuring mandates are strategic, streamlined and supported by flexible systems, we can empower the UN to deliver with greater coherence and impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished Representative of Croatia.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor now to Japan to be followed by Vietnam and Timor Lest.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you Co Chair and thank you Brief for their insightful and informative briefings.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Japan would like to make three comments regarding this mandate Delivery Phase first, we encourage the Secretary General to make full use of his authority as the Chief Administrative Officer to move forward on areas where action can be taken without delay in order to avoid duplication and ensuring strategic and coherent use of resources across the UN system.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Some of those concrete measures in this regard were mentioned in the SG report, so I don't repeat here.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, as for the actions requiring the approval by Member States, Japan welcomed concrete proposals such as streamlining meeting schedules and reducing the volume of reports, and we have already been and will continue to be flexible in accommodating the Secretariat's concrete proposal in this regard.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Finally, regarding the proposal on the flexible funding, we recognize the need for greater flexibility to respond to emergencies and unforeseen circumstances.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: At the same time, we wish to emphasize that it is necessary to examine whether the flexible funding proposal by the Secretariat will lead to improved efficiency in mandatory implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Furthermore, for voluntary contributions, alike assessed contributions, a high level of accountability to the Member States is required.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In other words, it is important to ensure that funding mechanism preserves the incentive for donor countries to make contributions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Therefore, we believe that such discussions should take place in existing forums involving the relevant Member States and UN entities, and we stand ready to continue participating them.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank you, I thank the distinguished representative of Japan.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor now to Vietnam to be followed by Timor Lest and then Saudi Arabia.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs, I I thank you for all your efforts and I thank also the briefers for the very nice presentations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Allow me to just make two points and both of them in fact are a bit related to money.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Number one is there's a narrative that the UN80 process is caused by or driven by the lack of money.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I beg to differ a bit because I believe that the need to change, the need for reform, is a constant desire that we have had for many, many years.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: An example is the Delivering as One initiative which has been piloted since 2007 in a set of seven countries.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And there are a lot that have been done and a lot that have changed and driven change.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So the current crisis may give us a stronger push, a sense of urgency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But I believe that this must remain a long term endeavor for all of us.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: After, after UN80, there will have to be UN90, UN100 and beyond.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So that's the first point I wanted to make.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, I wanted to emphasize and focus on funding.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We get what we fund.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The current situation is that funding is more short term than strategic, it creates more competition than coherence, and it is often in most Cases more driven by individual donor priorities rather than collective commitments.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Now my experience at the country level has been that, you know, when I ask for funding for certain activities, when it comes to gender equality, women, peace and security, there's plenty of that.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But if I ask for funding for a child rights event or an agricultural event, it's very hard to find the funding.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So it's not meeting the needs of the country where the UN is operating.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And it is because of the funding fragmentation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I really liked how the SG puts it in the report which says fragmentation and funding leads to fragmentation in implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I think it's critical that we change this pattern of funding.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We have to encourage more multi year unearmarked funding and it may be useful to revisit the role and the effectiveness of pooled funding mechanisms that we had in the past, including the MDG Fund, the Multi Partner Trust Fund, and also revisit the lessons learned from the various reform initiatives that we have had.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And finally, because we are talking about short term meetings, I encourage you to have a MIC cutoff enforcement in your upcoming meetings.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor now to Timur Leste followed by Saudi Arabia.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you Co Chair.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Just to be very brief, we commend your hard work and we share most of the opinions that actually being shared across this room.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Just want to make a few points from a programmatic standpoint and take into account the financial shortcomings.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I think we need to actually concentrate on certain programmatic issues when it comes to this reform apart from what has been said in the report of the the Secret General at first I think we need to look into the mandate cycle design, life cycle design.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, I think we need to actually also look into the coherence in terms of programmatic architecture, the issue of like merging and no repetition and so on.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
