text: And then the third point is on the operational alignment, particularly in the use of data driven systems, shared platforms and interoperable tools to elevate programmatic delivery rather than merely administrative efficiency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And then we also actually have to I think take into account the adaptive programming, particularly in terms of mandates and programs that have to be responsive and evolving with the evolving realities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And also looking into issues of capacity building, localization, particularly in the last developed countries.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In summary co chairs, just to comply with what my colleague from Vietnam has said, I mean the UN 80 program agenda is about doing things differently, differently.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So not simply doing the same things with less, but structuring programs so that they are coherent, outcome oriented, integrated, adaptable and designed for hanover it's about shifting from an organization where mandates accumulate to one where programs deliver and transition.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished Ambassador of Timor Leste and I'll give the floor to the distinguished PR of Saudi Arabia to be followed by Ecuador and then the UK

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Excellency is distinguished delegates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: My delegation alliance itself itself with the statements made by Iraq on behalf of the G77 and China and by Kuwait on behalf of the GCC Co chairs, we wish to express our sincere appreciation for your wise leadership in guiding the work of the informal ad hoc working group and for convening this meeting to consider the second phase of the mandate review cycle.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We also appreciate the efforts made in preparing in preparing the Secretary General's report on this matter, which provided a clear overview of the challenges in this era.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Along with a set of recommendations Co chairs, the report identifies major challenges hindering effective mandate implementation, including overlapping, excessive meetings and reports, procedural complexity and weak institutional coordination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In return, the report proposed set of solutions such as simplifying procedures, reducing duplication in meetings and reports and strengthening coordination among UN entities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In this context, we view the proposed recommendations positively and we would like to put forward a couple of practical measures to strengthening implementation of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: These measures include forming coordination team among UN agencies with similar mandates to develop joint implementation plans as well as streamlining meetings with similar topics.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Additionally, employing artificial intelligence to analyze reports and monitor commitments can help build an integrated database on the mandate's implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In conclusion, we wish to reiterate that the success of this second phase of the mandate review cycle depends on on a realistic and comprehensive approach that enhances the effectiveness of the UN system and delivers tangible results.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: My delegation reaffirmed its commitment to support efforts to develop practical mechanisms that strengthen mandate implementation and the objectives of the UN Charter.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished Permanent Representative of Saudi Arabia.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor to the distinguished PR of Ecuador.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And I thank the Cocheres for their leadership and their briefers for their insightful feedback.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I also value the Secretary General's proposals, especially those focused on streamlining reports and meetings, leveraging digital tools and enhancing internal coordination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Every resource saved should be redirected to concrete action.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Colleagues, within the allocated three minutes, allow me once again to briefly speak about my experience as President of the Executive Board of undp, UNFPA and unops.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: By the way, with some reluctance, but with final understanding of the rationale behind it, we managed to cut off the MIC after three minutes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: So feel free to do it with me if I exceed that time.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: There, in our Board, we have prioritized efficiency by reducing official sessions, improving coherence in decision making and generating savings that benefit the organization.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We have also worked to ensure that the decisions adopted by our Board are as coherent and implementable as possible and based on the Agency's mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Of note, this year, in my capacity as President of the Triple Board, I visited Panama, Jordan and Egypt where I observed the tangible impact of UN initiative initiatives from watershed management and refugee health services to climate adaptation and food security.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: These experiences convince me that our success is measured not by reports, but by real improvements in people's lives in some of the most challenging contexts.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Understanding operations on the ground helps identify synergies and prevent duplication, fostering complementarity rather than competition as we move forward and to improve mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: One of the goals of this exercise should be to identify and agree on practical ways to operationalize deeper collaboration across entities, including through shared back office functions, joint digital hubs and other integrated services.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We should also aim at strengthening the current oversight mechanisms in place.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: On funding we recognize that reliance on voluntary and earmarked contributions has increased fragmentation and limited strategic capacity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Predictable funding is essential.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Ultimately the our aim is not to do more with less, but to achieve greater efficiency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Modernizing our approach to maximize impact the challenge before us is on how to install a state of the art software on a heavy hardware.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished PR of Ecuador.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor now to the United States Kingdom and just before she takes the floor let me advise we do have a number of other requests for the floor so we will be reconvening at3.uk you have the floor.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you Co Chairs and thank you to Jamaica and New Zealand for your continued leadership of this ad hoc working group and for the transparency and inclusiveness of of the process that you're running.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The United Kingdom reaffirms our strong support for the UNAT Initiative and the Secretary General's efforts to promote coherence, efficiency and effectiveness across the UN's three core pillars.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As this Working Group considers principles that could apply to future mandates, we again underscore the need to set the bar high, ensuring we reduce duplication and free up resources to better deliver priorities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This will reduce the burden on all of us as Member States, but even more critically on the UN Secretariat if we improve the focus, specificity and timelines of mandates for the UN Secretariat, strengthening internal strategic coordination is essential to reducing duplication and enhancing delivery, ensuring work is assigned to the most appropriate entity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This could be led by EOSG working in coordination with the cpc and in that regard I want to build on questions and comments made by others around understanding the SG's authority in this space.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: On meetings and reports, much has been said, but from a UK perspective we support the streamlining of reports and meetings, including by reducing their length and frequency, as well as considering alternative formats.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: But procedural reforms have their limits.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Proliferation is best addressed at inception and this requires collective discipline for us as Member States when we're creating these mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Finally, on funding, adequate funding is critical to mandate implementation and as ever, this issue is best addressed by Member States paying assessed contributions in full and on time and without conditions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: With regards to voluntary funding, I was struck by USG Rider's slide around small grants and the administrative burden related to that and that point is well made and I think on pooled funding the UK is very much in support of pooled funding, specifically in the humanitarian space.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Finally, we welcome the recent issuance of the UNAT Work Plan and hope that this will help build the links between the three work strands.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the United Kingdom.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I give the floor to Cuba.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you Co Chairs, we appreciate this news opportunity to discuss proposals regarding the implementation of mandates under the UN 80 initiative.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Cuba aligns itself with the Declaration of Iraq on behalf of the Group of USD and China and would like to make the following observations in national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We emphasize that as stated in the follow up information to the consultation on October 30, decisions on which reports should be prioritized, combined or simplified must be studied on case by case basis, taking into account the level of political sensitivity and consequently the volume of information needed for the consideration of a given issue.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We also believe that the Unity Initiative is an opportunity to improve the report preparation process, including the review of information sources and other aspects that contribute to the reports providing a comprehensive reflection of reality.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Co Chairs, we recognize the need to advance in the search of efficiencies that will enable the entities to across the system to be in a better position to fulfill their mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: However, we do not favor the relocation of resources without the proper approval of the General Assembly.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: A clear definition of what it meant by reasonable justification is needed as granting in a given entity greater flexibility under such an ambiguous term could lead to arbitrary decisions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: In that case, the prerogative of Member States will be relegated.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Furthermore, we reiterate that we have doubts about how to approach these proposals given that the budget responds to a program plan previously defined by the Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you so much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you Cuba. I give the floor to the distinguished DPR of France, who will be the final speaker in the this morning's session.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Thank you Mr. Co Chair and all protocol observes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I'll do the short version of my speech and to add three remarks in complement of the European Union statement with which France aligns itself.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First, we fully support the implementation of leaner, clearer and more agile mandate delivery process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: This starts with the assignment of tasks.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We strongly encourage the Security Secretary General to designate a single lead entity for mandate implementation each time mandates allow it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Second, we need to frame our dialogue on mandate financing around increased responsibility and flexibility.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: As Member States, we have a double responsibility.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: First, to honor our financial commitments in time and in full, but second, to acknowledge that some mandates can actually be implemented within existing resources and some of them require additional resources.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: And on the second point, I think our discussions show that we need to have more regular exchanges with the Secretariat on the funding of mandates, and France would support exploring avenues for more flexible use of resources by the Secretariat in order to make the best possible use of the organization's workload absorption capacity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Third, and finally, France calls for an enhanced dialogue between Member States and the Secretariat on mandate results, performance and evaluation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: During a previous meeting and also today, USG Guy Rider shared insightful information on the organization's marginal costs for additional reports or additional meetings, which could provide a useful starting point in this regard.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Benchmarks with other international organizations could be mobilized, for example, for the presentations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Sorry, in the presentations by Secretary to this ad hoc working group and for example on AI in interpretation, which is widely used at the European Parliament or for some international conferences to end, France remains fully committed to supporting the Secretary General's drive forward on this important work stream.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: Tetra finances.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: I thank the distinguished DPR of France who was the last speaker in this session.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: We will resume at 3 to hear the remaining speakers.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 1
text: The meeting is adjourned.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Colleagues, can I ask you to take your seats as I call to order this meeting of the informal Ad hoc Working Group on Mandate Implementation Review.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We will resume where we Left off at 1 o' clock today with the remaining list of speakers, and I will begin by giving the floor to the representative of Costa Rica.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you very much.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Dear co facilitators, Co chairs, I'm sorry.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: It's great to see you coordinating our works and congratulations from my delegation for all the work you have done so far.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Excellencies, Dear distinguished colleagues, we are operating in a context of growing financial pressures that affect the predictability required for effective mandate delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: This reality underscores the need to strengthen responsible financing, governance and administration so that the United nations can continue to fulfill the mandates entrusted to it.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Mandate implementation is where credibility is tested.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Allow me to highlight three points and four possible step forwards.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: First, the reporting burden continues to expand, largely because we Member States continue to request new reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Costa Rica supports a careful review of periodicities, duplications and mandates whose reporting requirements may be no longer necessary.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: The goal is to improve the quality, usefulness and timeliness of reporting.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: While each committee has its own dynamics, more deliberate planning and sequencing of meeting time between bureaus and the Secretariat can support more effective workload management, acknowledging that only part of the cost structure is truly adjustable.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Second, a more coherent United nations requires stronger system wide coordination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Clarifying the division of labor on the basis of comparative advantage can reduce overlap and increase impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: For Costa Rica, this must be guided by transparent and more inclusive intergovernmental oversight across the UN system as a whole, particularly in the funds and programs and within the governance of their executive boards.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Coordination efforts should respect established governance arrangements while also identifying areas where those arrangements could be refined to support more coherent planning and delivery.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Third, mandate implementation, budgeting and liquidity are inseparable.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Persistent cash constraints require responsible forms of flexibility within existing governance frameworks.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Better internal reprogramming, a better a more strategic use of existing reserve and more coherent resource planning across related clusters can help sustain operations and reduce fragmentation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Pool or joint mechanisms may also help reduce structural competition for resources.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Looking ahead, Costa Rica supports first, a focused mandate implementation dialogue, a more comprehensive one and a continuous one.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Second, evidence based reviews of reporting cycles.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Third, assessments of the cost implications of different reporting and meeting models, modalities and fourth, an annual exchange with the Secretariat to better align mandates, capacities and resources.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Costa Rica remains committed to a United nations that is coherent, efficient and capable of delivering the results that the international community expects.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank Costa Rica.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I give the floor now to Indonesia and then we will have Germany, Algeria, Kyrgyzstan, Senegal and Norway.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Indonesia, you have the floor.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you. Co Chairs Indonesia extends appreciation to you for the inclusive, transparent and constructive engagement in the continuation of this process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We also thank all briefers for the responses and also for the presentation last week.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Today's discussion on mandate implementation is among the utmost importance of the overall process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: This is the point where decisions taken are translated into real change on the ground.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: It is where expectations must turn into action and where the true effectiveness of the United nations is ultimately measured.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Allow us to share our two key reflections on today's topic.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: First, on the design of the reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: From the last briefing, we noted a persistent pattern that a significant portion of reports are recurring, yet those do not always yield new or meaningful values.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Indonesia believes that future reports must shift from repetition to relevance and offering deeper insights in a more comprehensive and measurable way.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: In this regard, we are of the view that areas of improvement could be applied to the report designs, such as maintaining a similar structure of reports on targeted focus with updated contents in its issuance of reports, that this will enable us to track progress and identify gaps.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Meanwhile, emerging issues could be highlighted in a separate chapter with brief details.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Second, on the issue of overlapping mandate citations, while entities might cite similar mandates, a similar citation does not necessarily mean similar implementation in practice.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Entities may apply the same mandate to different regions, constituencies or operational contexts.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We therefore need a mechanism that traces the end use of these mandates, clarifying what activities are undertaken, where they occur and with what concrete impacts.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: The function parameters presented in the response to the last briefing, ranging from normative support and policy advice to data capacity building and service delivery, could be a starting point as practical tools to map complementarities and reduce unnecessary duplication.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Co Chairs to conclude, rest assured that Indonesia stands ready to engage constructively to ensure mandate implementation remains purposeful, coherent and impactful.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank Indonesia.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Give the floor now to Germany and then Algeria.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Co Chairs Colleagues, Germany fully aligns with the statement made by the EU this morning.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We thank you again, Co Chairs, for your leadership and for organizing the very insightful briefing on mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Building on what we learned from our great briefers, I would like to make three points in my national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: First, on reports and meetings.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: As others have already outlined, we also think that we need to address the proliferation of meetings and reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Since 1990, the amount of reports has increased by about 20%.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Why not, as a first step, cut the comparable 20% and get back to the level of 9090 when it comes to the amount of reports.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Secondly, on internal oversight, one important task is to address the poor division of labor within the UN system that can lead to duplication and also to the misallocation of funds.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We should strengthen the internal strategic planning and where appropriate, accompanied by independent internal and external oversight.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: The goal should be to ensure that UN entities only work on implementation of those mandates for which they have tangible comparative advantages and of course, in a well coordinated manner.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thirdly, and lastly, Co Chairs, let me make a broader point on the UNH spirit.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Germany very much appreciates the deliberations and the exchange in this Working Group under the able leadership of you, dear Co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: If we want the reform to be successful, we as Member States need to fully embrace the Unit spirit.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Also, outside this room and this Working Group, the current Committee season provides the perfect opportunity to do so.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: For instance, in the First Committee, France and Germany made some proposals how to make the work in that Committee more efficient.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Specific ideas include reduced time for statements and meetings and only submitting draft resolutions if there is a substantial change.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: That's just one example.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I'm sure other delegations and other committees might come up with even better and bolder ideas.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: But that kind of practical application could in turn feed back into this room and this Working Group.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: By that, we, the Member States, could fully embrace the UNAT spirit in our everyday Committee work and of course, continue our work here in the Working Group, aiming at high ambitious results under your leadership.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank Germany for its statement.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I give the floor now to Algeria, followed by Kyrgyzstan.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you for giving me the floor.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Algeria aligns itself with the statement delivered by Iraq on behalf of G77 and China and welcomes the opportunity to engage constructively in the ongoing discussions on unity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We share the collective aspiration for a United nations that is more coherent, more coordinated and more responsive.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: In this regard, we have taken note of proposals that could allow the Secretariat to set or adjust priorities on the basis of internal consideration.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We wish to reiterate that the strategic direction of the Organization is determined exclusively by Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Mandates, whether political, peacekeeping, humanitarian or development related, cannot be recalibrated due to financial constraints or operational pressures.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Their implementation is not discretionary, nor can it be delayed or reshaped outside of intergovernmental decisions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We also recognize the value of enhancing efficiency and fostering innovation in reporting and resolution making.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: However, these efforts must not weaken Member States ability to exercise their work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: What is required is improved analytical depth, clearer methodologies for the preparation of reports, more rigorous self evaluation by the Secretariat and increased transparency.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We need to make the best of the accumulated institutional knowledge that the organization has gathered through its 80 years of existence.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Furthermore, reforms that affect Africa must be undertaken in close consultation with African states, the African Union, and regional organizations that hold direct responsibilities in peace, security and development on the continent.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Inclusion and partnership are indispensable for a credible and sustainable reform process.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: In this regard, we caution against any measures that could negatively impact peace, security and development in Africa, and recall that the United nations bears a historical responsibility toward the continent, one that this reform process must uphold and strengthen, not depart from.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Finally, we underscore the importance of Excuse me, we underscore the importance of maintaining coherence across all UNH work streams.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Decisions taken in one area, whether structural, operational or budgetary, inevitably affect mandate implementation in others.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: To avoid fragmented or unintended outcomes, the process must be considered and managed holistically, with a full appreciation of its interdependences.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank Algeria for her statement.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I give the floor now to Kyrgyzstan and then Senegal.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you. Co Chairs Excellencies.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Let me begin by thanking the Co Chairs for convening this important meeting and for their continued efforts to advance the reform of the United Nations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Today, the United nations stand at a decisive moment.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: The UNAT reform must be more than an administrative exercise.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: It must help the organization act faster, work smarter and deliver better Results.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: With the UN system resources expected to decrease by almost 1/4 by 2026, we cannot afford excessive bureaucracy.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We must focus on what truly effective, coordinated and accountable implementation of mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Kyrgyzstan believes that the success of reform depends on our ability to to strengthen cooperation among UN aid entities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We need to reduce duplication, improve coordination, and ensure that every mandate has clear objectives and measurable impact.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: The UN should move from fragmented and parallel efforts toward a more integrated and complementary approach, especially across the peace, development and humanitarian pillars.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Financing remains a central challenge.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Kyrgyzstan supports proposals to better align new mandates with realistic financial resources.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Efficiency means not doing more with less, but doing better with what we have in a focused and measurable way.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We must also make reporting a tool for management, not bureaucracy.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Too many reports are rarely used.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We need shorter, more digital and analytical reports that help decision making and strengthen accountability.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Kyrgyzstan also wishes to highlight the situation of small and developing countries.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Many of us with limited staff and small permanent missions face challenges in following numerous meetings and processes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Full engagement of all member states, regardless of size or capacity, is essential for a fair and representative United Nations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: At the heart of these reforms must remain the human dimension.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: The real measure of UN success lies in its ability to prevent conflict, build peace and include people.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: In these efforts, we emphasize preventive diplomacy, regional cooperation and inclusive peace building that fully engage women and youth as agents of stability and resilience.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Co Chairs we stand at a historic crossroads.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: The choice is ours to remain constrained by outdated procedures or to rise as a force for decisive and principled actions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Kyrgyzstan calls and all Member States to show political will, vision and courage so that the unity reform becomes a true turnpoint leading to an organization that acts swiftly, clearly and in service of all people.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank Kyrgyzstan for the statement.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I give the floor now to Senegal to be followed by Norway.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you. Dear Co Chair Dear Co Chairs, the delegation of Senegal aligns itself with the statements delivered by Iraq and Singapore respectively on behalf of the G77 and China and a small States group and would like to share the following points on its national capacity.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: My delegation thanks the Under Secretary General Ryder for his constant engagement to ensure ownership of this process by Member States and commend you Co Chairs for your efforts to create this opportunity of information and dialogue.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: You can continue to count on our full support.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Firstly, my delegation encouraged efforts in terms of mandate monitoring tools, particularly the development of register of mandates, putting its and artificial intelligence to better contribution.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: This kind of registry should help us have that global perspective of existing mandates and of primary responsible entities with a view to identify obsolete or dormant mandates, overlaps or duplicates prior to the generation of new mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: This mandate inventory should also serve to a better identification of implementing bodies, clarification of the rules and mission of entities involved in the implementation of cross cutting mandates, assessment of necessary budgetary and human resources, as well as advancing possibilities for financing through existing budgetary lines.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: In current programs about financing, the payment of assets contribution in due time remains critical for well implemented mandates.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Nonetheless, this process can also nourish our reflections on how to defragment the resources available within the organization, including through the fungibility of voluntary contribution.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Secondly, in line with the steps taken through the United Nations General assembly resolution 793 to 7 on revitalization of the work of the General assembly, formulation of mandates should be strengthened through concise, action oriented and time bound resolutions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: This kind of approach shall form part of a revitalized coordination between the Secretariat mandated entities, Member State and other stakeholders with a view to discuss in a timely manner ways to create synergies between similar mandates and deciding on adjustments, mergers or elimination as appropriate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: In this respect, the review of periodicity, length and format of reports should be considered in a way to give sufficient and efficient time to stakeholders to implement the mandates to take stock of the difficulties of implementation and to provide prospects for improvement and amendments.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Finally, the issue of the implementation of mandates speaks to their cycle of life from creation to termination.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: One part of our challenge is also to give meaning to what that termination would be, whether through a plain and simple conclusion or through a form of continuation via another vehicle of action.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: By doing that, we will also help reconcile competing and overlapping lines of actions.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank the representative of Senegal for the statement.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I now give the floor to Norway, to be followed by Angola.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you coaches and thank you to the brief.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Before we before Norway takes the floor, I'd just like to say thank you to USG Rider who has to leave for another engagement with the Secretary General.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you so much for being here with us and I'll give the floor back to Norway.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you, thank you, thank you co chairs and thank you to the briefers for today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Norway particularly appreciates the clarity of the mandate delivery chapter on the SD report that informs our discussions today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Given that we're already into the afternoon session, I'll just focus on one particular aspect on reporting.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We strongly support the Secretary General's proposals and prerogatives to prioritise and streamline requests and mandates for reports or meetings, recognizing the urgent need to modernise how the UN designs, manages and delivers data and information.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: As we heard this morning, the current culture of extensive reports to documentation and frequent meetings consume significant resources both for those producing them and for us, the Member States that receive them.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: With more than half of all active mandates requiring reports, most of them recurring and unevenly read, we should use this as an opportunity to step back and rethink how we as Member States are best served in terms of information sharing and accountability.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Could we envision a future UN without formal reports instead of moving to digital systems, perhaps through an integrated UN digital platform?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: One offering a new kind of reporting with up to date multilingual access to visualized data which presents concise information and analysis rather than static written yearly updates?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Could it perhaps also provide a snapshot of progress made on mandate implementation, including associated budgets from across the UN system?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: A new kind of digital visualization of information and analysis could be a valuable tool to enable evidence based decision making when we come to mandate renewals and hopefully improve coordination across UN entities.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We welcome other concrete ideas that were presented by colleagues this morning, like the standard templates for drafting mandates as suggested by Singapore.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Or does it explore further ideas like cooling off periods for mandates as suggested by Mexico?

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We also, in closing, wanted to echo the comments from the UK this morning on the importance of core funding, another key challenge outlined in the SG's report.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Norway will expand on these ideas and others in our written inputs.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank Norway for your statement.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I give the floor now to Angola who is the last speaker on our list.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you Mr. Chair for giving this delegation the floor.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Co Chairs Angola appreciates the organizer and all contributors engaged in advancing this critical discussion.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Angola aligns with statement delivered by Iraq on behalf of G77/China and wish to emphasize the following.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We recognize the effective execution of the United nations mandates requires a robust coordination across all agencies and domains.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: The intercontinental nature of the organization responsibilities demands a comprehensive approach.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: The UN80 initiative aims to make the UN nimbler and more effective while reducing inefficiencies and overlappings in its operations.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Any reforms should ultimately serve the goal of better mandates implementation and service outcomes.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Respecting the decision making authority of Member States guided by transparent government, government led oversight, Excellencies and Co Chairs to turn commitments into real progress, we advocate for clear, measurable objectives and continuous dialogue with Secretariats.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Member States should steer the goal setting and assessment process with Secretariat providing supportive input rather than a directive role.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: While we see value in utilizing digital tools and artificial intelligence to identify inefficiencies, we stress the importance of applying these solutions judiciously and responsibly.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Safeguards are crucial to protect privacy, ensure accuracy and prevent costly errors, particularly under current budgetary constraints.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Angola also called for thorough and accessible information regarding which intergovernmental bodies are managing each mandate, along with regular updates on achievements and obstacles.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Transparency is vital to identify board necklace and driving evidence based improvements.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Finally, we insist that all entities adhere strictly to the mandates adopted by Member States, ensuring impartiality and compliance with agreed parameters.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Angola remains committed to participating transparently, inclusively and constructively in the mandate review, ensuring that United nations can meet the expectations of all its Member States.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I thank you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Thank you so much Angola.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We appreciate both your thoughtful intervention but also your patience in being the last speaker of today's session.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We started the conversation this morning with a call from one of our colleagues to have an honest conversation and dialogue.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: And I think from where we're sitting up here at the front, it felt not only honest and constructive, but also substantive.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: It's thoughtful.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: You're being collaborative and you're really thinking about space specific ideas you can put on the table.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: So thank you so much to all of you.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: I will just mention a couple of things that we've heard and of course we're Feeding in your thoughts all the time into our thoughts as well.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: But what we heard from a lot of you today was about the importance of improving the quality and the impact of our work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: That came through really strongly.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: A lot of you made a strong connection between the relationship between mandate creation and and mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: And there were calls by many of you to think about how we can do better when we create mandates, to make sure that implementation is more impactful.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: A lot of you have given really helpful suggestions about the practical tools and processes, templates, technology, knowledge management.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: This has all come through really clearly today that there seems to be a really large shared appetite to contemporise not only what we do, but the way we do our work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: A lot of you spoke about how the way we fund the organisation, finance the organisation, has an impact on implementation and others spoke to the activities that we choose to mandate.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: The vast array of Secretary General reports and meetings and so forth are in fact a trade off at times to practical delivery on the ground, especially in a resource constrained environment.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: So these were some of the things that I heard today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We will go away, as we always do, and think deeply and review all your inputs that you have made to us and to each other today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: But before adjourning, as we've previously announced, we just wanted to remind you that the next meeting of the Working Group will be a briefing on mandate review and that will take place on the 25th of November and then of course will be followed by the normal pattern of consultations on 3rd of December and with that that will complete, of course, this discovery phase of our work.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We will give you, as we always do, more information on the mandate implementation implementation briefing in due course.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We mentioned it earlier, but just to remind you again as well that we have that the President of the General assembly has scheduled an informal meeting of the General assembly on 11th of December for us to provide the General assembly, us as co chairs, to provide the General assembly with an update on the work and progress of the ad hoc, informal ad hoc working Group that will help us deliver against what we're required to do with the 15 December deadline, as was required in decision 79 571.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: Of course we remain here at your service.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: We're really happy if you come and contact us.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: You can do that directly and in person with us or with our teams.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: And of course you can do it in writing, including to the email address that we've provided to you earlier, including in the 12 November letter.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: So with that, again, just a warm thank you on behalf of my co chair and I, we think it was a really great session today.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: And the fact you stuck with us on a Friday afternoon shows your dedication.

session_title: Mandate Implementation consultations - Statements from members of the working group  Part 2
text: But with that, the meeting is adjourned.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I call to order the informal meeting of the Working Group to hear a technical briefing on mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We warmly welcome all of you to this technical briefing.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We recognise the presence of Mr. Guy Ryder, under Secretary General for Policy and chair of the UN 80 taskforce.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Mr. Locke Bahadur Thapa, Permanent Representative of Nepal to the United nations and President of the Economic and Social Council Ms. Inga Anderson, Executive Director of the United Nations Environment Program Ms. Ilse Branz Kheras, Assistant Secretary General for human rights and Ms. Claudia Bans, director of the Security Council Affairs Division.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Before handing the floor to our briefers, please, please allow me to deliver some opening remarks on behalf of the co Chairs.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We warmly thank Member States for your continued engagement in this important process.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The briefings we convened on mandate creation and implementation provided new important data analysis, information and real world examples to Working Group members.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Your questions to the briefers have so far unearthed further insights and your remarks at our two consultations have been thoughtful and have given us some good ideas that we have carefully noted.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We hope that today's briefing on mandate review will be just as fruitful.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Our briefers will discuss how UN mandates are reviewed across the UN system and how successful, coordinated and useful or not these are.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: They will of course also elaborate on the relationship between mandate creation, implementation and review from their perspectives.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: At our briefings and consultations, as well as in our meetings with Working Group members, we have consistently heard agreement among the membership that reform is urgently needed.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We are at risk of losing the confidence of both our publics and political decision makers.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And to build this back, we must restore the UN's ability to deliver across its its core mandates.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have heard about the clear through line between mandate creation and mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: But as you all know, and as many of you have mentioned in your statements, this should not be the end of the story.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Without any review mechanisms, we will not be able to accurately assess how we are delivering against the objectives we set ourselves, nor the impact our decisions have on the lives of our constituents.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The information and analysis that mandate reviews can uncover should play an important role in driving the work of this organisation.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Being able to deliver on our undertakings and course correct where necessary, will naturally strengthen the UN's legitimacy.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As we said last time, we have a responsibility to our citizens and to each other to implement the things we agree to here, the things our public expect of us to deliver for them and for others.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Equally, review mechanisms should allow us to see clearly where we have been successful.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: When we have completed our work, we should be able to retire mandates.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Indeed, ending Mandates in this way is maybe the highest measure of success.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We have certain parts of the system have experience in reviewing, recalibrating and completing mandates that we hope to learn from today.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: It is for this reason that we encourage working group members to keep an open mind to the analysis they hear today and to be ambitious in the ideas they bring in the coming weeks.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Without this, our ability to achieve change at the scale needed to improve mandate implementation may be compromised.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I now pass the floor to Ambassador Wallace to outline the way ahead and to introduce our briefers.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Good morning.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Today's briefing will be followed by consultations on 3 December, where working group members will again have the opportunity to offer their perspectives and ideas for consideration, as well as to ask further questions.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: We apologize for the short turnaround, but we trust in your understanding of the challenging timelines and constraints we face in this and other processes and remain confident that you are up to the task.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: As with our prior briefings, the briefers today have been selected for their experience with mandate implementation.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: They will present from different perspectives for us to all consider, and there will be an opportunity for questions from the floor once they have all presented.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Like all of us here today, they are invested in the good functioning of the UN.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: With that, I give the floor to Mr. Guy Ryder, under Secretary General for Policy and Chair of the UNAT Task Force.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Thank you very much indeed.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Ambassador Wallace, Ambassador Schwalger.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Good morning, Excellencies, ladies and gentlemen.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Well, thank you for this new opportunity to speak with you, to introduce the third stage of this mandate life cycle, the stage that we commonly refer to as the mandate review stage.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And perhaps just to situate this discussion in the overall context of this process, we could look at this when it's up.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Diagram of the mandate life cycle.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: I wonder if we can show it.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: Next one.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: There we are.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: This is just to remind us that we're in a mandate life cycle approach, which goes from the.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: The creation of mandates, how you adopt resolutions, the second stage of delivery, how the UN system implements mandates by turning them into activities to be undertaken across all pillars of the organization.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: That's the delivery phase.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
text: And then what we're coming on to now, crucially, the third phase, in which member states come back to look at whether the work that the UN system has undertaken is indeed achieving the results intended and whether mandates remain relevant or whether they need to be adjusted.

session_title: Mandate Review briefing - Panel followed by questions from members of the working group
